owl:Ontology.rdfs:comment: Added to SO during the immunology workshop, June 2007. This relationship was approved by Barry Smith.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: adjacent_to
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: A geometric operator, specified in Egenhofer 1989. Two features meet if they share a junction on the sequence. X adjacent_to Y iff X and Y share a boundary but do not overlap.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A geometric operator, specified in Egenhofer 1989. Two features meet if they share a junction on the sequence. X adjacent_to Y iff X and Y share a boundary but do not overlap.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: associated_with
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This relationship is vague and up for discussion.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: complete_evidence_for_feature
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: B is complete_evidence_for_feature A if the extent (5' and 3' boundaries) and internal boundaries of B fully support the extent and internal boundaries of A.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: If A is a feature with multiple regions such as a multi exon transcript, the supporting EST evidence is complete if each of the regions is supported by an equivalent region in B. Also there must be no extra regions in B that are not represented in A. This relationship was requested by jeltje on the SO term tracker. The thread for the discussion is available can be accessed via tracker ID:1917222.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: B is complete_evidence_for_feature A if the extent (5' and 3' boundaries) and internal boundaries of B fully support the extent and internal boundaries of A.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: connects_on
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Example: A splice_junction connects_on exon, exon, mature_transcript.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X connects_on Y, Z, R iff whenever Z is on a R, X is adjacent to a Y and adjacent to a Z.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X connects_on Y, Z, R iff whenever Z is on a R, X is adjacent to a Y and adjacent to a Z.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contained_by
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The inverse is contains. Example: intein contained_by immature_peptide_region.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X contained_by Y iff X starts after start of Y and X ends before end of Y.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X contained_by Y iff X starts after start of Y and X ends before end of Y.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: contains
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: The inverse of contained_by.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The inverse of contained_by.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: disconnected_from
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X is disconnected_from Y iff it is not the case that X overlaps Y.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X is disconnected_from Y iff it is not the case that X overlaps Y.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: evidence_for_feature
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: B is evidence_for_feature A, if an instance of B supports the existence of A.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: This relationship was requested by nlw on the SO term tracker. The thread for the discussion is available can be accessed via tracker ID:1917222.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: B is evidence_for_feature A, if an instance of B supports the existence of A.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: exemplar_of
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X is exemplar of Y if X is the best evidence for Y.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X is exemplar of Y if X is the best evidence for Y.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: finished_by
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: Xy is finished_by Y if Y part of X, and X and Y share a 3' boundary.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Xy is finished_by Y if Y part of X, and X and Y share a 3' boundary.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: finishes
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X finishes Y if X is part_of Y and X and Y share a 3' or C terminal boundary.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X finishes Y if X is part_of Y and X and Y share a 3' or C terminal boundary.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: gained
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation with which to annotate the changes in a variant sequence with respect to a reference.nFor example a variant transcript may gain a stop codon not present in the reference sequence.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X gained Y if X is a variant_of X' and Y part of X but not X'.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X gained Y if X is a variant_of X' and Y part of X but not X'.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has_integral_part
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X has_integral_part Y if and only if: X has_part Y and Y part_of X.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X has_integral_part Y if and only if: X has_part Y and Y part_of X.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has_part
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: Inverse of part_of.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Inverse of part_of.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: has_quality
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: The relationship between a feature and an attribute.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: integral_part_of
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X integral_part_of Y if and only if: X part_of Y and Y has_part X.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X integral_part_of Y if and only if: X part_of Y and Y has_part X.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: is_consecutive_sequence_of
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Example: region is consecutive_sequence of base.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: R is_consecutive_sequence_of R iff every instance of R is equivalent to a collection of instances of U:u1, u2, un, such that no pair of ux uy is overlapping and for all ux, it is adjacent to ux-1 and ux+1, with the exception of the initial and terminal u1,and un (which may be identical).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: R is_consecutive_sequence_of R iff every instance of R is equivalent to a collection of instances of U:u1, u2, un, such that no pair of ux uy is overlapping and for all ux, it is adjacent to ux-1 and ux+1, with the exception of the initial and terminal u1,and un (which may be identical).

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: lost
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A relation with which to annotate the changes in a variant sequence with respect to a reference.nFor example a variant transcript may have lost a stop codon present in the reference sequence.
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X lost Y if X is a variant_of X' and Y part of X' but not X.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X lost Y if X is a variant_of X' and Y part of X' but not X.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: maximally_overlaps
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: A maximally_overlaps X iff all parts of A (including A itself) overlap both A and Y.
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: Example: non_coding_region_of_exon maximally_overlaps the intersections of exon and UTR.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A maximally_overlaps X iff all parts of A (including A itself) overlap both A and Y.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: member_of
owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:comment: A subtype of part_of. Inverse is collection_of. Winston, M, Chaffin, R, Herrmann: A taxonomy of part-whole relations. Cognitive Science 1987, 11:417-444.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: non_functional_homolog_of
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: A relationship between a pseudogenic feature and its functional ancestor.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A relationship between a pseudogenic feature and its functional ancestor.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: overlaps
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X overlaps Y iff there exists some Z such that Z contained_by X and Z contained_by Y.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X overlaps Y iff there exists some Z such that Z contained_by X and Z contained_by Y.

owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X part_of Y if X is a subregion of Y.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X part_of Y if X is a subregion of Y.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: partial_evidence_for_feature
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: B is partial_evidence_for_feature A if the extent of B supports part_of but not all of A.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: B is partial_evidence_for_feature A if the extent of B supports part_of but not all of A.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: processed_from
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: Inverse of processed_into.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Inverse of processed_into.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: processed_into
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X is processed_into Y if a region X is modified to create Y.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X is processed_into Y if a region X is modified to create Y.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: started_by
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X is strted_by Y if Y is part_of X and X and Y share a 5' boundary.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X is strted_by Y if Y is part_of X and X and Y share a 5' boundary.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: starts
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X starts Y if X is part of Y, and A and Y share a 5' or N-terminal boundary.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X starts Y if X is part of Y, and A and Y share a 5' or N-terminal boundary.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: transcribed_from
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X is transcribed_from Y if X is synthesized from template Y.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X is transcribed_from Y if X is synthesized from template Y.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: transcribed_to
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: Inverse of transcribed_from.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Inverse of transcribed_from.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: translates_to
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: Inverse of translation _of.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Inverse of translation _of.

owl:ObjectProperty.rdfs:label: translation_of
owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: X is translation of Y if Y is translated by ribosome to create X.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: X is translation of Y if Y is translated by ribosome to create X.

owl:ObjectProperty.obo:def: A' is a variant (mutation) of A = definition every instance of A' is either an immediate mutation of some instance of A, or there is a chain of immediate mutation processes linking A' to some instance of A.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A' is a variant (mutation) of A = definition every instance of A' is either an immediate mutation of some instance of A, or there is a chain of immediate mutation processes linking A' to some instance of A.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: region
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_feature with an extent greater than zero. A nucleotide region is composed of bases and a polypeptide region is composed of amino acids.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_feature with an extent greater than zero. A nucleotide region is composed of bases and a polypeptide region is composed of amino acids.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_secondary_structure
owl:Class.obo:def: A folded sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A folded sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: G_quartet
owl:Class.obo:def: G-quartets are unusual nucleic acid structures consisting of a planar arrangement where each guanine is hydrogen bonded by hoogsteen pairing to another guanine in the quartet.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: G-quartets are unusual nucleic acid structures consisting of a planar arrangement where each guanine is hydrogen bonded by hoogsteen pairing to another guanine in the quartet.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: satellite_DNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The many tandem repeats (identical or related) of a short basic repeating unit; many have a base composition or other property different from the genome average that allows them to be separated from the bulk (main band) genomic DNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The many tandem repeats (identical or related) of a short basic repeating unit; many have a base composition or other property different from the genome average that allows them to be separated from the bulk (main band) genomic DNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: PCR_product
owl:Class.obo:def: A region amplified by a PCR reaction.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. This term is now located in OBI, with the following ID OBI_0000406.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region amplified by a PCR reaction.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: read_pair
owl:Class.obo:def: One of a pair of sequencing reads in which the two members of the pair are related by originating at either end of a clone insert.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: One of a pair of sequencing reads in which the two members of the pair are related by originating at either end of a clone insert.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: scRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: The primary transcript of any one of several small cytoplasmic RNA molecules present in the cytoplasm and sometimes nucleus of a Eukaryote.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The primary transcript of any one of several small cytoplasmic RNA molecules present in the cytoplasm and sometimes nucleus of a Eukaryote.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: scRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A small non coding RNA sequence, present in the cytoplasm.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small non coding RNA sequence, present in the cytoplasm.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: INR_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters required for the correct positioning of the polymerase for the start of transcription. Overlaps the TSS. The mammalian consensus sequence is YYAN(T|A)YY; the Drosophila consensus sequence is TCA(G|T)t(T|C). In each the A is at position +1 with respect to the TSS. Functionally similar to the TATA box element.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Binds TAF1, TAF2.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters required for the correct positioning of the polymerase for the start of transcription. Overlaps the TSS. The mammalian consensus sequence is YYAN(T|A)YY; the Drosophila consensus sequence is TCA(G|T)t(T|C). In each the A is at position +1 with respect to the TSS. Functionally similar to the TATA box element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DPE_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters; Positioned from +28 to +32 with respect to the TSS (+1). Experimental results suggest that the DPE acts in conjunction with the INR_motif to provide a binding site for TFIID in the absence of a TATA box to mediate transcription of TATA-less promoters. Consensus sequence (A|G)G(A|T)(C|T)(G|A|C).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Binds TAF6, TAF9.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters; Positioned from +28 to +32 with respect to the TSS (+1). Experimental results suggest that the DPE acts in conjunction with the INR_motif to provide a binding site for TFIID in the absence of a TATA box to mediate transcription of TATA-less promoters. Consensus sequence (A|G)G(A|T)(C|T)(G|A|C).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: BREu_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, located immediately upstream of some TATA box elements at -37 to -32 with respect to the TSS (+1). Consensus sequence is (G|C)(G|C)(G|A)CGCC. Binds TFIIB.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Binds TFIIB.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, located immediately upstream of some TATA box elements at -37 to -32 with respect to the TSS (+1). Consensus sequence is (G|C)(G|C)(G|A)CGCC. Binds TFIIB.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: PSE_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of the promoters of snRNA genes transcribed by RNA polymerase II or by RNA polymerase III. Located between -45 and -60 relative to the TSS. The human PSE_motif consensus sequence is TCACCNTNA(C|G)TNAAAAG(T|G).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of the promoters of snRNA genes transcribed by RNA polymerase II or by RNA polymerase III. Located between -45 and -60 relative to the TSS. The human PSE_motif consensus sequence is TCACCNTNA(C|G)TNAAAAG(T|G).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: linkage_group
owl:Class.obo:def: A group of loci that can be grouped in a linear order representing the different degrees of linkage among the genes concerned.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A group of loci that can be grouped in a linear order representing the different degrees of linkage among the genes concerned.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA_internal_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of double stranded RNA where the bases do not conform to WC base pairing. The loop is closed on both sides by canonical base pairing. If the interruption to base pairing occurs on one strand only, it is known as a bulge.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of double stranded RNA where the bases do not conform to WC base pairing. The loop is closed on both sides by canonical base pairing. If the interruption to base pairing occurs on one strand only, it is known as a bulge.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: asymmetric_RNA_internal_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: An internal RNA loop where one of the strands includes more bases than the corresponding region on the other strand.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An internal RNA loop where one of the strands includes more bases than the corresponding region on the other strand.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: A_minor_RNA_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A region forming a motif, composed of adenines, where the minor groove edges are inserted into the minor groove of another helix.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region forming a motif, composed of adenines, where the minor groove edges are inserted into the minor groove of another helix.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: K_turn_RNA_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: The kink turn (K-turn) is an RNA structural motif that creates a sharp (~120 degree) bend between two continuous helices.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The kink turn (K-turn) is an RNA structural motif that creates a sharp (~120 degree) bend between two continuous helices.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sarcin_like_RNA_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A loop in ribosomal RNA containing the sites of attack for ricin and sarcin.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A loop in ribosomal RNA containing the sites of attack for ricin and sarcin.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: symmetric_RNA_internal_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: An internal RNA loop where the extent of the loop on both stands is the same size.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An internal RNA loop where the extent of the loop on both stands is the same size.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: WC_base_pair
owl:Class.obo:def: The canonical base pair, where two bases interact via WC edges, with glycosidic bonds oriented cis relative to the axis of orientation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The canonical base pair, where two bases interact via WC edges, with glycosidic bonds oriented cis relative to the axis of orientation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sugar_edge_base_pair
owl:Class.obo:def: A type of non-canonical base-pairing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A type of non-canonical base-pairing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: aptamer
owl:Class.obo:def: DNA or RNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA or RNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA_aptamer
owl:Class.obo:def: DNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA_aptamer
owl:Class.obo:def: RNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: RNA molecules that have been selected from random pools based on their ability to bind other molecules.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: morpholino_oligo
owl:Class.obo:def: Morpholino oligos are synthesized from four different Morpholino subunits, each of which contains one of the four genetic bases (A, C, G, T) linked to a 6-membered morpholine ring. Eighteen to 25 subunits of these four subunit types are joined in a specific order by non-ionic phosphorodiamidate intersubunit linkages to give a Morpholino.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Morpholino oligos are synthesized from four different Morpholino subunits, each of which contains one of the four genetic bases (A, C, G, T) linked to a 6-membered morpholine ring. Eighteen to 25 subunits of these four subunit types are joined in a specific order by non-ionic phosphorodiamidate intersubunit linkages to give a Morpholino.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: riboswitch
owl:Class.obo:def: A riboswitch is a part of an mRNA that can act as a direct sensor of small molecules to control their own expression. A riboswitch is a cis element in the 5' end of an mRNA, that acts as a direct sensor of metabolites.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A riboswitch is a part of an mRNA that can act as a direct sensor of small molecules to control their own expression. A riboswitch is a cis element in the 5' end of an mRNA, that acts as a direct sensor of metabolites.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: matrix_attachment_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA region that is required for the binding of chromatin to the nuclear matrix.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA region that is required for the binding of chromatin to the nuclear matrix.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: locus_control_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA region that includes DNAse hypersensitive sites located 5' to a gene that confers the high-level, position-independent, and copy number-dependent expression to that gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA region that includes DNAse hypersensitive sites located 5' to a gene that confers the high-level, position-independent, and copy number-dependent expression to that gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: match_set
owl:Class.obo:def: A collection of match parts.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A collection of match parts.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: match_part
owl:Class.obo:def: A part of a match, for example an hsp from blast is a match_part.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A part of a match, for example an hsp from blast is a match_part.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: genomic_clone
owl:Class.obo:def: A clone of a DNA region of a genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A clone of a DNA region of a genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_operation
owl:Class.obo:def: An operation that can be applied to a sequence, that results in a change.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An operation that can be applied to a sequence, that results in a change.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudogene_attribute
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute of a pseudogene (SO:0000336).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute of a pseudogene (SO:0000336).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: processed_pseudogene
owl:Class.obo:def: A pseudogene where by an mRNA was retrotransposed. The mRNA sequence is transcribed back into the genome, lacking introns and promoters, but often including a polyA tail.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Please not the synonym R psi M uses the spelled out form of the greek letter.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A pseudogene where by an mRNA was retrotransposed. The mRNA sequence is transcribed back into the genome, lacking introns and promoters, but often including a polyA tail.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudogene_by_unequal_crossing_over
owl:Class.obo:def: A pseudogene caused by unequal crossing over at recombination.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A pseudogene caused by unequal crossing over at recombination.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: delete
owl:Class.obo:def: To remove a subsection of sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: To remove a subsection of sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insert
owl:Class.obo:def: To insert a subsection of sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: To insert a subsection of sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: invert
owl:Class.obo:def: To invert a subsection of sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: To invert a subsection of sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: substitute
owl:Class.obo:def: To substitute a subsection of sequence for another.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: To substitute a subsection of sequence for another.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: translocate
owl:Class.obo:def: To translocate a subsection of sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: To translocate a subsection of sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_part
owl:Class.obo:def: A part of a gene, that has no other route in the ontology back to region. This concept is necessary for logical inference as these parts must have the properties of region. It also allows us to associate all the parts of genes with a gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A part of a gene, that has no other route in the ontology back to region. This concept is necessary for logical inference as these parts must have the properties of region. It also allows us to associate all the parts of genes with a gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: probe
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA sequence used experimentally to detect the presence or absence of a complementary nucleic acid.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA sequence used experimentally to detect the presence or absence of a complementary nucleic acid.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_regulatory_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant_effect which changes the regulatory region of a gene.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variant_effect which changes the regulatory region of a gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: aneuploid
owl:Class.obo:def: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: hyperploid
owl:Class.obo:def: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number as extra chromosomes are present.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number as extra chromosomes are present.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: hypoploid
owl:Class.obo:def: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number as some chromosomes are missing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number as some chromosomes are missing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: operator
owl:Class.obo:def: A regulatory element of an operon to which activators or repressors bind thereby effecting translation of genes in that operon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regulatory element of an operon to which activators or repressors bind thereby effecting translation of genes in that operon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nuclease_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A binding site that, of a nucleotide molecule, that interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues of a nuclease.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A binding site that, of a nucleotide molecule, that interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues of a nuclease.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: compound_chromosome_arm
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: FLAG - this term is should probably be a part of rather than an is_a.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: restriction_enzyme_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A binding site that, in the nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues of a restriction enzyme.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A region of a molecule that binds to a restriction enzyme.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A binding site that, in the nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues of a restriction enzyme.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: deficient_intrachromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby a translocation in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby a translocation in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: deficient_interchromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a translocation in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a translocation in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_by_transcript_attribute
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This classes of attributes was added by MA to allow the broad description of genes based on qualities of the transcript(s). A product of SO meeting 2004.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: free_chromosome_arm
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome structure variation whereby an arm exists as an individual chromosome element.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome structure variation whereby an arm exists as an individual chromosome element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: overlapping
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a gene that has a sequence that overlaps the sequence of another gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a gene that has a sequence that overlaps the sequence of another gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inside_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inside_intron_antiparallel
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene and on the opposite strand.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene and on the opposite strand.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inside_intron_parallel
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene and on the same strand.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a gene when it is located within the intron of another gene and on the same strand.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_three_prime_overlap
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a gene when the five prime region overlaps with another gene's 3' region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a gene when the five prime region overlaps with another gene's 3' region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_five_prime_overlap
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a gene when the five prime region overlaps with another gene's five prime region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a gene when the five prime region overlaps with another gene's five prime region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_three_prime_overlap
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a gene when the 3' region overlaps with another gene's 3' region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a gene when the 3' region overlaps with another gene's 3' region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_five_prime_overlap
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a gene when the 3' region overlaps with another gene's 5' region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a gene when the 3' region overlaps with another gene's 5' region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: antisense
owl:Class.obo:def: A region sequence that is complementary to a sequence of messenger RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region sequence that is complementary to a sequence of messenger RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polycistronic_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript that is polycistronic.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript that is polycistronic.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: dicistronic_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript that is dicistronic.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript that is dicistronic.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nuclear_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from nuclear sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from nuclear sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mt_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene located in mitochondrial sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene located in mitochondrial sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: kinetoplast_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene located in kinetoplast sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene located in kinetoplast sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: plastid_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from plastid sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from plastid sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: apicoplast_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from apicoplast sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from apicoplast sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ct_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from chloroplast sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from chloroplast sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromoplast_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from chromoplast_sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from chromoplast_sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cyanelle_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from cyanelle sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from cyanelle sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: leucoplast_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A plastid gene from leucoplast sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A plastid gene from leucoplast sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: proplastid_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from proplastid sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from proplastid sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nucleomorph_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from nucleomorph sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from nucleomorph sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: plasmid_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from plasmid sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from plasmid sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: proviral_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene from proviral sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene from proviral sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: endogenous_retroviral_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A proviral gene with origin endogenous retrovirus.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A proviral gene with origin endogenous retrovirus.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transposable_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A transposon or insertion sequence. An element that can insert in a variety of DNA sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transposon or insertion sequence. An element that can insert in a variety of DNA sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: expressed_sequence_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match to an EST or cDNA sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match to an EST or cDNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: clone_insert_end
owl:Class.obo:def: The end of the clone insert.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The end of the clone insert.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence of amino acids linked by peptide bonds which may lack appreciable tertiary structure and may not be liable to irreversible denaturation.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology. The term 'protein' was merged with 'polypeptide'. Although 'protein' was a sequence_attribute and therefore meant to describe the quality rather than an actual feature, it was being used erroneously. It is replaced by 'peptidyl' as the polymer attribute.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence of amino acids linked by peptide bonds which may lack appreciable tertiary structure and may not be liable to irreversible denaturation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosome_arm
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of the chromosome between the centromere and the telomere. Human chromosomes have two arms, the p arm (short) and the q arm (long) which are separated from each other by the centromere.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of the chromosome between the centromere and the telomere. Human chromosomes have two arms, the p arm (short) and the q arm (long) which are separated from each other by the centromere.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_with_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: An mRNA with a frameshift.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An mRNA with a frameshift.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_obs
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant is a non exact copy of a sequence_feature or genome exhibiting one or more sequence_alteration.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variant is a non exact copy of a sequence_feature or genome exhibiting one or more sequence_alteration.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_feature
owl:Class.obo:def: Any extent of continuous biological sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Any extent of continuous biological sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transposable_element_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene encoded within a transposable element. For example gag, int, env and pol are the transposable element genes of the TY element in yeast.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene encoded within a transposable element. For example gag, int, env and pol are the transposable element genes of the TY element in yeast.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: primer
owl:Class.obo:def: An oligo to which new deoxyribonucleotides can be added by DNA polymerase.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An oligo to which new deoxyribonucleotides can be added by DNA polymerase.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: proviral_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A viral sequence which has integrated into a host genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A viral sequence which has integrated into a host genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: methylated_cytosine
owl:Class.obo:def: A methylated deoxy-cytosine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A methylated deoxy-cytosine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: edited
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence that is modified by editing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence that is modified by editing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript_with_translational_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript with a translational frameshift.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript with a translational frameshift.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regulated
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a sequence that is regulated.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a sequence that is regulated.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: protein_coding_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript that, at least in part, encodes one or more proteins.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: May contain introns.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript that, at least in part, encodes one or more proteins.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: forward_primer
owl:Class.obo:def: A single stranded oligo used for polymerase chain reaction.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A single stranded oligo used for polymerase chain reaction.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA_sequence_secondary_structure
owl:Class.obo:def: A folded RNA sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A folded RNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcriptionally_regulated
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated at transcription.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: By:<protein_id>.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated at transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcriptionally_constitutive
owl:Class.obo:def: Expressed in relatively constant amounts without regard to cellular environmental conditions such as the concentration of a particular substrate.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Expressed in relatively constant amounts without regard to cellular environmental conditions such as the concentration of a particular substrate.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcriptionally_induced
owl:Class.obo:def: An inducer molecule is required for transcription to occur.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An inducer molecule is required for transcription to occur.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcriptionally_repressed
owl:Class.obo:def: A repressor molecule is required for transcription to stop.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A repressor molecule is required for transcription to stop.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: silenced_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is silenced.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is silenced.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_silenced_by_DNA_modification
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is silenced by DNA modification.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is silenced by DNA modification.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_silenced_by_DNA_methylation
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is silenced by DNA methylation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is silenced by DNA methylation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: post_translationally_regulated
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated after it has been translated.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated after it has been translated.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: translationally_regulated
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated as it is translated.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a gene that is regulated as it is translated.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: reverse_primer
owl:Class.obo:def: A single stranded oligo used for polymerase chain reaction.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A single stranded oligo used for polymerase chain reaction.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: epigenetically_modified
owl:Class.obo:def: This attribute describes a gene where heritable changes other than those in the DNA sequence occur. These changes include: modification to the DNA (such as DNA methylation, the covalent modification of cytosine), and post-translational modification of histones.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: This attribute describes a gene where heritable changes other than those in the DNA sequence occur. These changes include: modification to the DNA (such as DNA methylation, the covalent modification of cytosine), and post-translational modification of histones.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: genomically_imprinted
owl:Class.obo:def: Imprinted genes are epigenetically modified genes that are expressed monoallelically according to their parent of origin.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Imprinted genes are epigenetically modified genes that are expressed monoallelically according to their parent of origin.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: maternally_imprinted
owl:Class.obo:def: The maternal copy of the gene is modified, rendering it transcriptionally silent.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The maternal copy of the gene is modified, rendering it transcriptionally silent.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: paternally_imprinted
owl:Class.obo:def: The paternal copy of the gene is modified, rendering it transcriptionally silent.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The paternal copy of the gene is modified, rendering it transcriptionally silent.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: allelically_excluded
owl:Class.obo:def: Allelic exclusion is a process occurring in diploid organisms, where a gene is inactivated and not expressed in that cell.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Examples are x-inactivation and immunoglobulin formation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Allelic exclusion is a process occurring in diploid organisms, where a gene is inactivated and not expressed in that cell.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_rearranged_at_DNA_level
owl:Class.obo:def: An epigenetically modified gene, rearranged at the DNA level.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An epigenetically modified gene, rearranged at the DNA level.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ribosome_entry_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Region in mRNA where ribosome assembles.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Region in mRNA where ribosome assembles.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: attenuator
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence segment located within the five prime end of an mRNA that causes premature termination of translation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence segment located within the five prime end of an mRNA that causes premature termination of translation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: terminator
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence of DNA located either at the end of the transcript that causes RNA polymerase to terminate transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence of DNA located either at the end of the transcript that causes RNA polymerase to terminate transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA_sequence_secondary_structure
owl:Class.obo:def: A folded DNA sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A folded DNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: assembly_component
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of known length which may be used to manufacture a longer region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of known length which may be used to manufacture a longer region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: recoded_codon
owl:Class.obo:def: A codon that has been redefined at translation. The redefinition may be as a result of translational bypass, translational frameshifting or stop codon readthrough.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A codon that has been redefined at translation. The redefinition may be as a result of translational bypass, translational frameshifting or stop codon readthrough.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: capped
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing when a sequence, usually an mRNA is capped by the addition of a modified guanine nucleotide at the 5' end.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing when a sequence, usually an mRNA is capped by the addition of a modified guanine nucleotide at the 5' end.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: exon
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of the transcript sequence within a gene which is not removed from the primary RNA transcript by RNA splicing.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of the transcript sequence within a gene which is not removed from the primary RNA transcript by RNA splicing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: supercontig
owl:Class.obo:def: One or more contigs that have been ordered and oriented using end-read information. Contains gaps that are filled with N's.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: One or more contigs that have been ordered and oriented using end-read information. Contains gaps that are filled with N's.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: contig
owl:Class.obo:def: A contiguous sequence derived from sequence assembly. Has no gaps, but may contain N's from unavailable bases.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A contiguous sequence derived from sequence assembly. Has no gaps, but may contain N's from unavailable bases.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: read
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence obtained from a single sequencing experiment. Typically a read is produced when a base calling program interprets information from a chromatogram trace file produced from a sequencing machine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence obtained from a single sequencing experiment. Typically a read is produced when a base calling program interprets information from a chromatogram trace file produced from a sequencing machine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: clone
owl:Class.obo:def: A piece of DNA that has been inserted in a vector so that it can be propagated in a host bacterium or some other organism.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A piece of DNA that has been inserted in a vector so that it can be propagated in a host bacterium or some other organism.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: YAC
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.
owl:Class.obo:def: Yeast Artificial Chromosome, a vector constructed from the telomeric, centromeric, and replication origin sequences needed for replication in yeast cells.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Yeast Artificial Chromosome, a vector constructed from the telomeric, centromeric, and replication origin sequences needed for replication in yeast cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: BAC
owl:Class.obo:def: Bacterial Artificial Chromosome, a cloning vector that can be propagated as mini-chromosomes in a bacterial host.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Bacterial Artificial Chromosome, a cloning vector that can be propagated as mini-chromosomes in a bacterial host.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: PAC
owl:Class.obo:def: The P1-derived artificial chromosome are DNA constructs that are derived from the DNA of P1 bacteriophage. They can carry large amounts (about 100-300 kilobases) of other sequences for a variety of bioengineering purposes. It is one type of vector used to clone DNA fragments (100- to 300-kb insert size; average, 150 kb) in Escherichia coli cells.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology. Drosophila melanogaster PACs carry an average insert size of 80 kb. The library represents a 6-fold coverage of the genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The P1-derived artificial chromosome are DNA constructs that are derived from the DNA of P1 bacteriophage. They can carry large amounts (about 100-300 kilobases) of other sequences for a variety of bioengineering purposes. It is one type of vector used to clone DNA fragments (100- to 300-kb insert size; average, 150 kb) in Escherichia coli cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: plasmid
owl:Class.obo:def: A self replicating, using the hosts cellular machinery, often circular nucleic acid molecule that is distinct from a chromosome in the organism.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A self replicating, using the hosts cellular machinery, often circular nucleic acid molecule that is distinct from a chromosome in the organism.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cosmid
owl:Class.obo:def: A cloning vector that is a hybrid of lambda phages and a plasmid that can be propagated as a plasmid or packaged as a phage,since they retain the lambda cos sites.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Paper: vans GA et al. High efficiency vectors for cosmid microcloning and genomic analysis. Gene 1989; 79(1):9-20. This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cloning vector that is a hybrid of lambda phages and a plasmid that can be propagated as a plasmid or packaged as a phage,since they retain the lambda cos sites.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: phagemid
owl:Class.obo:def: "A plasmid which carries within its sequence a bacteriophage replication origin. When the host bacterium is infected with \"helper\" phage, a phagemid is replicated along with the phage DNA and packaged into phage capsids." [SO:ma]

owl:Class.rdfs:label: fosmid
owl:Class.obo:def: A cloning vector that utilizes the E. coli F factor.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Birren BW et al. A human chromosome 22 fosmid resource: mapping and analysis of 96 clones. Genomics 1996.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cloning vector that utilizes the E. coli F factor.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: deletion
owl:Class.obo:def: The point at which one or more contiguous nucleotides were excised.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The point at which one or more contiguous nucleotides were excised.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: lambda_clone
owl:Class.obo:def: A linear clone derived from lambda bacteriophage. The genes involved in the lysogenic pathway are removed from the from the viral DNA. Up to 25 kb of foreign DNA can then be inserted into the lambda genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A linear clone derived from lambda bacteriophage. The genes involved in the lysogenic pathway are removed from the from the viral DNA. Up to 25 kb of foreign DNA can then be inserted into the lambda genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: methylated_adenine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified base in which adenine has been methylated.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified base in which adenine has been methylated.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Consensus region of primary transcript bordering junction of splicing. A region that overlaps exactly 2 base and adjacent_to splice_junction.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: With spliceosomal introns, the splice sites bind the spliceosomal machinery.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Consensus region of primary transcript bordering junction of splicing. A region that overlaps exactly 2 base and adjacent_to splice_junction.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_cis_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Intronic 2 bp region bordering the exon, at the 5' edge of the intron. A splice_site that is downstream_adjacent_to exon and starts intron.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Intronic 2 bp region bordering the exon, at the 5' edge of the intron. A splice_site that is downstream_adjacent_to exon and starts intron.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_cis_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Intronic 2 bp region bordering the exon, at the 3' edge of the intron. A splice_site that is upstream_adjacent_to exon and finishes intron.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Intronic 2 bp region bordering the exon, at the 3' edge of the intron. A splice_site that is upstream_adjacent_to exon and finishes intron.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: enhancer
owl:Class.obo:def: A cis-acting sequence that increases the utilization of (some) eukaryotic promoters, and can function in either orientation and in any location (upstream or downstream) relative to the promoter.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An enhancer may participate in an enhanceosome GO:0034206. A protein-DNA complex formed by the association of a distinct set of general and specific transcription factors with a region of enhancer DNA. The cooperative assembly of an enhanceosome confers specificity of transcriptional regulation. This comment is a place holder should we start to make cross products with GO.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cis-acting sequence that increases the utilization of (some) eukaryotic promoters, and can function in either orientation and in any location (upstream or downstream) relative to the promoter.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: enhancer_bound_by_factor
owl:Class.obo:def: An enhancer bound by a factor.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An enhancer bound by a factor.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A regulatory_region composed of the TSS(s) and binding sites for TF_complexes of the basal transcription machinery.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology. The region on a DNA molecule involved in RNA polymerase binding to initiate transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regulatory_region composed of the TSS(s) and binding sites for TF_complexes of the basal transcription machinery.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: restriction_enzyme_cut_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A specific nucleotide sequence of DNA at or near which a particular restriction enzyme cuts the DNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A specific nucleotide sequence of DNA at or near which a particular restriction enzyme cuts the DNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNApol_I_promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase I binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase I binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNApol_II_promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase II binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase II binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNApol_III_promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase III binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA sequence in eukaryotic DNA to which RNA polymerase III binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CAAT_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: Part of a conserved sequence located about 75-bp upstream of the start point of eukaryotic transcription units which may be involved in RNA polymerase binding; consensus=GG(C|T)CAATCT.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Part of a conserved sequence located about 75-bp upstream of the start point of eukaryotic transcription units which may be involved in RNA polymerase binding; consensus=GG(C|T)CAATCT.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: GC_rich_promoter_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved GC-rich region located upstream of the start point of eukaryotic transcription units which may occur in multiple copies or in either orientation; consensus=GGGCGG.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved GC-rich region located upstream of the start point of eukaryotic transcription units which may occur in multiple copies or in either orientation; consensus=GGGCGG.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TATA_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved AT-rich septamer found about 25-bp before the start point of many eukaryotic RNA polymerase II transcript units; may be involved in positioning the enzyme for correct initiation; consensus=TATA(A|T)A(A|T).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Binds TBP.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved AT-rich septamer found about 25-bp before the start point of many eukaryotic RNA polymerase II transcript units; may be involved in positioning the enzyme for correct initiation; consensus=TATA(A|T)A(A|T).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: minus_10_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved region about 10-bp upstream of the start point of bacterial transcription units which may be involved in binding RNA polymerase; consensus=TAtAaT. This region is associated with sigma factor 70.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved region about 10-bp upstream of the start point of bacterial transcription units which may be involved in binding RNA polymerase; consensus=TAtAaT. This region is associated with sigma factor 70.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: minus_35_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved hexamer about 35-bp upstream of the start point of bacterial transcription units; consensus=TTGACa or TGTTGACA. This region is associated with sigma factor 70.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved hexamer about 35-bp upstream of the start point of bacterial transcription units; consensus=TTGACa or TGTTGACA. This region is associated with sigma factor 70.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cross_genome_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A nucleotide match against a sequence from another organism.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A nucleotide match against a sequence from another organism.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: operon
owl:Class.obo:def: A group of contiguous genes transcribed as a single (polycistronic) mRNA from a single regulatory region.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A group of contiguous genes transcribed as a single (polycistronic) mRNA from a single regulatory region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: clone_insert_start
owl:Class.obo:def: The start of the clone insert.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The start of the clone insert.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: retrotransposon
owl:Class.obo:def: A transposable element that is incorporated into a chromosome by a mechanism that requires reverse transcriptase.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transposable element that is incorporated into a chromosome by a mechanism that requires reverse transcriptase.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: translated_nucleotide_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match against a translated sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match against a translated sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA_transposon
owl:Class.obo:def: A transposon where the mechanism of transposition is via a DNA intermediate.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transposon where the mechanism of transposition is via a DNA intermediate.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_transcribed_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of the gene which is not transcribed.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of the gene which is not transcribed.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U2_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: A major type of spliceosomal intron spliced by the U2 spliceosome, that includes U1, U2, U4/U6 and U5 snRNAs.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: May have either GT-AG or AT-AG 5' and 3' boundaries.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A major type of spliceosomal intron spliced by the U2 spliceosome, that includes U1, U2, U4/U6 and U5 snRNAs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript that in its initial state requires modification to be functional.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript that in its initial state requires modification to be functional.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: LTR_retrotransposon
owl:Class.obo:def: A retrotransposon flanked by long terminal repeat sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A retrotransposon flanked by long terminal repeat sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: repeat_family
owl:Class.obo:def: A group of characterized repeat sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A group of characterized repeat sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intron
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a primary transcript that is transcribed, but removed from within the transcript by splicing together the sequences (exons) on either side of it.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a primary transcript that is transcribed, but removed from within the transcript by splicing together the sequences (exons) on either side of it.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_LTR_retrotransposon
owl:Class.obo:def: A retrotransposon without long terminal repeat sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A retrotransposon without long terminal repeat sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RFLP_fragment
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA fragment used as a reagent to detect the polymorphic genomic loci by hybridizing against the genomic DNA digested with a given restriction enzyme.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA fragment used as a reagent to detect the polymorphic genomic loci by hybridizing against the genomic DNA digested with a given restriction enzyme.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: LINE_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A dispersed repeat family with many copies, each from 1 to 6 kb long. New elements are generated by retroposition of a transcribed copy. Typically the LINE contains 2 ORF's one of which is reverse transcriptase, and 3'and 5' direct repeats.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A dispersed repeat family with many copies, each from 1 to 6 kb long. New elements are generated by retroposition of a transcribed copy. Typically the LINE contains 2 ORF's one of which is reverse transcriptase, and 3'and 5' direct repeats.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: coding_exon
owl:Class.obo:def: An exon whereby at least one base is part of a codon (here, 'codon' is inclusive of the stop_codon).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An exon whereby at least one base is part of a codon (here, 'codon' is inclusive of the stop_codon).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_coding_exon_coding_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence of the five_prime_coding_exon that codes for protein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence of the five_prime_coding_exon that codes for protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_coding_exon_coding_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence of the three_prime_coding_exon that codes for protein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence of the three_prime_coding_exon that codes for protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: noncoding_exon
owl:Class.obo:def: An exon that does not contain any codons.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An exon that does not contain any codons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of nucleotide sequence that has translocated to a new position.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of nucleotide sequence that has translocated to a new position.
transchr

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_coding_exon
owl:Class.obo:def: The 5' most coding exon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The 5' most coding exon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: interior_exon
owl:Class.obo:def: An exon that is bounded by 5' and 3' splice sites.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An exon that is bounded by 5' and 3' splice sites.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_coding_exon
owl:Class.obo:def: The coding exon that is most 3-prime on a given transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The coding exon that is most 3-prime on a given transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: UTR
owl:Class.obo:def: Messenger RNA sequences that are untranslated and lie five prime or three prime to sequences which are translated.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Messenger RNA sequences that are untranslated and lie five prime or three prime to sequences which are translated.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_UTR
owl:Class.obo:def: A region at the 5' end of a mature transcript (preceding the initiation codon) that is not translated into a protein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region at the 5' end of a mature transcript (preceding the initiation codon) that is not translated into a protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_UTR
owl:Class.obo:def: A region at the 3' end of a mature transcript (following the stop codon) that is not translated into a protein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region at the 3' end of a mature transcript (following the stop codon) that is not translated into a protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SINE_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A repetitive element, a few hundred base pairs long, that is dispersed throughout the genome. A common human SINE is the Alu element.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A repetitive element, a few hundred base pairs long, that is dispersed throughout the genome. A common human SINE is the Alu element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: terminal_inverted_repeat_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA transposable element defined as having termini with perfect, or nearly perfect short inverted repeats, generally 10 - 40 nucleotides long.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA transposable element defined as having termini with perfect, or nearly perfect short inverted repeats, generally 10 - 40 nucleotides long.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a ribosomal RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a ribosomal RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a transfer RNA (SO:0000253).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a transfer RNA (SO:0000253).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: alanine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding alanyl tRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding alanyl tRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: arginine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding arginyl tRNA (SO:0000255).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding arginyl tRNA (SO:0000255).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: asparagine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding asparaginyl tRNA (SO:0000256).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding asparaginyl tRNA (SO:0000256).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: aspartic_acid_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding aspartyl tRNA (SO:0000257).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding aspartyl tRNA (SO:0000257).

owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding cysteinyl tRNA (SO:0000258).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding cysteinyl tRNA (SO:0000258).

owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding glutaminyl tRNA (SO:0000260).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding glutaminyl tRNA (SO:0000260).

owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding glutamyl tRNA (SO:0000260).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding glutamyl tRNA (SO:0000260).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: glycine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding glycyl tRNA (SO:0000263).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding glycyl tRNA (SO:0000263).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: histidine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding histidyl tRNA (SO:0000262).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding histidyl tRNA (SO:0000262).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: isoleucine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding isoleucyl tRNA (SO:0000263).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding isoleucyl tRNA (SO:0000263).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: leucine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding leucyl tRNA (SO:0000264).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding leucyl tRNA (SO:0000264).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: lysine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding lysyl tRNA (SO:0000265).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding lysyl tRNA (SO:0000265).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: methionine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding methionyl tRNA (SO:0000266).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding methionyl tRNA (SO:0000266).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: phenylalanine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding phenylalanyl tRNA (SO:0000267).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding phenylalanyl tRNA (SO:0000267).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: proline_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding prolyl tRNA (SO:0000268).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding prolyl tRNA (SO:0000268).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: serine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding seryl tRNA (SO:000269).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding seryl tRNA (SO:000269).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: threonine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding threonyl tRNA (SO:000270).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding threonyl tRNA (SO:000270).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tryptophan_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding tryptophanyl tRNA (SO:000271).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding tryptophanyl tRNA (SO:000271).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tyrosine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding tyrosyl tRNA (SO:000272).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding tyrosyl tRNA (SO:000272).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: valine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding valyl tRNA (SO:000273).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding valyl tRNA (SO:000273).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: snRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a small nuclear RNA (SO:0000274).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a small nuclear RNA (SO:0000274).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: snoRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a small nucleolar mRNA (SO:0000275).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a small nucleolar mRNA (SO:0000275).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mature_transcript
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A processed transcript cannot contain introns.
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript which has undergone the necessary modifications, if any, for its function. In eukaryotes this includes, for example, processing of introns, cleavage, base modification, and modifications to the 5' and/or the 3' ends, other than addition of bases. In bacteria functional mRNAs are usually not modified.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript which has undergone the necessary modifications, if any, for its function. In eukaryotes this includes, for example, processing of introns, cleavage, base modification, and modifications to the 5' and/or the 3' ends, other than addition of bases. In bacteria functional mRNAs are usually not modified.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An mRNA does not contain introns as it is a processed_transcript. The equivalent kind of primary_transcript is protein_coding_primary_transcript (SO:0000120) which may contain introns. This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.
owl:Class.obo:def: Messenger RNA is the intermediate molecule between DNA and protein. It includes UTR and coding sequences. It does not contain introns.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Messenger RNA is the intermediate molecule between DNA and protein. It includes UTR and coding sequences. It does not contain introns.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TF_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a nucleotide molecule that binds a Transcription Factor or Transcription Factor complex [GO:0005667].

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a nucleotide molecule that binds a Transcription Factor or Transcription Factor complex [GO:0005667].

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ORF
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The definition was modified by Rama. ORF is defined by the sequence, whereas the CDS is defined according to whether a polypeptide is made. This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.
owl:Class.obo:def: The in-frame interval between the stop codons of a reading frame which when read as sequential triplets, has the potential of encoding a sequential string of amino acids. TER(NNN)nTER.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The in-frame interval between the stop codons of a reading frame which when read as sequential triplets, has the potential of encoding a sequential string of amino acids. TER(NNN)nTER.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: foldback_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A transposable element with extensive secondary structure, characterized by large modular imperfect long inverted repeats.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transposable element with extensive secondary structure, characterized by large modular imperfect long inverted repeats.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: flanking_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequences extending on either side of a specific region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequences extending on either side of a specific region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: internal_UTR
owl:Class.obo:def: A UTR bordered by the terminal and initial codons of two CDSs in a polycistronic transcript. Every UTR is either 5', 3' or internal.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A UTR bordered by the terminal and initial codons of two CDSs in a polycistronic transcript. Every UTR is either 5', 3' or internal.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: untranslated_region_polycistronic_mRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The untranslated sequence separating the 'cistrons' of multicistronic mRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The untranslated sequence separating the 'cistrons' of multicistronic mRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: internal_ribosome_entry_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Sequence element that recruits a ribosomal subunit to internal mRNA for translation initiation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sequence element that recruits a ribosomal subunit to internal mRNA for translation initiation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polyadenylated
owl:Class.obo:def: A attribute describing the addition of a poly A tail to the 3' end of a mRNA molecule.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A attribute describing the addition of a poly A tail to the 3' end of a mRNA molecule.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: modified_RNA_base_feature
owl:Class.obo:def: A post_transcriptionally modified base.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A post_transcriptionally modified base.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: RNA that comprises part of a ribosome, and that can provide both structural scaffolding and catalytic activity.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: RNA that comprises part of a ribosome, and that can provide both structural scaffolding and catalytic activity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tRNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.
owl:Class.obo:def: Transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules are approximately 80 nucleotides in length. Their secondary structure includes four short double-helical elements and three loops (D, anti-codon, and T loops). Further hydrogen bonds mediate the characteristic L-shaped molecular structure. Transfer RNAs have two regions of fundamental functional importance: the anti-codon, which is responsible for specific mRNA codon recognition, and the 3' end, to which the tRNA's corresponding amino acid is attached (by aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases). Transfer RNAs cope with the degeneracy of the genetic code in two manners: having more than one tRNA (with a specific anti-codon) for a particular amino acid; and 'wobble' base-pairing, i.e. permitting non-standard base-pairing at the 3rd anti-codon position.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Transfer RNA (tRNA) molecules are approximately 80 nucleotides in length. Their secondary structure includes four short double-helical elements and three loops (D, anti-codon, and T loops). Further hydrogen bonds mediate the characteristic L-shaped molecular structure. Transfer RNAs have two regions of fundamental functional importance: the anti-codon, which is responsible for specific mRNA codon recognition, and the 3' end, to which the tRNA's corresponding amino acid is attached (by aminoacyl-tRNA synthetases). Transfer RNAs cope with the degeneracy of the genetic code in two manners: having more than one tRNA (with a specific anti-codon) for a particular amino acid; and 'wobble' base-pairing, i.e. permitting non-standard base-pairing at the 3rd anti-codon position.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: alanyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has an alanine anticodon, and a 3' alanine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has an alanine anticodon, and a 3' alanine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_small_subunit_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a small ribosomal subunit RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a small ribosomal subunit RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: asparaginyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has an asparagine anticodon, and a 3' asparagine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has an asparagine anticodon, and a 3' asparagine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: aspartyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has an aspartic acid anticodon, and a 3' aspartic acid binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has an aspartic acid anticodon, and a 3' aspartic acid binding region.

owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a cysteine anticodon, and a 3' cysteine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a cysteine anticodon, and a 3' cysteine binding region.

owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a glutamine anticodon, and a 3' glutamine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a glutamic acid anticodon, and a 3' glutamic acid binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: glycyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a glycine anticodon, and a 3' glycine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a glycine anticodon, and a 3' glycine binding region.

owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a histidine anticodon, and a 3' histidine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a histidine anticodon, and a 3' histidine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: isoleucyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has an isoleucine anticodon, and a 3' isoleucine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has an isoleucine anticodon, and a 3' isoleucine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: leucyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a leucine anticodon, and a 3' leucine binding region.
