owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a lysine anticodon, and a 3' lysine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a lysine anticodon, and a 3' lysine binding region.

owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a methionine anticodon, and a 3' methionine binding region.

owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a phenylalanine anticodon, and a 3' phenylalanine binding region.

owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a serine anticodon, and a 3' serine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: threonyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a threonine anticodon, and a 3' threonine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a threonine anticodon, and a 3' threonine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tryptophanyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a tryptophan anticodon, and a 3' tryptophan binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a tryptophan anticodon, and a 3' tryptophan binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tyrosyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a tyrosine anticodon, and a 3' tyrosine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: valyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a valine anticodon, and a 3' valine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a valine anticodon, and a 3' valine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A small nuclear RNA molecule involved in pre-mRNA splicing and processing.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small nuclear RNA molecule involved in pre-mRNA splicing and processing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: snoRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A snoRNA (small nucleolar RNA) is any one of a class of small RNAs that are associated with the eukaryotic nucleus as components of small nucleolar ribonucleoproteins. They participate in the processing or modifications of many RNAs, mostly ribosomal RNAs (rRNAs) though snoRNAs are also known to target other classes of RNA, including spliceosomal RNAs, tRNAs, and mRNAs via a stretch of sequence that is complementary to a sequence in the targeted RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A snoRNA (small nucleolar RNA) is any one of a class of small RNAs that are associated with the eukaryotic nucleus as components of small nucleolar ribonucleoproteins. They participate in the processing or modifications of many RNAs, mostly ribosomal RNAs (rRNAs) though snoRNAs are also known to target other classes of RNA, including spliceosomal RNAs, tRNAs, and mRNAs via a stretch of sequence that is complementary to a sequence in the targeted RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: miRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Small, ~22-nt, RNA molecule that is the endogenous transcript of a miRNA gene. Micro RNAs are produced from precursor molecules (SO:0000647) that can form local hairpin structures, which ordinarily are processed (via the Dicer pathway) such that a single miRNA molecule accumulates from one arm of a hairpin precursor molecule. Micro RNAs may trigger the cleavage of their target molecules or act as translational repressors.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Small, ~22-nt, RNA molecule that is the endogenous transcript of a miRNA gene. Micro RNAs are produced from precursor molecules (SO:0000647) that can form local hairpin structures, which ordinarily are processed (via the Dicer pathway) such that a single miRNA molecule accumulates from one arm of a hairpin precursor molecule. Micro RNAs may trigger the cleavage of their target molecules or act as translational repressors.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: bound_by_factor
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence that is bound by another molecule.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Formerly called transcript_by_bound_factor.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence that is bound by another molecule.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript_bound_by_nucleic_acid
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript that is bound by a nucleic acid.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Formerly called transcript_by_bound_nucleic_acid.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript that is bound by a nucleic acid.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript_bound_by_protein
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript that is bound by a protein.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Formerly called transcript_by_bound_protein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript that is bound by a protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: engineered_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is engineered.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is engineered.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: engineered_foreign_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is engineered and foreign.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is engineered and foreign.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_with_minus_1_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: An mRNA with a minus 1 frameshift.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An mRNA with a minus 1 frameshift.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: engineered_foreign_transposable_element_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A transposable_element that is engineered and foreign.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transposable_element that is engineered and foreign.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: type_I_enzyme_restriction_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The recognition site is bipartite and interrupted.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The recognition site is bipartite and interrupted.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: foreign_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is foreign.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is foreign.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: long_terminal_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence directly repeated at both ends of a defined sequence, of the sort typically found in retroviruses.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence directly repeated at both ends of a defined sequence, of the sort typically found in retroviruses.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: fusion_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is a fusion.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is a fusion.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: engineered_fusion_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A fusion gene that is engineered.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A fusion gene that is engineered.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: microsatellite
owl:Class.obo:def: A repeat_region containing repeat_units of 2 to 10 bp repeated in tandem.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A repeat_region containing repeat_units of 2 to 10 bp repeated in tandem.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: engineered_foreign_repetitive_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A repetitive element that is engineered and foreign.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A repetitive element that is engineered and foreign.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inverted_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence is complementarily repeated on the opposite strand. It is a palindrome, and it may, or may not be hyphenated. Examples: GCTGATCAGC, or GCTGA-----TCAGC.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence is complementarily repeated on the opposite strand. It is a palindrome, and it may, or may not be hyphenated. Examples: GCTGATCAGC, or GCTGA-----TCAGC.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U12_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: A type of spliceosomal intron spliced by the U12 spliceosome, that includes U11, U12, U4atac/U6atac and U5 snRNAs.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: May have either GT-AC or AT-AC 5' and 3' boundaries.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A type of spliceosomal intron spliced by the U12 spliceosome, that includes U11, U12, U4atac/U6atac and U5 snRNAs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: origin_of_replication
owl:Class.obo:def: The origin of replication; starting site for duplication of a nucleic acid molecule to give two identical copies.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The origin of replication; starting site for duplication of a nucleic acid molecule to give two identical copies.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: D_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: Displacement loop; a region within mitochondrial DNA in which a short stretch of RNA is paired with one strand of DNA, displacing the original partner DNA strand in this region; also used to describe the displacement of a region of one strand of duplex DNA by a single stranded invader in the reaction catalyzed by RecA protein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Displacement loop; a region within mitochondrial DNA in which a short stretch of RNA is paired with one strand of DNA, displacing the original partner DNA strand in this region; also used to describe the displacement of a region of one strand of duplex DNA by a single stranded invader in the reaction catalyzed by RecA protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: vertebrate_immune_system_gene_recombination_feature
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: vertebrate immune system gene recombination feature

owl:Class.rdfs:label: J_gene_recombination_feature
owl:Class.obo:def: Recombination signal including J-heptamer, J-spacer and J-nonamer in 5' of J-region of a J-gene or J-sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Recombination signal including J-heptamer, J-spacer and J-nonamer in 5' of J-region of a J-gene or J-sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: clip
owl:Class.obo:def: Part of the primary transcript that is clipped off during processing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Part of the primary transcript that is clipped off during processing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: type_II_enzyme_restriction_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The recognition site is either palindromic, partially palindromic or an interrupted palindrome. Cleavage occurs within the recognition site.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The recognition site is either palindromic, partially palindromic or an interrupted palindrome. Cleavage occurs within the recognition site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: modified_DNA_base
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified nucleotide, i.e. a nucleotide other than A, T, C. G.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Modified base:<modified_base>.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified nucleotide, i.e. a nucleotide other than A, T, C. G.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: methylated_DNA_base_feature
owl:Class.obo:def: A nucleotide modified by methylation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A nucleotide modified by methylation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CpG_island
owl:Class.obo:def: Regions of a few hundred to a few thousand bases in vertebrate genomes that are relatively GC and CpG rich; they are typically unmethylated and often found near the 5' ends of genes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Regions of a few hundred to a few thousand bases in vertebrate genomes that are relatively GC and CpG rich; they are typically unmethylated and often found near the 5' ends of genes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: computed_feature_by_similarity
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: similar to:<sequence_id>

owl:Class.rdfs:label: experimentally_determined
owl:Class.obo:def: Attribute to describe a feature that has been experimentally verified.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Attribute to describe a feature that has been experimentally verified.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: stem_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: A double-helical region of nucleic acid formed by base-pairing between adjacent (inverted) complementary sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A double-helical region of nucleic acid formed by base-pairing between adjacent (inverted) complementary sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: direct_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: A repeat where the same sequence is repeated in the same direction. Example: GCTGA-----GCTGA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A repeat where the same sequence is repeated in the same direction. Example: GCTGA-----GCTGA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TSS
owl:Class.obo:def: The first base where RNA polymerase begins to synthesize the RNA transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The first base where RNA polymerase begins to synthesize the RNA transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CDS
owl:Class.obo:def: A contiguous sequence which begins with, and includes, a start codon and ends with, and includes, a stop codon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A contiguous sequence which begins with, and includes, a start codon and ends with, and includes, a stop codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cDNA_clone
owl:Class.obo:def: Complementary DNA; A piece of DNA copied from an mRNA and spliced into a vector for propagation in a suitable host.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Complementary DNA; A piece of DNA copied from an mRNA and spliced into a vector for propagation in a suitable host.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: start_codon
owl:Class.obo:def: First codon to be translated by a ribosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: First codon to be translated by a ribosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: stop_codon
owl:Class.obo:def: In mRNA, a set of three nucleotides that indicates the end of information for protein synthesis.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: In mRNA, a set of three nucleotides that indicates the end of information for protein synthesis.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intronic_splice_enhancer
owl:Class.obo:def: Sequences within the intron that modulate splice site selection for some introns.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sequences within the intron that modulate splice site selection for some introns.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_with_plus_1_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: An mRNA with a plus 1 frameshift.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An mRNA with a plus 1 frameshift.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: coding_start
owl:Class.obo:def: The first base to be translated into protein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The first base to be translated into protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tag
owl:Class.obo:def: A nucleotide sequence that may be used to identify a larger sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A nucleotide sequence that may be used to identify a larger sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_large_subunit_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a large ribosomal subunit RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a large ribosomal subunit RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SAGE_tag
owl:Class.obo:def: A short diagnostic sequence tag, serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE), that allows the quantitative and simultaneous analysis of a large number of transcripts.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A short diagnostic sequence tag, serial analysis of gene expression (SAGE), that allows the quantitative and simultaneous analysis of a large number of transcripts.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: coding_end
owl:Class.obo:def: The last base to be translated into protein. It does not include the stop codon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The last base to be translated into protein. It does not include the stop codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_with_plus_2_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: An mRNA with a plus 2 frameshift.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An mRNA with a plus 2 frameshift.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: conserved_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: STS
owl:Class.obo:def: Short (typically a few hundred base pairs) DNA sequence that has a single occurrence in a genome and whose location and base sequence are known.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Short (typically a few hundred base pairs) DNA sequence that has a single occurrence in a genome and whose location and base sequence are known.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: coding_conserved_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Coding region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Coding region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: exon_junction
owl:Class.obo:def: The boundary between two exons in a processed transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The boundary between two exons in a processed transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nc_conserved_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Non-coding region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Non-coding region of sequence similarity by descent from a common ancestor.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_with_minus_2_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: A mRNA with a minus 2 frameshift.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mRNA with a minus 2 frameshift.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudogene
owl:Class.obo:def: "A sequence that closely resembles a known functional gene, at another locus within a genome, that is non-functional as a consequence of (usually several) mutations that prevent either its transcription or translation (or both). In general, pseudogenes result from either reverse transcription of a transcript of their \"normal\" paralog (SO:0000043) (in which case the pseudogene typically lacks introns and includes a poly(A) tail) or from recombination (SO:0000044) (in which case the pseudogene is typically a tandem duplication of its \"normal\" paralog)." [http://www.ucl.ac.uk/~ucbhjow/b241/glossary.html]

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNAi_reagent
owl:Class.obo:def: A double stranded RNA duplex, at least 20bp long, used experimentally to inhibit gene function by RNA interference.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A double stranded RNA duplex, at least 20bp long, used experimentally to inhibit gene function by RNA interference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: MITE
owl:Class.obo:def: A highly repetitive and short (100-500 base pair) transposable element with terminal inverted repeats (TIR) and target site duplication (TSD). MITEs do not encode proteins.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A highly repetitive and short (100-500 base pair) transposable element with terminal inverted repeats (TIR) and target site duplication (TSD). MITEs do not encode proteins.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: recombination_hotspot
owl:Class.obo:def: A region in a genome which promotes recombination.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region in a genome which promotes recombination.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: Structural unit composed of a nucleic acid molecule which controls its own replication through the interaction of specific proteins at one or more origins of replication.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Structural unit composed of a nucleic acid molecule which controls its own replication through the interaction of specific proteins at one or more origins of replication.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosome_band
owl:Class.obo:def: A cytologically distinguishable feature of a chromosome, often made visible by staining, and usually alternating light and dark.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cytologically distinguishable feature of a chromosome, often made visible by staining, and usually alternating light and dark.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: match
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence, aligned to another sequence with some statistical significance, using an algorithm such as BLAST or SIM4.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence, aligned to another sequence with some statistical significance, using an algorithm such as BLAST or SIM4.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: splice_enhancer
owl:Class.obo:def: Region of a transcript that regulates splicing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Region of a transcript that regulates splicing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: EST
owl:Class.obo:def: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a cDNA clone or PCR product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a cDNA clone or PCR product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nucleotide_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match against a nucleotide sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match against a nucleotide sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nucleic_acid
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to repeating units. The forms found in nature are deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA), where the repeating units are 2-deoxy-D-ribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone, and ribonucleic acid (RNA), where the repeating units are D-ribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to repeating units. The forms found in nature are deoxyribonucleic acid (DNA), where the repeating units are 2-deoxy-D-ribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone, and ribonucleic acid (RNA), where the repeating units are D-ribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: protein_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match against a protein sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match against a protein sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: FRT_site
owl:Class.obo:def: An inversion site found on the Saccharomyces cerevisiae 2 micron plasmid.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An inversion site found on the Saccharomyces cerevisiae 2 micron plasmid.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: synthetic_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to decide a sequence of nucleotides, nucleotide analogs, or amino acids that has been designed by an experimenter and which may, or may not, correspond with any natural sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to decide a sequence of nucleotides, nucleotide analogs, or amino acids that has been designed by an experimenter and which may, or may not, correspond with any natural sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to a repeating unit made of a 2-deoxy-D-ribose ring connected to a phosphate backbone.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to a repeating unit made of a 2-deoxy-D-ribose ring connected to a phosphate backbone.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_assembly
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence of nucleotides that has been algorithmically derived from an alignment of two or more different sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence of nucleotides that has been algorithmically derived from an alignment of two or more different sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: group_1_intron_homing_endonuclease_target_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of intronic nucleotide sequence targeted by a nuclease enzyme.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: group 1 intron homing endonuclease target region

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of intronic nucleotide sequence targeted by a nuclease enzyme.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: haplotype_block
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of the genome which is co-inherited as the result of the lack of historic recombination within it.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of the genome which is co-inherited as the result of the lack of historic recombination within it.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to a repeating unit made of a D-ribose ring connected to a phosphate backbone.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases bound to a repeating unit made of a D-ribose ring connected to a phosphate backbone.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: flanked
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a region that is bounded either side by a particular kind of region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a region that is bounded either side by a particular kind of region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: floxed
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing sequence that is flanked by Lox-P sites.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing sequence that is flanked by Lox-P sites.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: codon
owl:Class.obo:def: A set of (usually) three nucleotide bases in a DNA or RNA sequence, which together code for a unique amino acid or the termination of translation and are contained within the CDS.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A set of (usually) three nucleotide bases in a DNA or RNA sequence, which together code for a unique amino acid or the termination of translation and are contained within the CDS.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: FRT_flanked
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe sequence that is flanked by the FLP recombinase recognition site, FRT.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe sequence that is flanked by the FLP recombinase recognition site, FRT.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: invalidated_by_chimeric_cDNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A cDNA clone constructed from more than one mRNA. Usually an experimental artifact.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cDNA clone constructed from more than one mRNA. Usually an experimental artifact.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: floxed_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A transgene that is floxed.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transgene that is floxed.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transposable_element_flanking_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of sequence surrounding a transposable element.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of sequence surrounding a transposable element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: integron
owl:Class.obo:def: A region encoding an integrase which acts at a site adjacent to it (attI_site) to insert DNA which must include but is not limited to an attC_site.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region encoding an integrase which acts at a site adjacent to it (attI_site) to insert DNA which must include but is not limited to an attC_site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insertion_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The junction where an insertion occurred.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The junction where an insertion occurred.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: attI_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A region within an integron, adjacent to an integrase, at which site specific recombination involving an attC_site takes place.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region within an integron, adjacent to an integrase, at which site specific recombination involving an attC_site takes place.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transposable_element_insertion_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The junction in a genome where a transposable_element has inserted.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The junction in a genome where a transposable_element has inserted.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: small_regulatory_ncRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-coding RNA, usually with a specific secondary structure, that acts to regulate gene expression.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-coding RNA, usually with a specific secondary structure, that acts to regulate gene expression.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: conjugative_transposon
owl:Class.obo:def: A transposon that encodes function required for conjugation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transposon that encodes function required for conjugation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: enzymatic_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An RNA sequence that has catalytic activity with or without an associated ribonucleoprotein.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This was moved to be a child of transcript (SO:0000673) because some enzymatic RNA regions are part of primary transcripts and some are part of processed transcripts.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An RNA sequence that has catalytic activity with or without an associated ribonucleoprotein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: recombinationally_inverted_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A recombinationally rearranged gene by inversion.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recombinationally rearranged gene by inversion.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ribozyme
owl:Class.obo:def: An RNA with catalytic activity.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An RNA with catalytic activity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_5_8S
owl:Class.obo:def: 5_8S ribosomal RNA (5. 8S rRNA) is a component of the large subunit of the eukaryotic ribosome. It is transcribed by RNA polymerase I as part of the 45S precursor that also contains 18S and 28S rRNA. Functionally, it is thought that 5.8S rRNA may be involved in ribosome translocation. It is also known to form covalent linkage to the p53 tumour suppressor protein. 5_8S rRNA is also found in archaea.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: 5_8S ribosomal RNA (5. 8S rRNA) is a component of the large subunit of the eukaryotic ribosome. It is transcribed by RNA polymerase I as part of the 45S precursor that also contains 18S and 28S rRNA. Functionally, it is thought that 5.8S rRNA may be involved in ribosome translocation. It is also known to form covalent linkage to the p53 tumour suppressor protein. 5_8S rRNA is also found in archaea.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA_6S
owl:Class.obo:def: A small (184-nt in E. coli) RNA that forms a hairpin type structure. 6S RNA associates with RNA polymerase in a highly specific manner. 6S RNA represses expression from a sigma70-dependent promoter during stationary phase.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small (184-nt in E. coli) RNA that forms a hairpin type structure. 6S RNA associates with RNA polymerase in a highly specific manner. 6S RNA represses expression from a sigma70-dependent promoter during stationary phase.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CsrB_RsmB_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An enterobacterial RNA that binds the CsrA protein. The CsrB RNAs contain a conserved motif CAGGXXG that is found in up to 18 copies and has been suggested to bind CsrA. The Csr regulatory system has a strong negative regulatory effect on glycogen biosynthesis, glyconeogenesis and glycogen catabolism and a positive regulatory effect on glycolysis. In other bacteria such as Erwinia caratovara the RsmA protein has been shown to regulate the production of virulence determinants, such extracellular enzymes. RsmA binds to RsmB regulatory RNA which is also a member of this family.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An enterobacterial RNA that binds the CsrA protein. The CsrB RNAs contain a conserved motif CAGGXXG that is found in up to 18 copies and has been suggested to bind CsrA. The Csr regulatory system has a strong negative regulatory effect on glycogen biosynthesis, glyconeogenesis and glycogen catabolism and a positive regulatory effect on glycolysis. In other bacteria such as Erwinia caratovara the RsmA protein has been shown to regulate the production of virulence determinants, such extracellular enzymes. RsmA binds to RsmB regulatory RNA which is also a member of this family.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DsrA_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: DsrA RNA regulates both transcription, by overcoming transcriptional silencing by the nucleoid-associated H-NS protein, and translation, by promoting efficient translation of the stress sigma factor, RpoS. These two activities of DsrA can be separated by mutation: the first of three stem-loops of the 85 nucleotide RNA is necessary for RpoS translation but not for anti-H-NS action, while the second stem-loop is essential for antisilencing and less critical for RpoS translation. The third stem-loop, which behaves as a transcription terminator, can be substituted by the trp transcription terminator without loss of either DsrA function. The sequence of the first stem-loop of DsrA is complementary with the upstream leader portion of RpoS messenger RNA, suggesting that pairing of DsrA with the RpoS message might be important for translational regulation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DsrA RNA regulates both transcription, by overcoming transcriptional silencing by the nucleoid-associated H-NS protein, and translation, by promoting efficient translation of the stress sigma factor, RpoS. These two activities of DsrA can be separated by mutation: the first of three stem-loops of the 85 nucleotide RNA is necessary for RpoS translation but not for anti-H-NS action, while the second stem-loop is essential for antisilencing and less critical for RpoS translation. The third stem-loop, which behaves as a transcription terminator, can be substituted by the trp transcription terminator without loss of either DsrA function. The sequence of the first stem-loop of DsrA is complementary with the upstream leader portion of RpoS messenger RNA, suggesting that pairing of DsrA with the RpoS message might be important for translational regulation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: GcvB_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A small untranslated RNA involved in expression of the dipeptide and oligopeptide transport systems in Escherichia coli.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small untranslated RNA involved in expression of the dipeptide and oligopeptide transport systems in Escherichia coli.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: hammerhead_ribozyme
owl:Class.obo:def: A small catalytic RNA motif that catalyzes self-cleavage reaction. Its name comes from its secondary structure which resembles a carpenter's hammer. The hammerhead ribozyme is involved in the replication of some viroid and some satellite RNAs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small catalytic RNA motif that catalyzes self-cleavage reaction. Its name comes from its secondary structure which resembles a carpenter's hammer. The hammerhead ribozyme is involved in the replication of some viroid and some satellite RNAs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: MicF_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-translated 93 nt antisense RNA that binds its target ompF mRNA and regulates ompF expression by inhibiting translation and inducing degradation of the message.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-translated 93 nt antisense RNA that binds its target ompF mRNA and regulates ompF expression by inhibiting translation and inducing degradation of the message.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: OxyS_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A small untranslated RNA which is induced in response to oxidative stress in Escherichia coli. Acts as a global regulator to activate or repress the expression of as many as 40 genes, including the fhlA-encoded transcriptional activator and the rpoS-encoded sigma(s) subunit of RNA polymerase. OxyS is bound by the Hfq protein, that increases the OxyS RNA interaction with its target messages.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small untranslated RNA which is induced in response to oxidative stress in Escherichia coli. Acts as a global regulator to activate or repress the expression of as many as 40 genes, including the fhlA-encoded transcriptional activator and the rpoS-encoded sigma(s) subunit of RNA polymerase. OxyS is bound by the Hfq protein, that increases the OxyS RNA interaction with its target messages.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNase_MRP_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The RNA molecule essential for the catalytic activity of RNase MRP, an enzymatically active ribonucleoprotein with two distinct roles in eukaryotes. In mitochondria it plays a direct role in the initiation of mitochondrial DNA replication. In the nucleus it is involved in precursor rRNA processing, where it cleaves the internal transcribed spacer 1 between 18S and 5.8S rRNAs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The RNA molecule essential for the catalytic activity of RNase MRP, an enzymatically active ribonucleoprotein with two distinct roles in eukaryotes. In mitochondria it plays a direct role in the initiation of mitochondrial DNA replication. In the nucleus it is involved in precursor rRNA processing, where it cleaves the internal transcribed spacer 1 between 18S and 5.8S rRNAs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNase_P_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The RNA component of Ribonuclease P (RNase P), a ubiquitous endoribonuclease, found in archaea, bacteria and eukarya as well as chloroplasts and mitochondria. Its best characterized activity is the generation of mature 5 prime ends of tRNAs by cleaving the 5 prime leader elements of precursor-tRNAs. Cellular RNase Ps are ribonucleoproteins. RNA from bacterial RNase Ps retains its catalytic activity in the absence of the protein subunit, i.e. it is a ribozyme. Isolated eukaryotic and archaeal RNase P RNA has not been shown to retain its catalytic function, but is still essential for the catalytic activity of the holoenzyme. Although the archaeal and eukaryotic holoenzymes have a much greater protein content than the bacterial ones, the RNA cores from all the three lineages are homologous. Helices corresponding to P1, P2, P3, P4, and P10/11 are common to all cellular RNase P RNAs. Yet, there is considerable sequence variation, particularly among the eukaryotic RNAs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The RNA component of Ribonuclease P (RNase P), a ubiquitous endoribonuclease, found in archaea, bacteria and eukarya as well as chloroplasts and mitochondria. Its best characterized activity is the generation of mature 5 prime ends of tRNAs by cleaving the 5 prime leader elements of precursor-tRNAs. Cellular RNase Ps are ribonucleoproteins. RNA from bacterial RNase Ps retains its catalytic activity in the absence of the protein subunit, i.e. it is a ribozyme. Isolated eukaryotic and archaeal RNase P RNA has not been shown to retain its catalytic function, but is still essential for the catalytic activity of the holoenzyme. Although the archaeal and eukaryotic holoenzymes have a much greater protein content than the bacterial ones, the RNA cores from all the three lineages are homologous. Helices corresponding to P1, P2, P3, P4, and P10/11 are common to all cellular RNase P RNAs. Yet, there is considerable sequence variation, particularly among the eukaryotic RNAs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RprA_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Translational regulation of the stationary phase sigma factor RpoS is mediated by the formation of a double-stranded RNA stem-loop structure in the upstream region of the rpoS messenger RNA, occluding the translation initiation site. Clones carrying rprA (RpoS regulator RNA) increased the translation of RpoS. The rprA gene encodes a 106 nucleotide regulatory RNA. As with DsrA Rfam:RF00014, RprA is predicted to form three stem-loops. Thus, at least two small RNAs, DsrA and RprA, participate in the positive regulation of RpoS translation. Unlike DsrA, RprA does not have an extensive region of complementarity to the RpoS leader, leaving its mechanism of action unclear. RprA is non-essential.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Translational regulation of the stationary phase sigma factor RpoS is mediated by the formation of a double-stranded RNA stem-loop structure in the upstream region of the rpoS messenger RNA, occluding the translation initiation site. Clones carrying rprA (RpoS regulator RNA) increased the translation of RpoS. The rprA gene encodes a 106 nucleotide regulatory RNA. As with DsrA Rfam:RF00014, RprA is predicted to form three stem-loops. Thus, at least two small RNAs, DsrA and RprA, participate in the positive regulation of RpoS translation. Unlike DsrA, RprA does not have an extensive region of complementarity to the RpoS leader, leaving its mechanism of action unclear. RprA is non-essential.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RRE_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The Rev response element (RRE) is encoded within the HIV-env gene. Rev is an essential regulatory protein of HIV that binds an internal loop of the RRE leading, encouraging further Rev-RRE binding. This RNP complex is critical for mRNA export and hence for expression of the HIV structural proteins.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The Rev response element (RRE) is encoded within the HIV-env gene. Rev is an essential regulatory protein of HIV that binds an internal loop of the RRE leading, encouraging further Rev-RRE binding. This RNP complex is critical for mRNA export and hence for expression of the HIV structural proteins.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: spot_42_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A 109-nucleotide RNA of E. coli that seems to have a regulatory role on the galactose operon. Changes in Spot 42 levels are implicated in affecting DNA polymerase I levels.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A 109-nucleotide RNA of E. coli that seems to have a regulatory role on the galactose operon. Changes in Spot 42 levels are implicated in affecting DNA polymerase I levels.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: telomerase_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The RNA component of telomerase, a reverse transcriptase that synthesizes telomeric DNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The RNA component of telomerase, a reverse transcriptase that synthesizes telomeric DNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U1_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: U1 is a small nuclear RNA (snRNA) component of the spliceosome (involved in pre-mRNA splicing). Its 5' end forms complementary base pairs with the 5' splice junction, thus defining the 5' donor site of an intron. There are significant differences in sequence and secondary structure between metazoan and yeast U1 snRNAs, the latter being much longer (568 nucleotides as compared to 164 nucleotides in human). Nevertheless, secondary structure predictions suggest that all U1 snRNAs share a 'common core' consisting of helices I, II, the proximal region of III, and IV.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snRNA U1
small nuclear RNA U1
U1 small nuclear RNA

Its 5' end forms complementary base pairs with the 5' splice junction, thus defining the 5' donor site of an intron. There are significant differences in sequence and secondary structure between metazoan and yeast U1 snRNAs, the latter being much longer (568 nucleotides as compared to 164 nucleotides in human). Nevertheless, secondary structure predictions suggest that all U1 snRNAs share a 'common core' consisting of helices I, II, the proximal region of III, and IV.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U2_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: U2 is a small nuclear RNA (snRNA) component of the spliceosome (involved in pre-mRNA splicing). Complementary binding between U2 snRNA (in an area lying towards the 5' end but 3' to hairpin I) and the branchpoint sequence (BPS) of the intron results in the bulging out of an unpaired adenine, on the BPS, which initiates a nucleophilic attack at the intronic 5' splice site, thus starting the first of two transesterification reactions that mediate splicing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: small nuclear RNA U2
U2 small nuclear RNA

snRNA U2

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U4_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: U4 small nuclear RNA (U4 snRNA) is a component of the major U2-dependent spliceosome. It forms a duplex with U6, and with each splicing round, it is displaced from U6 (and the spliceosome) in an ATP-dependent manner, allowing U6 to refold and create the active site for splicing catalysis. A recycling process involving protein Prp24 re-anneals U4 and U6.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: small nuclear RNA U4
snRNA U4
U4 small nuclear RNA

A recycling process involving protein Prp24 re-anneals U4 and U6.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U4atac_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An snRNA required for the splicing of the minor U12-dependent class of eukaryotic nuclear introns. It forms a base paired complex with U6atac_snRNA (SO:0000397).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: small nuclear RNA U4atac
snRNA U4atac
An snRNA required for the splicing of the minor U12-dependent class of eukaryotic nuclear introns. It forms a base paired complex with U6atac_snRNA (SO:0000397).
U4atac small nuclear RNA

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U5_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: U5 RNA is a component of both types of known spliceosome. The precise function of this molecule is unknown, though it is known that the 5' loop is required for splice site selection and p220 binding, and that both the 3' stem-loop and the Sm site are important for Sm protein binding and cap methylation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snRNA U5
U5 small nuclear RNA

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U6_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: U6 snRNA is a component of the spliceosome which is involved in splicing pre-mRNA. The putative secondary structure consensus base pairing is confined to a short 5' stem loop, but U6 snRNA is thought to form extensive base-pair interactions with U4 snRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snRNA U6
small nuclear RNA U6
U6 small nuclear RNA

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U6atac_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: U6atac_snRNA is an snRNA required for the splicing of the minor U12-dependent class of eukaryotic nuclear introns. It forms a base paired complex with U4atac_snRNA (SO:0000394).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U11_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: U11 snRNA plays a role in splicing of the minor U12-dependent class of eukaryotic nuclear introns, similar to U1 snRNA in the major class spliceosome it base pairs to the conserved 5' splice site sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U12_snRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The U12 small nuclear (snRNA), together with U4atac/U6atac, U5, and U11 snRNAs and associated proteins, forms a spliceosome that cleaves a divergent class of low-abundance pre-mRNA introns.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_attribute
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describes a quality of sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describes a quality of sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U14_snoRNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An evolutionarily conserved eukaryotic low molecular weight RNA capable of intermolecular hybridization with both homologous and heterologous 18S rRNA.
owl:Class.obo:def: U14 small nucleolar RNA (U14 snoRNA) is required for early cleavages of eukaryotic precursor rRNAs. In yeasts, this molecule possess a stem-loop region (known as the Y-domain) which is essential for function. A similar structure, but with a different consensus sequence, is found in plants, but is absent in vertebrates.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: U14 small nucleolar RNA (U14 snoRNA) is required for early cleavages of eukaryotic precursor rRNAs. In yeasts, this molecule possess a stem-loop region (known as the Y-domain) which is essential for function. owl:Class.rdfs:label: vault_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A family of RNAs are found as part of the enigmatic vault ribonucleoprotein complex. The complex consists of a major vault protein (MVP), two minor vault proteins (VPARP and TEP1), and several small untranslated RNA molecules. It has been suggested that the vault complex is involved in drug resistance.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A family of RNAs are found as part of the enigmatic vault ribonucleoprotein complex. The complex consists of a major vault protein (MVP), two minor vault proteins (VPARP and TEP1), and several small untranslated RNA molecules. It has been suggested that the vault complex is involved in drug resistance.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Y_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Y RNAs are components of the Ro ribonucleoprotein particle (Ro RNP), in association with Ro60 and La proteins. The Y RNAs and Ro60 and La proteins are well conserved, but the function of the Ro RNP is not known. In humans the RNA component can be one of four small RNAs: hY1, hY3, hY4 and hY5. These small RNAs are predicted to fold into a conserved secondary structure containing three stem structures. The largest of the four, hY1, contains an additional hairpin.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Y RNAs are components of the Ro ribonucleoprotein particle (Ro RNP), in association with Ro60 and La proteins. The Y RNAs and Ro60 and La proteins are well conserved, but the function of the Ro RNP is not known. In humans the RNA component can be one of four small RNAs: hY1, hY3, hY4 and hY5. These small RNAs are predicted to fold into a conserved secondary structure containing three stem structures. The largest of the four, hY1, contains an additional hairpin.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: twintron
owl:Class.obo:def: An intron within an intron. Twintrons are group II or III introns, into which another group II or III intron has been transposed.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intron within an intron. Twintrons are group II or III introns, into which another group II or III intron has been transposed.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_18S
owl:Class.obo:def: A large polynucleotide in eukaryotes, which functions as the small subunit of the ribosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A biological_region of sequence that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with other molecules. A region on the surface of a molecule that may interact with another molecule. When applied to polypeptides: Amino acids involved in binding or interactions. It can also apply to an amino acid bond which is represented by the positions of the two flanking amino acids.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: See GO:0005488 : binding.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome structure variant whereby a region of a chromosome has been transferred to another position. owl:Class.rdfs:label: Hoogsteen_base_pair

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcribed_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence that is transcribed. This region may cover the transcript of a gene, it may emcompas the sequence covered by all of the transcripts of a alternately spliced gene, or it may cover the region transcribed by a polycistronic transcript. A gene may have 1 or more transcribed regions and a transcribed_region may belong to one or more genes.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This concept cam about as a direct result of the SO meeting August 2004.nThe exact nature of the relationship between transcribed_region and gene is still up for discussion. We are going with 'associated_with' for the time being.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence that is transcribed. This region may cover the transcript of a gene, it may emcompas the sequence covered by all of the transcripts of a alternately spliced gene, or it may cover the region transcribed by a polycistronic transcript. A gene may have 1 or more transcribed regions and a transcribed_region may belong to one or more genes.

owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a methylation guide small nucleolar RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cap
owl:Class.obo:def: A structure consisting of a 7-methylguanosine in 5'-5' triphosphate linkage with the first nucleotide of an mRNA. It is added post-transcriptionally, and is not encoded in the DNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_cleavage_snoRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding an rRNA cleavage snoRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pre_edited_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of a transcript that will be edited.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of a transcript that will be edited.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tmRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tmRNA liberates a mRNA from a stalled ribosome. To accomplish this part of the tmRNA is used as a reading frame that ends in a translation stop signal. The broken mRNA is replaced in the ribosome by the tmRNA and translation of the tmRNA leads to addition of a proteolysis tag to the incomplete protein enabling recognition by a protease. Recently a number of permuted tmRNAs genes have been found encoded in two parts. TmRNAs have been identified in eubacteria and some chloroplasts but are absent from archeal and Eukaryote nuclear genomes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tmRNA liberates a mRNA from a stalled ribosome. To accomplish this part of the tmRNA is used as a reading frame that ends in a translation stop signal. The broken mRNA is replaced in the ribosome by the tmRNA and translation of the tmRNA leads to addition of a proteolysis tag to the incomplete protein enabling recognition by a protease. Recently a number of permuted tmRNAs genes have been found encoded in two parts. TmRNAs have been identified in eubacteria and some chloroplasts but are absent from archeal and Eukaryote nuclear genomes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tmRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a tmRNA (SO:0000584).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a tmRNA (SO:0000584).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: group_I_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: Group I catalytic introns are large self-splicing ribozymes. They catalyze their own excision from mRNA, tRNA and rRNA precursors in a wide range of organisms. The core secondary structure consists of 9 paired regions (P1-P9). These fold to essentially two domains, the P4-P6 domain (formed from the stacking of P5, P4, P6 and P6a helices) and the P3-P9 domain (formed from the P8, P3, P7 and P9 helices). Group I catalytic introns often have long ORFs inserted in loop regions.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Group I catalytic introns are large self-splicing ribozymes. They catalyze their own excision from mRNA, tRNA and rRNA precursors in a wide range of organisms. The core secondary structure consists of 9 paired regions (P1-P9). These fold to essentially two domains, the P4-P6 domain (formed from the stacking of P5, P4, P6 and P6a helices) and the P3-P9 domain (formed from the P8, P3, P7 and P9 helices). Group I catalytic introns often have long ORFs inserted in loop regions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: autocatalytically_spliced_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: A self spliced intron.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A self spliced intron.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SRP_RNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a signal recognition particle RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a signal recognition particle RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SRP_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The signal recognition particle (SRP) is a universally conserved ribonucleoprotein. It is involved in the co-translational targeting of proteins to membranes. The eukaryotic SRP consists of a 300-nucleotide 7S RNA and six proteins: SRPs 72, 68, 54, 19, 14, and 9. Archaeal SRP consists of a 7S RNA and homologues of the eukaryotic SRP19 and SRP54 proteins. In most eubacteria, the SRP consists of a 4.5S RNA and the Ffh protein (a homologue of the eukaryotic SRP54 protein). Eukaryotic and archaeal 7S RNAs have very similar secondary structures, with eight helical elements. These fold into the Alu and S domains, separated by a long linker region. Eubacterial SRP is generally a simpler structure, with the M domain of Ffh bound to a region of the 4.5S RNA that corresponds to helix 8 of the eukaryotic and archaeal SRP S domain. Some Gram-positive bacteria (e.g. Bacillus subtilis), however, have a larger SRP RNA that also has an Alu domain. The Alu domain is thought to mediate the peptide chain elongation retardation function of the SRP. The universally conserved helix which interacts with the SRP54/Ffh M domain mediates signal sequence recognition. In eukaryotes and archaea, the SRP19-helix 6 complex is thought to be involved in SRP assembly and stabilizes helix 8 for SRP54 binding.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The signal recognition particle (SRP) is a universally conserved ribonucleoprotein. It is involved in the co-translational targeting of proteins to membranes. The eukaryotic SRP consists of a 300-nucleotide 7S RNA and six proteins: SRPs 72, 68, 54, 19, 14, and 9. Archaeal SRP consists of a 7S RNA and homologues of the eukaryotic SRP19 and SRP54 proteins. In most eubacteria, the SRP consists of a 4.5S RNA and the Ffh protein (a homologue of the eukaryotic SRP54 protein). Eukaryotic and archaeal 7S RNAs have very similar secondary structures, with eight helical elements. These fold into the Alu and S domains, separated by a long linker region. Eubacterial SRP is generally a simpler structure, with the M domain of Ffh bound to a region of the 4.5S RNA that corresponds to helix 8 of the eukaryotic and archaeal SRP S domain. Some Gram-positive bacteria (e.g. Bacillus subtilis), however, have a larger SRP RNA that also has an Alu domain. The Alu domain is thought to mediate the peptide chain elongation retardation function of the SRP. The universally conserved helix which interacts with the SRP54/Ffh M domain mediates signal sequence recognition. In eukaryotes and archaea, the SRP19-helix 6 complex is thought to be involved in SRP assembly and stabilizes helix 8 for SRP54 binding.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudoknot
owl:Class.obo:def: A tertiary structure in RNA where nucleotides in a loop form base pairs with a region of RNA downstream of the loop.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tertiary structure in RNA where nucleotides in a loop form base pairs with a region of RNA downstream of the loop.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: H_pseudoknot
owl:Class.obo:def: A pseudoknot which contains two stems and at least two loops.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A pseudoknot which contains two stems and at least two loops.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: C_D_box_snoRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Most box C/D snoRNAs also contain long (>10 nt) sequences complementary to rRNA. Boxes C and D, as well as boxes C' and D', are usually located in close proximity, and form a structure known as the box C/D motif. This motif is important for snoRNA stability, processing, nucleolar targeting and function. A small number of box C/D snoRNAs are involved in rRNA processing; most, however, are known or predicted to serve as guide RNAs in ribose methylation of rRNA. Targeting involves direct base pairing of the snoRNA at the rRNA site to be modified and selection of a rRNA nucleotide a fixed distance from box D or D'.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Most box C/D snoRNAs also contain long (>10 nt) sequences complementary to rRNA. Boxes C and D, as well as boxes C' and D', are usually located in close proximity, and form a structure known as the box C/D motif. This motif is important for snoRNA stability, processing, nucleolar targeting and function. A small number of box C/D snoRNAs are involved in rRNA processing; most, however, are known or predicted to serve as guide RNAs in ribose methylation of rRNA. Targeting involves direct base pairing of the snoRNA at the rRNA site to be modified and selection of a rRNA nucleotide a fixed distance from box D or D'.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: H_ACA_box_snoRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Members of the box H/ACA family contain an ACA triplet, exactly 3 nt upstream from the 3' end and an H-box in a hinge region that links two structurally similar functional domains of the molecule. Both boxes are important for snoRNA biosynthesis and function. A few box H/ACA snoRNAs are involved in rRNA processing; most others are known or predicted to participate in selection of uridine nucleosides in rRNA to be converted to pseudouridines. Site selection is mediated by direct base pairing of the snoRNA with rRNA through one or both targeting domains.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Members of the box H/ACA family contain an ACA triplet, exactly 3 nt upstream from the 3' end and an H-box in a hinge region that links two structurally similar functional domains of the molecule. Both boxes are important for snoRNA biosynthesis and function. A few box H/ACA snoRNAs are involved in rRNA processing; most others are known or predicted to participate in selection of uridine nucleosides in rRNA to be converted to pseudouridines. Site selection is mediated by direct base pairing of the snoRNA with rRNA through one or both targeting domains.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a small nucleolar RNA of the box C/D family.

owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a small nucleolar RNA of the box H/ACA family.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript_edited_by_U_insertion/deletion
owl:Class.obo:def: The insertion and deletion of uridine (U) residues, usually within coding regions of mRNA transcripts of cryptogenes in the mitochondrial genome of kinetoplastid protozoa.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The insertion and deletion of uridine (U) residues, usually within coding regions of mRNA transcripts of cryptogenes in the mitochondrial genome of kinetoplastid protozoa.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: guide_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A short 3'-uridylated RNA that can form a duplex (except for its post-transcriptionally added oligo_U tail (SO:0000609)) with a stretch of mature edited mRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A short 3'-uridylated RNA that can form a duplex (except for its post-transcriptionally added oligo_U tail (SO:0000609)) with a stretch of mature edited mRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: group_II_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: Group II introns are found in rRNA, tRNA and mRNA of organelles in fungi, plants and protists, and also in mRNA in bacteria. They are large self-splicing ribozymes and have 6 structural domains (usually designated dI to dVI). A subset of group II introns also encode essential splicing proteins in intronic ORFs. The length of these introns can therefore be up to 3kb. Splicing occurs in almost identical fashion to nuclear pre-mRNA splicing with two transesterification steps. The 2' hydroxyl of a bulged adenosine in domain VI attacks the 5' splice site, followed by nucleophilic attack on the 3' splice site by the 3' OH of the upstream exon. Protein machinery is required for splicing in vivo, and long range intron-intron and intron-exon interactions are important for splice site positioning. Group II introns are further sub-classified into groups IIA and IIB which differ in splice site consensus, distance of bulged A from 3' splice site, some tertiary interactions, and intronic ORF phylogeny.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Group II introns are found in rRNA, tRNA and mRNA of organelles in fungi, plants and protists, and also in mRNA in bacteria. They are large self-splicing ribozymes and have 6 structural domains (usually designated dI to dVI). A subset of group II introns also encode essential splicing proteins in intronic ORFs. The length of these introns can therefore be up to 3kb. Splicing occurs in almost identical fashion to nuclear pre-mRNA splicing with two transesterification steps. The 2' hydroxyl of a bulged adenosine in domain VI attacks the 5' splice site, followed by nucleophilic attack on the 3' splice site by the 3' OH of the upstream exon. Protein machinery is required for splicing in vivo, and long range intron-intron and intron-exon interactions are important for splice site positioning. Group II introns are further sub-classified into groups IIA and IIB which differ in splice site consensus, distance of bulged A from 3' splice site, some tertiary interactions, and intronic ORF phylogeny.
