owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Part of an rRNA transcription unit that is transcribed but discarded during maturation, not giving rise to any part of rRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: internal_transcribed_spacer_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Non-coding regions of DNA sequence that separate genes coding for the 28S, 5.8S, and 18S ribosomal RNAs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Non-coding regions of DNA sequence that separate genes coding for the 28S, 5.8S, and 18S ribosomal RNAs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: external_transcribed_spacer_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Non-coding regions of DNA that precede the sequence that codes for the ribosomal RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Non-coding regions of DNA that precede the sequence that codes for the ribosomal RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: minisatellite
owl:Class.obo:def: A repeat region containing tandemly repeated sequences having a unit length of 10 to 40 bp.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A repeat region containing tandemly repeated sequences having a unit length of 10 to 40 bp.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: antisense_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Antisense RNA is RNA that is transcribed from the coding, rather than the template, strand of DNA. It is therefore complementary to mRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Antisense RNA is RNA that is transcribed from the coding, rather than the template, strand of DNA. It is therefore complementary to mRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: antisense_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: The reverse complement of the primary transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The reverse complement of the primary transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: siRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A small RNA molecule that is the product of a longer exogenous or endogenous dsRNA, which is either a bimolecular duplex or very long hairpin, processed (via the Dicer pathway) such that numerous siRNAs accumulate from both strands of the dsRNA. SRNAs trigger the cleavage of their target molecules.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small RNA molecule that is the product of a longer exogenous or endogenous dsRNA, which is either a bimolecular duplex or very long hairpin, processed (via the Dicer pathway) such that numerous siRNAs accumulate from both strands of the dsRNA. SRNAs trigger the cleavage of their target molecules.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: miRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a micro RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a micro RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: stRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a small temporal mRNA (SO:0000649).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a small temporal mRNA (SO:0000649).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: stRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Non-coding RNAs of about 21 nucleotides in length that regulate temporal development; first discovered in C. elegans.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Non-coding RNAs of about 21 nucleotides in length that regulate temporal development; first discovered in C. elegans.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: small_subunit_rRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Ribosomal RNA transcript that structures the small subunit of the ribosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ribosomal RNA transcript that structures the small subunit of the ribosome.
SSU rRNA
SSU RNA

owl:Class.rdfs:label: large_subunit_rRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Ribosomal RNA transcript that structures the large subunit of the ribosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: LSU rRNA
LSU RNA
Ribosomal RNA transcript that structures the large subunit of the ribosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_5S
owl:Class.obo:def: 5S ribosomal RNA (5S rRNA) is a component of the large ribosomal subunit in both prokaryotes and eukaryotes. In eukaryotes, it is synthesised by RNA polymerase III (the other eukaryotic rRNAs are cleaved from a 45S precursor synthesised by RNA polymerase I). In Xenopus oocytes, it has been shown that fingers 4-7 of the nine-zinc finger transcription factor TFIIIA can bind to the central region of 5S RNA. Thus, in addition to positively regulating 5S rRNA transcription, TFIIIA also stabilizes 5S rRNA until it is required for transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: 5S ribosomal RNA (5S rRNA) is a component of the large ribosomal subunit in both prokaryotes and eukaryotes. In eukaryotes, it is synthesised by RNA polymerase III (the other eukaryotic rRNAs are cleaved from a 45S precursor synthesised by RNA polymerase I). In Xenopus oocytes, it has been shown that fingers 4-7 of the nine-zinc finger transcription factor TFIIIA can bind to the central region of 5S RNA. Thus, in addition to positively regulating 5S rRNA transcription, TFIIIA also stabilizes 5S rRNA until it is required for transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_28S
owl:Class.obo:def: A component of the large ribosomal subunit.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A component of the large ribosomal subunit.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: maxicircle_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A mitochondrial gene located in a maxicircle.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mitochondrial gene located in a maxicircle.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ncRNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A ncRNA is a processed_transcript, so it may not contain parts such as transcribed_spacer_regions that are removed in the act of processing. For the corresponding primary_transcripts, please see term SO:0000483 nc_primary_transcript.
owl:Class.obo:def: An RNA transcript that does not encode for a protein rather the RNA molecule is the gene product.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An RNA transcript that does not encode for a protein rather the RNA molecule is the gene product.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: repeat_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence containing one or more repeat units.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence containing one or more repeat units.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: dispersed_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: A repeat that is located at dispersed sites in the genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A repeat that is located at dispersed sites in the genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: spliceosomal_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: An intron which is spliced by the spliceosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intron which is spliced by the spliceosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: monocistronic_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript that is monocistronic.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript that is monocistronic.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mobile_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: An intron (mitochondrial, chloroplast, nuclear or prokaryotic) that encodes a double strand sequence specific endonuclease allowing for mobility.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intron (mitochondrial, chloroplast, nuclear or prokaryotic) that encodes a double strand sequence specific endonuclease allowing for mobility.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insertion
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence of one or more nucleotides added between two adjacent nucleotides in the sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence of one or more nucleotides added between two adjacent nucleotides in the sequence.
insertion

owl:Class.rdfs:label: EST_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match against an EST sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match against an EST sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosome_breakage_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence within the micronuclear DNA of ciliates at which chromosome breakage and telomere addition occurs during nuclear differentiation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence within the micronuclear DNA of ciliates at which chromosome breakage and telomere addition occurs during nuclear differentiation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: internal_eliminated_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence eliminated from the genome of ciliates during nuclear differentiation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence eliminated from the genome of ciliates during nuclear differentiation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: macronucleus_destined_segment
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence that is conserved, although rearranged relative to the micronucleus, in the macronucleus of a ciliate genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence that is conserved, although rearranged relative to the micronucleus, in the macronucleus of a ciliate genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: An RNA synthesized on a DNA or RNA template by an RNA polymerase.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An RNA synthesized on a DNA or RNA template by an RNA polymerase.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_canonical_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A splice site where the donor and acceptor sites differ from the canonical form.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A splice site where the donor and acceptor sites differ from the canonical form.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: canonical_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The major class of splice site with dinucleotides GT and AG for donor and acceptor sites, respectively.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The major class of splice site with dinucleotides GT and AG for donor and acceptor sites, respectively.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: canonical_three_prime_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: "The canonical 3' splice site has the sequence \"AG\"." [SO:ke]

owl:Class.rdfs:label: canonical_five_prime_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: "The canonical 5' splice site has the sequence \"GT\"." [SO:ke]

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_canonical_three_prime_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: "A 3' splice site that does not have the sequence \"AG\"." [SO:ke]
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: non canonical three prime splice site

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_canonical_five_prime_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: "A 5' splice site which does not have the sequence \"GT\"." [SO:ke]
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: non canonical five prime splice site

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_canonical_start_codon
owl:Class.obo:def: A start codon that is not the usual AUG sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A start codon that is not the usual AUG sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: aberrant_processed_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: "A transcript that has been processed \"incorrectly\", for example by the failure of splicing of one or more exons." [SO:ke]

owl:Class.rdfs:label: exonic_splice_enhancer
owl:Class.obo:def: Exonic splicing enhancers (ESEs) facilitate exon definition by assisting in the recruitment of splicing factors to the adjacent intron.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Exonic splicing enhancers (ESEs) facilitate exon definition by assisting in the recruitment of splicing factors to the adjacent intron.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nuclease_sensitive_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of nucleotide sequence targeted by a nuclease enzyme.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of nucleotide sequence targeted by a nuclease enzyme.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: translocation_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal translocation whereby the chromosomes carrying non-homologous centromeres may be recovered independently. These chromosomes are described as translocation elements. This occurs for some translocations, particularly but not exclusively, reciprocal translocations.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal translocation whereby the chromosomes carrying non-homologous centromeres may be recovered independently. These chromosomes are described as translocation elements. This occurs for some translocations, particularly but not exclusively, reciprocal translocations.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: deletion_junction
owl:Class.obo:def: The space between two bases in a sequence which marks the position where a deletion has occurred.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The space between two bases in a sequence which marks the position where a deletion has occurred.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: golden_path
owl:Class.obo:def: A set of subregions selected from sequence contigs which when concatenated form a nonredundant linear sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A set of subregions selected from sequence contigs which when concatenated form a nonredundant linear sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cDNA_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match against cDNA sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match against cDNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_polycistronic_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that encodes a polycistronic transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that encodes a polycistronic transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cleaved_initiator_methionine
owl:Class.obo:def: The initiator methionine that has been cleaved from a mature polypeptide sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The initiator methionine that has been cleaved from a mature polypeptide sequence.
init_met

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_dicistronic_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that encodes a dicistronic transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that encodes a dicistronic transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_recoded_mRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that encodes an mRNA that is recoded.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that encodes an mRNA that is recoded.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SNP
owl:Class.obo:def: SNPs are single base pair positions in genomic DNA at which different sequence alternatives exist in normal individuals in some population(s), wherein the least frequent variant has an abundance of 1% or greater.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: SNPs are single base pair positions in genomic DNA at which different sequence alternatives exist in normal individuals in some population(s), wherein the least frequent variant has an abundance of 1% or greater.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: reagent
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence used in experiment.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Lynn Crosby, jan 2006.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence used in experiment.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: oligo
owl:Class.obo:def: A short oligonucleotide sequence, of length on the order of 10's of bases; either single or double stranded.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A short oligonucleotide sequence, of length on the order of 10's of bases; either single or double stranded.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_stop_codon_read_through
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that encodes a transcript with stop codon readthrough.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: gene with stop codon read through

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that encodes a transcript with stop codon readthrough.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_stop_codon_redefined_as_pyrrolysine
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene encoding an mRNA that has the stop codon redefined as pyrrolysine.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: gene with stop codon redefined as pyrrolysine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene encoding an mRNA that has the stop codon redefined as pyrrolysine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: junction
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A junction is a boundary between regions. A boundary has an extent of zero.
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_feature with an extent of zero.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_feature with an extent of zero.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: remark
owl:Class.obo:def: A comment about the sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A comment about the sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: possible_base_call_error
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence where the validity of the base calling is questionable.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence where the validity of the base calling is questionable.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: possible_assembly_error
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence where there may have been an error in the assembly.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence where there may have been an error in the assembly.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: experimental_result_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence implicated in an experimental result.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence implicated in an experimental result.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology. A gene may be considered as a unit of inheritance.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region (or regions) that includes all of the sequence elements necessary to encode a functional transcript. A gene may include regulatory regions, transcribed regions and/or other functional sequence regions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tandem_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: Two or more adjacent copies of a region (of length greater than 1).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Two or more adjacent copies of a region (of length greater than 1).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: trans_splice_acceptor_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The 3' splice site of the acceptor primary transcript.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This region contains a polypyridine tract and AG dinucleotide in some organisms and is UUUCAG in C. elegans.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The 3' splice site of the acceptor primary transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: trans_splice_donor_site
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: SL RNA contains a donor site.
owl:Class.obo:def: The 5' five prime splice site region of the donor RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The 5' five prime splice site region of the donor RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SL1_acceptor_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A trans_splicing_acceptor_site which appends the 22nt SL1 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of most mRNAs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A trans_splicing_acceptor_site which appends the 22nt SL1 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of most mRNAs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SL2_acceptor_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A trans_splicing_acceptor_site which appends the 22nt SL2 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of mRNAs. SL2 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A trans_splicing_acceptor_site which appends the 22nt SL2 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of mRNAs. SL2 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_stop_codon_redefined_as_selenocysteine
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene encoding an mRNA that has the stop codon redefined as selenocysteine.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: gene with stop codon redefined as selenocysteine

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene encoding an mRNA that has the stop codon redefined as selenocysteine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_mRNA_recoded_by_translational_bypass
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene with mRNA recoded by translational bypass.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: gene with mRNA recoded by translational bypass

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene with mRNA recoded by translational bypass.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_transcript_with_translational_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene encoding a transcript that has a translational frameshift.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: gene with transcript with translational frameshift

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene encoding a transcript that has a translational frameshift.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif that is active in the DNA form of the sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif that is active in the DNA form of the sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nucleotide_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of nucleotide sequence corresponding to a known motif.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of nucleotide sequence corresponding to a known motif.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif that is active in RNA sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif that is active in RNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: dicistronic_mRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An mRNA that has the quality dicistronic.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An mRNA that has the quality dicistronic.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: reading_frame
owl:Class.obo:def: A nucleic acid sequence that when read as sequential triplets, has the potential of encoding a sequential string of amino acids. It need not contain the start or stop codon.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term was added after a request by SGD. August 2004. Modified after SO meeting in Cambridge to not include start or stop.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A nucleic acid sequence that when read as sequential triplets, has the potential of encoding a sequential string of amino acids. It need not contain the start or stop codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: blocked_reading_frame
owl:Class.obo:def: A reading_frame that is interrupted by one or more stop codons; usually identified through inter-genomic sequence comparisons.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Term requested by Rama from SGD.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A reading_frame that is interrupted by one or more stop codons; usually identified through inter-genomic sequence comparisons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ultracontig
owl:Class.obo:def: An ordered and oriented set of scaffolds based on somewhat weaker sets of inferential evidence such as one set of mate pair reads together with supporting evidence from ESTs or location of markers from SNP or microsatellite maps, or cytogenetic localization of contained markers.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An ordered and oriented set of scaffolds based on somewhat weaker sets of inferential evidence such as one set of mate pair reads together with supporting evidence from ESTs or location of markers from SNP or microsatellite maps, or cytogenetic localization of contained markers.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: foreign_transposable_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A transposable element that is foreign.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: requested by Michael on 19 Nov 2004.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transposable element that is foreign.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_dicistronic_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that encodes a dicistronic primary transcript.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Michael, 19 nov 2004.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that encodes a dicistronic primary transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_dicistronic_mRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that encodes a polycistronic mRNA.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by MA nov 19 2004.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that encodes a polycistronic mRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: iDNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Genomic sequence removed from the genome, as a normal event, by a process of recombination.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Genomic sequence removed from the genome, as a normal event, by a process of recombination.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: oriT
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a DNA molecule where transfer is initiated during the process of conjugation or mobilization.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a DNA molecule where transfer is initiated during the process of conjugation or mobilization.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transit_peptide
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added to bring SO inline with the EMBL, DDBJ, GenBank feature table. Old definition before biosapiens: The coding sequence for an N-terminal domain of a nuclear-encoded organellar protein. This domain is involved in post translational import of the protein into the organelle.
owl:Class.obo:def: The transit_peptide is a short region at the N-terminus of the peptide that directs the protein to an organelle (chloroplast, mitochondrion, microbody or cyanelle).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The transit_peptide is a short region at the N-terminus of the peptide that directs the protein to an organelle (chloroplast, mitochondrion, microbody or cyanelle).
transit

owl:Class.rdfs:label: repeat_unit
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added to comply with the feature table. A single repeat.
owl:Class.obo:def: The simplest repeated component of a repeat region. A single repeat.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The simplest repeated component of a repeat region. A single repeat.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CRM
owl:Class.obo:def: A regulatory region where transcription factor binding sites clustered to regulate various aspects of transcription activities. (CRMs can be located a few kb to hundred kb upstream of the basal promoter, in the coding sequence, within introns, or in the downstream 3'UTR sequences, as well as on different chromosome). A single gene can be regulated by multiple CRMs to give precise control of its spatial and temporal expression. CRMs function as nodes in large, intertwined regulatory network.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Stephen Grossmann Dec 2004.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regulatory region where transcription factor binding sites clustered to regulate various aspects of transcription activities. (CRMs can be located a few kb to hundred kb upstream of the basal promoter, in the coding sequence, within introns, or in the downstream 3'UTR sequences, as well as on different chromosome). A single gene can be regulated by multiple CRMs to give precise control of its spatial and temporal expression. CRMs function as nodes in large, intertwined regulatory network.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intein
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a peptide that is able to excise itself and rejoin the remaining portions with a peptide bond.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Intein-mediated protein splicing occurs after mRNA has been translated into a protein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a peptide that is able to excise itself and rejoin the remaining portions with a peptide bond.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intein_containing
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute of protein-coding genes where the initial protein product contains an intein.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute of protein-coding genes where the initial protein product contains an intein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gap
owl:Class.obo:def: A gap in the sequence of known length. The unknown bases are filled in with N's.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gap in the sequence of known length. The unknown bases are filled in with N's.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: fragmentary
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a feature that is incomplete.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Term added because of request by MO people.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe a feature that is incomplete.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: predicted
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing an unverified region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing an unverified region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: feature_attribute
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a located_sequence_feature.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a located_sequence_feature.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: exemplar_mRNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added for the MO people.
owl:Class.obo:def: An exemplar is a representative cDNA sequence for each gene. The exemplar approach is a method that usually involves some initial clustering into gene groups and the subsequent selection of a representative from each gene group.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An exemplar is a representative cDNA sequence for each gene. The exemplar approach is a method that usually involves some initial clustering into gene groups and the subsequent selection of a representative from each gene group.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mitochondrial_sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: kinetoplast
owl:Class.obo:def: A kinetoplast is an interlocked network of thousands of minicircles and tens of maxicircles, located near the base of the flagellum of some protozoan species.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kinetoplast is an interlocked network of thousands of minicircles and tens of maxicircles, located near the base of the flagellum of some protozoan species.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: maxicircle
owl:Class.obo:def: A maxicircle is a replicon, part of a kinetoplast, that contains open reading frames and replicates via a rolling circle method.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A maxicircle is a replicon, part of a kinetoplast, that contains open reading frames and replicates via a rolling circle method.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: amplification_origin
owl:Class.obo:def: An origin_of_replication that is used for the amplification of a chromosomal nucleic acid sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An origin_of_replication that is used for the amplification of a chromosomal nucleic acid sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: clone_insert
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of sequence that has been inserted and is being propagated by the clone.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of sequence that has been inserted and is being propagated by the clone.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: lambda_vector
owl:Class.obo:def: The lambda bacteriophage is the vector for the linear lambda clone. The genes involved in the lysogenic pathway are removed from the from the viral DNA. Up to 25 kb of foreign DNA can then be inserted into the lambda genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The lambda bacteriophage is the vector for the linear lambda clone. The genes involved in the lysogenic pathway are removed from the from the viral DNA. Up to 25 kb of foreign DNA can then be inserted into the lambda genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cDNA
owl:Class.obo:def: DNA synthesized by reverse transcriptase using RNA as a template.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA synthesized by reverse transcriptase using RNA as a template.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pyrrolysyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a pyrrolysine anticodon, and a 3' pyrrolysine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a pyrrolysine anticodon, and a 3' pyrrolysine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: episome
owl:Class.obo:def: A plasmid that may integrate with a chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A plasmid that may integrate with a chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tmRNA_coding_piece
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added in response to comment from Kelly Williams from Indiana. Nov 2005.
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of a two-piece tmRNA that bears the reading frame encoding the proteolysis tag. The tmRNA gene undergoes circular permutation in some groups of bacteria. Processing of the transcripts from such a gene leaves the mature tmRNA in two pieces, base-paired together.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of a two-piece tmRNA that bears the reading frame encoding the proteolysis tag. The tmRNA gene undergoes circular permutation in some groups of bacteria. Processing of the transcripts from such a gene leaves the mature tmRNA in two pieces, base-paired together.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tmRNA_acceptor_piece
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added in response to Kelly Williams from Indiana. Date: Nov 2005.
owl:Class.obo:def: The acceptor region of a two-piece tmRNA that when mature is charged at its 3' end with alanine. The tmRNA gene undergoes circular permutation in some groups of bacteria; processing of the transcripts from such a gene leaves the mature tmRNA in two pieces, base-paired together.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The acceptor region of a two-piece tmRNA that when mature is charged at its 3' end with alanine. The tmRNA gene undergoes circular permutation in some groups of bacteria; processing of the transcripts from such a gene leaves the mature tmRNA in two pieces, base-paired together.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: QTL
owl:Class.obo:def: A quantitative trait locus (QTL) is a polymorphic locus which contains alleles that differentially affect the expression of a continuously distributed phenotypic trait. Usually it is a marker described by statistical association to quantitative variation in the particular phenotypic trait that is thought to be controlled by the cumulative action of alleles at multiple loci.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added in respose to request by Simon Twigger November 14th 2005.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A quantitative trait locus (QTL) is a polymorphic locus which contains alleles that differentially affect the expression of a continuously distributed phenotypic trait. Usually it is a marker described by statistical association to quantitative variation in the particular phenotypic trait that is thought to be controlled by the cumulative action of alleles at multiple loci.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: genomic_island
owl:Class.obo:def: A genomic island is an integrated mobile genetic element, characterized by size (over 10 Kb). It that has features that suggest a foreign origin. These can include nucleotide distribution (oligonucleotides signature, CG content etc.) that differs from the bulk of the chromosome and/or genes suggesting DNA mobility.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Genomic islands are transmissible elements characterized by large size (>10kb).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A genomic island is an integrated mobile genetic element, characterized by size (over 10 Kb). It that has features that suggest a foreign origin. These can include nucleotide distribution (oligonucleotides signature, CG content etc.) that differs from the bulk of the chromosome and/or genes suggesting DNA mobility.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pathogenic_island
owl:Class.obo:def: Mobile genetic elements that contribute to rapid changes in virulence potential. They are present on the genomes of pathogenic strains but absent from the genomes of non pathogenic members of the same or related species.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Nature Reviews Microbiology 2, 414-424 (2004); doi:10.1038 micro 884 GENOMIC ISLANDS IN PATHOGENIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL MICROORGANISMS Ulrich Dobrindt, Bianca Hochhut, Ute Hentschel & Jorg Hacker.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Mobile genetic elements that contribute to rapid changes in virulence potential. They are present on the genomes of pathogenic strains but absent from the genomes of non pathogenic members of the same or related species.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: metabolic_island
owl:Class.obo:def: A transmissible element containing genes involved in metabolism, analogous to the pathogenicity islands of gram negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Genes for phenolic compound degradation in Pseudomonas putida are found on metabolic islands.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transmissible element containing genes involved in metabolism, analogous to the pathogenicity islands of gram negative bacteria.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: adaptive_island
owl:Class.obo:def: An adaptive island is a genomic island that provides an adaptive advantage to the host.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The iron-uptake ability of many pathogens are conveyed by adaptive islands. Nature Reviews Microbiology 2, 414-424 (2004); doi:10.1038 micro 884 GENOMIC ISLANDS IN PATHOGENIC AND ENVIRONMENTAL MICROORGANISMS Ulrich Dobrindt, Bianca Hochhut, Ute Hentschel & Jorg Hacker.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An adaptive island is a genomic island that provides an adaptive advantage to the host.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: symbiosis_island
owl:Class.obo:def: A transmissible element containing genes involved in symbiosis, analogous to the pathogenicity islands of gram negative bacteria.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Nitrogen fixation in Rhizobiaceae species is encoded by symbiosis islands. Evolution of rhizobia by acquisition of a 500-kb symbiosis island that integrates into a phe-tRNA gene. John T. Sullivan and Clive W. Ronso PNAS 1998 Apr 28 95 (9) 5145-5149.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transmissible element containing genes involved in symbiosis, analogous to the pathogenicity islands of gram negative bacteria.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudogenic_rRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A non functional descendant of an rRNA.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added Jan 2006 to allow the annotation of the pseudogenic rRNA by flybase. Non-functional is defined as its transcription is prevented due to one or more mutatations.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non functional descendant of an rRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudogenic_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A non functional descendent of a tRNA.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added Jan 2006 to allow the annotation of the pseudogenic tRNA by flybase. Non-functional is defined as its transcription is prevented due to one or more mutatations.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non functional descendent of a tRNA.

owl:Class.obo:def: TE that exists (or existed) in nature.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: engineered_transposable_element
owl:Class.obo:def: TE that has been modified by manipulations in vitro.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: TE that has been modified by manipulations in vitro.

owl:Class.obo:def: A multi-chromosome duplication aberration generated by reassortment of other aberration components.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A multi-chromosome duplication aberration generated by reassortment of other aberration components.

owl:Class.obo:def: A region that is engineered.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rescue
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a region's ability, when introduced to a mutant organism, to re-establish (rescue) a phenotype.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a region's ability, when introduced to a mutant organism, to re-establish (rescue) a phenotype.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mini_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: By definition, minigenes are short open-reading frames (ORF), usually encoding approximately 9 to 20 amino acids, which are expressed in vivo (as distinct from being synthesized as peptide or protein ex vivo and subsequently injected). The in vivo synthesis confers a distinct advantage: the expressed sequences can enter both antigen presentation pathways, MHC I (inducing CD8+ T- cells, which are usually cytotoxic T-lymphocytes (CTL)) and MHC II (inducing CD4+ T-cells, usually 'T-helpers' (Th)); and can encounter B-cells, inducing antibody responses. Three main vector approaches have been used to deliver minigenes: viral vectors, bacterial vectors and plasmid DNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: By definition, minigenes are short open-reading frames (ORF), usually encoding approximately 9 to 20 amino acids, which are expressed in vivo (as distinct from being synthesized as peptide or protein ex vivo and subsequently injected). The in vivo synthesis confers a distinct advantage: the expressed sequences can enter both antigen presentation pathways, MHC I (inducing CD8+ T- cells, which are usually cytotoxic T-lymphocytes (CTL)) and MHC II (inducing CD4+ T-cells, usually 'T-helpers' (Th)); and can encounter B-cells, inducing antibody responses. Three main vector approaches have been used to deliver minigenes: viral vectors, bacterial vectors and plasmid DNA.

owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by DNA modifications, resulting in repression of transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: silenced_by_DNA_methylation
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by DNA methylation, resulting in repression of transcription.

owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is translationally regulated.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: allelically_excluded_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is allelically_excluded.

owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is epigenetically modified.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nuclear_mitochondrial
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a nuclear pseudogene of a mitochndrial gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a nuclear pseudogene of a mitochndrial gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: processed
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a pseudogene where by an mRNA was retrotransposed. The mRNA sequence is transcribed back into the genome, lacking introns and promotors, but often including a polyA tail.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a pseudogene where by an mRNA was retrotransposed. The mRNA sequence is transcribed back into the genome, lacking introns and promotors, but often including a polyA tail.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: unequally_crossed_over
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a pseudogene that was created by tandem duplication and unequal crossing over during recombination.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a pseudogene that was created by tandem duplication and unequal crossing over during recombination.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transgene
owl:Class.obo:def: A transgene is a gene that has been transferred naturally or by any of a number of genetic engineering techniques from one organism to another.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transgene is a gene that has been transferred naturally or by any of a number of genetic engineering techniques from one organism to another.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rearranged_at_DNA_level
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe the sequence of a feature, where the DNA is rearranged.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute to describe the sequence of a feature, where the DNA is rearranged.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: status
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing the status of a feature, based on the available evidence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is the hypernym of attributes and should not be annotated to.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing the status of a feature, based on the available evidence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: independently_known
owl:Class.obo:def: Attribute to describe a feature that is independently known - not predicted.

owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute to describe a feature that has been predicted using sequence similarity techniques.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: predicted_by_ab_initio_computation

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a feature that is predicted by a computer program that did not rely on sequence similarity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: asx_turn
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of three consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Aspartate or Asparagine (Asx), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of three consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Aspartate or Asparagine (Asx), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2).

owl:Class.obo:def: An edit to insert a dinucleotide.

owl:Class.obo:def: An edit to substitute an U for a C.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insert_G
owl:Class.obo:def: An edit to insert a G.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An edit to insert a G.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insert_GC
owl:Class.obo:def: An edit to insert a GC dinucleotide.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The type of RNA editing found in the mitochondria of Myxomycota, characterized by the insertion of mono- and dinucleotides in RNAs relative to their mtDNA template and in addition, C to U base conversion. The most common mononucleotide insertion is cytidine, although a number of uridine mononucleotides are inserted at specific sites. Adenine and guanine have not been observed in mononucleotide insertions. Five different dinucleotide insertions have been observed, GC, GU, CU, AU and AA. Both mono- and dinucleotide insertions create open reading frames in mRNA and contribute to highly conserved structural features of rRNAs and tRNAs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An edit to insert a GC dinucleotide.

owl:Class.obo:def: An edit to insert a GU dinucleotide.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The type of RNA editing found in the mitochondria of Myxomycota, characterized by the insertion of mono- and dinucleotides in RNAs relative to their mtDNA template and in addition, C to U base conversion. The most common mononucleotide insertion is cytidine, although a number of uridine mononucleotides are inserted at specific sites. Adenine and guanine have not been observed in mononucleotide insertions. Five different dinucleotide insertions have been observed, GC, GU, CU, AU and AA. Both mono- and dinucleotide insertions create open reading frames in mRNA and contribute to highly conserved structural features of rRNAs and tRNAs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An edit to insert a GU dinucleotide.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The type of RNA editing found in the mitochondria of Myxomycota, characterized by the insertion of mono- and dinucleotides in RNAs relative to their mtDNA template and in addition, C to U base conversion. The most common mononucleotide insertion is cytidine, although a number of uridine mononucleotides are inserted at specific sites. Adenine and guanine have not been observed in mononucleotide insertions. Five different dinucleotide insertions have been observed, GC, GU, CU, AU and AA. Both mono- and dinucleotide insertions create open reading frames in mRNA and contribute to highly conserved structural features of rRNAs and tRNAs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An edit to insert a CU dinucleotide.

The most common mononucleotide insertion is cytidine, although a number of uridine mononucleotides are inserted at specific sites. owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The type of RNA editing found in the mitochondria of Myxomycota, characterized by the insertion of mono- and dinucleotides in RNAs relative to their mtDNA template and in addition, C to U base conversion. The most common mononucleotide insertion is cytidine, although a number of uridine mononucleotides are inserted at specific sites. owl:Class.rdfs:label: attP_site

owl:Class.rdfs:label: attB_site

owl:Class.rdfs:label: attL_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A region that results from recombination between attP_site and attB_site, composed of the 5' portion of attB_site and the 3' portion of attP_site.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region that results from recombination between attP_site and attB_site, composed of the 5' portion of attB_site and the 3' portion of attP_site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: attR_site

owl:Class.rdfs:label: integration_excision_site

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region specifically recognised by a recombinase, which inserts or removes another region marked by a distinct cognate integration/excision site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: resolution_site

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inversion_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A region specifically recognised by a recombinase, which inverts the region flanked by a pair of sites.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A target region for site-specific inversion of a DNA region and which carries binding sites for a site-specific recombinase and accessory proteins as well as the site for specific cleavage by the recombinase.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: class_II_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: Small non-coding RNA (59-60 nt long) containing 5' and 3' ends that are predicted to come together to form a stem structure. Identified in the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum and localized in the cytoplasm.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: class_I_RNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Karen Pilcher - Dictybase. song-Term Tracker-1574577.
owl:Class.obo:def: Small non-coding RNA (55-65 nt long) containing highly conserved 5' and 3' ends (16 and 8 nt, respectively) that are predicted to come together to form a stem structure. Identified in the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum and localized in the cytoplasm.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Small non-coding RNA (55-65 nt long) containing highly conserved 5' and 3' ends (16 and 8 nt, respectively) that are predicted to come together to form a stem structure. Identified in the social amoeba Dictyostelium discoideum and localized in the cytoplasm.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: genomic_DNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: BAC_cloned_genomic_insert
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Andy Schroder - Flybase Harvard, Nov 2006.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: consensus
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Term added Dec 06 to comply with mapping to MGED terms. It should be used to generate consensus regions. The specific cross product terms they require are consensus_region and consensus_mRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: consensus_region
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: DO not obsolete without considering MGED mapping.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: consensus_mRNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: DO not obsolete without considering MGED mapping.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: predicted_gene
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_fragment
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is mapped to MGED. Do not obsolete without consulting MGED ontology.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: recursive_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A recursive splice site is a splice site which subdivides a large intron. Recursive splicing is a mechanism that splices large introns by sub dividing the intron at non exonic elements and alternate exons.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recursive splice site is a splice site which subdivides a large intron. Recursive splicing is a mechanism that splices large introns by sub dividing the intron at non exonic elements and alternate exons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: BAC_end
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence from the end of a BAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Keith Boroevich December, 2006.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence from the end of a BAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_16S
owl:Class.obo:def: A large polynucleotide in Bacteria and Archaea, which functions as the small subunit of the ribosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A large polynucleotide in Bacteria and Archaea, which functions as the small subunit of the ribosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_23S
owl:Class.obo:def: A large polynucleotide in Bacteria and Archaea, which functions as the large subunit of the ribosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A large polynucleotide in Bacteria and Archaea, which functions as the large subunit of the ribosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_25S
owl:Class.obo:def: A large polynucleotide which functions as part of the large subunit of the ribosome in some eukaryotes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A large polynucleotide which functions as part of the large subunit of the ribosome in some eukaryotes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: solo_LTR
owl:Class.obo:def: A recombination product between the 2 LTR of the same element.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Hadi Quesneville January 2007.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recombination product between the 2 LTR of the same element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: prophage
owl:Class.obo:def: "A phage genome after it has established in the host genome in a latent/immune state either as a plasmid or as an integrated \"island\"." [GOC:jl]

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cryptic_prophage
owl:Class.obo:def: "A remnant of an integrated prophage in the host genome or an \"island\" in the host genome that includes phage like-genes." [GOC:jl]
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This is not cryptic in the same sense as a cryptic gene or cryptic splice site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tetraloop
owl:Class.obo:def: A base-paired stem with loop of 4 non-hydrogen bonded nucleotides.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A base-paired stem with loop of 4 non-hydrogen bonded nucleotides.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA_constraint_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: "A double-stranded DNA used to control macromolecular structure and function." [http:/www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/entrez/query.fcgi?cmd=search&db=pubmed&term=SILVERMAN+SK[au\]&dispmax=50]

owl:Class.rdfs:label: i_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A cytosine rich domain whereby strands associate both inter- and intramolecularly at moderately acidic pH.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cytosine rich domain whereby strands associate both inter- and intramolecularly at moderately acidic pH.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: PNA_oligo
owl:Class.obo:def: Peptide nucleic acid, is a chemical not known to occur naturally but is artificially synthesized and used in some biological research and medical treatments. The PNA backbone is composed of repeating N-(2-aminoethyl)-glycine units linked by peptide bonds. The purine and pyrimidine bases are linked to the backbone by methylene carbonyl bonds.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Peptide nucleic acid, is a chemical not known to occur naturally but is artificially synthesized and used in some biological research and medical treatments. The PNA backbone is composed of repeating N-(2-aminoethyl)-glycine units linked by peptide bonds. The purine and pyrimidine bases are linked to the backbone by methylene carbonyl bonds.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNAzyme
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA sequence with catalytic activity.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added by request from Colin Batchelor.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA sequence with catalytic activity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: MNP
owl:Class.obo:def: A multiple nucleotide polymorphism with alleles of common length > 1, for example AAA/TTT.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A multiple nucleotide polymorphism with alleles of common length > 1, for example AAA/TTT.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intron_domain
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Colin Batchelor, Feb 2007.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: wobble_base_pair
owl:Class.obo:def: A type of non-canonical base pairing, most commonly between G and U, which is important for the secondary structure of RNAs. It has similar thermodynamic stability to the Watson-Crick pairing. Wobble base pairs only have two hydrogen bonds. Other wobble base pair possibilities are I-A, I-U and I-C.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A type of non-canonical base pairing, most commonly between G and U, which is important for the secondary structure of RNAs. It has similar thermodynamic stability to the Watson-Crick pairing. Wobble base pairs only have two hydrogen bonds. Other wobble base pair possibilities are I-A, I-U and I-C.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: internal_guide_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A purine-rich sequence in the group I introns which determines the locations of the splice sites in group I intron splicing and has catalytic activity.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A purine-rich sequence in the group I introns which determines the locations of the splice sites in group I intron splicing and has catalytic activity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: silent_mutation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that does not affect protein function. Silent mutations may occur in genic ( CDS, UTR, intron etc) and intergenic regions. Silent mutations may have affects on processes such as splicing and regulation.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added in March 2007 in after meeting with PharmGKB. Although this term is in common usage, it is better to annotate with the most specific term possible, such as synonymous codon, intron variant etc.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that does not affect protein function. Silent mutations may occur in genic ( CDS, UTR, intron etc) and intergenic regions. Silent mutations may have affects on processes such as splicing and regulation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: epitope
owl:Class.obo:def: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with antibodies, B cells or T cells.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Trish Whetzel.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with antibodies, B cells or T cells.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: copy_number_variation
owl:Class.obo:def: A variation that increases or decreases the copy number of a given region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A variation that increases or decreases the copy number of a given region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_copy_number
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inversion_breakpoint
owl:Class.obo:def: The point within a chromosome where an inversion begins or ends.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The point within a chromosome where an inversion begins or ends.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: allele
owl:Class.obo:def: An allele is one of a set of coexisting sequence variants of a gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An allele is one of a set of coexisting sequence variants of a gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: haplotype
owl:Class.obo:def: A haplotype is one of a set of coexisting sequence variants of a haplotype block.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A haplotype is one of a set of coexisting sequence variants of a haplotype block.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polymorphic_sequence_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that is segregating in one or more natural populations of a species.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that is segregating in one or more natural populations of a species.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: genome
owl:Class.obo:def: A genome is the sum of genetic material within a cell or virion.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A genome is the sum of genetic material within a cell or virion.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: genotype
owl:Class.obo:def: A genotype is a variant genome, complete or incomplete.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A genotype is a variant genome, complete or incomplete.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: diplotype
owl:Class.obo:def: A diplotype is a pair of haplotypes from a given individual. It is a genotype where the phase is known.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A diplotype is a pair of haplotypes from a given individual. It is a genotype where the phase is known.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: forward
owl:Class.obo:def: Forward is an attribute of the feature, where the feature is in the 5' to 3' direction.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Forward is an attribute of the feature, where the feature is in the 5' to 3' direction.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: reverse
owl:Class.obo:def: Reverse is an attribute of the feature, where the feature is in the 3' to 5' direction. Again could be applied to primer.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Reverse is an attribute of the feature, where the feature is in the 3' to 5' direction. Again could be applied to primer.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mitochondrial_DNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This terms is used by MO.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chloroplast_DNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term is used by MO.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mirtron
owl:Class.obo:def: A de-branched intron which mimics the structure of pre-miRNA and enters the miRNA processing pathway without Drosha mediated cleavage.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Ruby et al. Nature 448:83 describe a new class of miRNAs that are derived from de-branched introns.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A de-branched intron which mimics the structure of pre-miRNA and enters the miRNA processing pathway without Drosha mediated cleavage.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: piRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A small non coding RNA, part of a silencing system that prevents the spreading of selfish genetic elements.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small non coding RNA, part of a silencing system that prevents the spreading of selfish genetic elements.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: arginyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has an arginine anticodon, and a 3' arginine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has an arginine anticodon, and a 3' arginine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mobile_genetic_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A nucleotide region with either intra-genome or intracellular mobility, of varying length, which often carry the information necessary for transfer and recombination with the host genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A nucleotide region with either intra-genome or intracellular mobility, of varying length, which often carry the information necessary for transfer and recombination with the host genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: extrachromosomal_mobile_genetic_element
owl:Class.obo:def: An MGE that is not integrated into the host chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An MGE that is not integrated into the host chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: integrated_mobile_genetic_element
owl:Class.obo:def: An MGE that is integrated into the host chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An MGE that is integrated into the host chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: integrated_plasmid
owl:Class.obo:def: A plasmid sequence that is integrated within the host chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A plasmid sequence that is integrated within the host chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: viral_sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The definitions of the children of this term were revised Decemeber 2007 after discussion on song-devel. The resulting definitions are slightly unweildy but hopefully more logically correct.
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of nucleotide sequence of a virus, a submicroscopic particle that replicates by infecting a host cell.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of nucleotide sequence of a virus, a submicroscopic particle that replicates by infecting a host cell.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: phage_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: The nucleotide sequence of a virus that infects bacteria.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The nucleotide sequence of a virus that infects bacteria.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: attCtn_site
owl:Class.obo:def: An attachment site located on a conjugative transposon and used for site-specific integration of a conjugative transposon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attachment site located on a conjugative transposon and used for site-specific integration of a conjugative transposon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nuclear_mt_pseudogene
owl:Class.obo:def: A nuclear pseudogene of either coding or non-coding mitochondria derived sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Definition change requested by Val, 3172757.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A nuclear pseudogene of either coding or non-coding mitochondria derived sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cointegrated_plasmid
owl:Class.obo:def: A MGE region consisting of two fused plasmids resulting from a replicative transposition event.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A MGE region consisting of two fused plasmids resulting from a replicative transposition event.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: IRLinv_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Component of the inversion site located at the left of a region susceptible to site-specific inversion.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Component of the inversion site located at the left of a region susceptible to site-specific inversion.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: IRRinv_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Component of the inversion site located at the right of a region susceptible to site-specific inversion.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Component of the inversion site located at the right of a region susceptible to site-specific inversion.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inversion_site_part
owl:Class.obo:def: A region located within an inversion site.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A term created to allow the parts of an inversion site have an is_a path back to the root.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region located within an inversion site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: defective_conjugative_transposon
owl:Class.obo:def: An island that contains genes for integration/excision and the gene and site for the initiation of intercellular transfer by conjugation. It can be complemented for transfer by a conjugative transposon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An island that contains genes for integration/excision and the gene and site for the initiation of intercellular transfer by conjugation. It can be complemented for transfer by a conjugative transposon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: repeat_fragment
owl:Class.obo:def: A portion of a repeat, interrupted by the insertion of another element.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Chris Smith, and others at Flybase to help annotate nested repeats.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A portion of a repeat, interrupted by the insertion of another element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transposon_fragment
owl:Class.obo:def: A portion of a transposon, interrupted by the insertion of another element.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A portion of a transposon, interrupted by the insertion of another element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcriptional_cis_regulatory_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A regulatory_region that modulates the transcription of a gene or genes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regulatory_region that modulates the transcription of a gene or genes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: splicing_regulatory_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A regulatory_region that modulates splicing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regulatory_region that modulates splicing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: promoter_targeting_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcriptional_cis_regulatory_region that restricts the activity of a CRM to a single promoter and which functions only when both itself and an insulator are located between the CRM and the promoter.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcriptional_cis_regulatory_region that restricts the activity of a CRM to a single promoter and which functions only when both itself and an insulator are located between the CRM and the promoter.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_alteration
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_alteration is a sequence_feature whose extent is the deviation from another sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Merged with partially characterized change in nucleotide sequence.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasNarrowSynonym: partially characterised change in DNA sequence

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_alteration is a sequence_feature whose extent is the deviation from another sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant is a non exact copy of a sequence_feature or genome exhibiting one or more sequence_alteration.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: VAAST:sequence_variant
ANNOVAR:unknown
A sequence_variant is a non exact copy of a sequence_feature or genome exhibiting one or more sequence_alteration.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: propeptide_cleavage_site
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Discrete.
owl:Class.obo:def: The propeptide_cleavage_site is the arginine/lysine boundary on a propeptide where cleavage occurs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The propeptide_cleavage_site is the arginine/lysine boundary on a propeptide where cleavage occurs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: propeptide
owl:Class.obo:def: Part of a peptide chain which is cleaved off during the formation of the mature protein.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: propep
Part of a peptide chain which is cleaved off during the formation of the mature protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: immature_peptide_region
owl:Class.obo:def: An immature_peptide_region is the extent of the peptide after it has been translated and before any processing occurs.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An immature_peptide_region is the extent of the peptide after it has been translated and before any processing occurs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: active_peptide
owl:Class.obo:def: Active peptides are proteins which are biologically active, released from a precursor molecule.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Hormones, neuropeptides, antimicrobial peptides, are active peptides. They are typically short (<40 amino acids) in length.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: peptide
Active peptides are proteins which are biologically active, released from a precursor molecule.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: compositionally_biased_region_of_peptide
owl:Class.obo:def: Polypeptide region that is rich in a particular amino acid or homopolymeric and greater than three residues in length.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polypeptide region that is rich in a particular amino acid or homopolymeric and greater than three residues in length.
compbias

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) region of biological interest. Such motifs, although they are too short to constitute functional domains, share sequence similarities and are conserved in different proteins. They display a common function (protein-binding, subcellular location etc.).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: motif

A sequence motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) region of biological interest. Such motifs, although they are too short to constitute functional domains, share sequence similarities and are conserved in different proteins. They display a common function (protein-binding, subcellular location etc.).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: A polypeptide_repeat is a single copy of an internal sequence repetition.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: repeat
A polypeptide_repeat is a single copy of an internal sequence repetition.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_structural_region
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.
owl:Class.obo:def: Region of polypeptide with a given structural property.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Region of polypeptide with a given structural property.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: membrane_structure
owl:Class.obo:def: Arrangement of the polypeptide with respect to the lipid bilayer.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Arrangement of the polypeptide with respect to the lipid bilayer.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: extramembrane_polypeptide_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Polypeptide region that is localized outside of a lipid bilayer.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polypeptide region that is localized outside of a lipid bilayer.
extramembrane_region
topo_dom
extramembrane

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cytoplasmic_polypeptide_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Polypeptide region that is localized inside the cytoplasm.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polypeptide region that is localized inside the cytoplasm.
inside
cytoplasm_location

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_cytoplasmic_polypeptide_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Polypeptide region that is localized outside of a lipid bilayer and outside of the cytoplasm.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This could be inside an organelle within the cell.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: non_cytoplasm_location
Polypeptide region that is localized outside of a lipid bilayer and outside of the cytoplasm.
outside

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intramembrane_polypeptide_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Polypeptide region present in the lipid bilayer.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: intramembrane
Polypeptide region present in the lipid bilayer.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: membrane_peptide_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: Polypeptide region localized within the lipid bilayer where both ends traverse the same membrane.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polypeptide region localized within the lipid bilayer where both ends traverse the same membrane.
membrane_loop

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transmembrane_polypeptide_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Polypeptide region traversing the lipid bilayer.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Polypeptide region traversing the lipid bilayer.
transmem
transmembrane

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_secondary_structure
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of peptide with secondary structure has hydrogen bonding along the peptide chain that causes a defined conformation of the chain.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Biosapien term was secondary_structure.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: 2nary structure
secondary_structure
A region of peptide with secondary structure has hydrogen bonding along the peptide chain that causes a defined conformation of the chain.
secondary structure
secondary structure region

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_structural_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: Motif is a three-dimensional structural element within the chain, which appears also in a variety of other molecules. Unlike a domain, a motif does not need to form a stable globular unit.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Motif is a three-dimensional structural element within the chain, which appears also in a variety of other molecules. Unlike a domain, a motif does not need to form a stable globular unit.
structural_motif

owl:Class.rdfs:label: coiled_coil
owl:Class.obo:def: A coiled coil is a structural motif in proteins, in which alpha-helices are coiled together like the strands of a rope.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A coiled coil is a structural motif in proteins, in which alpha-helices are coiled together like the strands of a rope.
coiled

owl:Class.rdfs:label: helix_turn_helix
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif comprising two helices separated by a turn.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif comprising two helices separated by a turn.
HTH

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_sequencing_information
owl:Class.obo:def: Incompatibility in the sequence due to some experimental problem.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Incompatibility in the sequence due to some experimental problem.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_adjacent_residues
owl:Class.obo:def: Indicates that two consecutive residues in a fragment sequence are not consecutive in the full-length protein and that there are a number of unsequenced residues between them.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Indicates that two consecutive residues in a fragment sequence are not consecutive in the full-length protein and that there are a number of unsequenced residues between them.
non_cons

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_terminal_residue
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Discrete.
owl:Class.obo:def: The residue at an extremity of the sequence is not the terminal residue.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The residue at an extremity of the sequence is not the terminal residue.
non_ter

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_conflict
owl:Class.obo:def: Different sources report differing sequences.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Discrete.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: conflict
Different sources report differing sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_uncertainty
owl:Class.obo:def: Describes the positions in a sequence where the authors are unsure about the sequence assignment.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Describes the positions in a sequence where the authors are unsure about the sequence assignment.
unsure

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cross_link
owl:Class.obo:def: Posttranslationally formed amino acid bonds.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Posttranslationally formed amino acid bonds.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: disulfide_bond
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: 2 discreet & joined.
owl:Class.obo:def: The covalent bond between sulfur atoms that binds two peptide chains or different parts of one peptide chain and is a structural determinant in many protein molecules.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The covalent bond between sulfur atoms that binds two peptide chains or different parts of one peptide chain and is a structural determinant in many protein molecules.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: post_translationally_modified_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region where a transformation occurs in a protein after it has been synthesized. This which may regulate, stabilize, crosslink or introduce new chemical functionalities in the protein.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Discrete.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: mod_res
A region where a transformation occurs in a protein after it has been synthesized. This which may regulate, stabilize, crosslink or introduce new chemical functionalities in the protein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: covalent_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Binding involving a covalent bond.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Binding involving a covalent bond.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_covalent_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Binding site for any chemical group (co-enzyme, prosthetic group, etc.).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Discrete.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Binding site for any chemical group (co-enzyme, prosthetic group, etc.).
binding

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_metal_contact
owl:Class.obo:def: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with metal ions.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Residue is part of a binding site for a metal ion.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with metal ions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: protein_protein_contact

owl:Class.obo:def: Residues which interact with a ligand.
