owl:Class.rdfs:label: asx_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of five consecutive residues and two H-bonds in which: Residue(i) is Aspartate or Asparagine (Asx), side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2) or (i+3), main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3) or (i+4).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of five consecutive residues and two H-bonds in which: Residue(i) is Aspartate or Asparagine (Asx), side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2) or (i+3), main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3) or (i+4).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_bulge
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet in which the main chains of two consecutive residues are H-bonded to that of the third, and in which the dihedral angles are as follows: Residue(i): -140 degrees < phi(l) -20 degrees , -90 degrees < psi(l) < 40 degrees. Residue (i+1): -180 degrees < phi < -25 degrees or +120 degrees < phi < +180 degrees, +40 degrees < psi < +180 degrees or -180 degrees < psi < -120 degrees.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet in which the main chains of two consecutive residues are H-bonded to that of the third, and in which the dihedral angles are as follows: Residue(i): -140 degrees < phi(l) -20 degrees , -90 degrees < psi(l) < 40 degrees. Residue (i+1): -180 degrees < phi < -25 degrees or +120 degrees < phi < +180 degrees, +40 degrees < psi < +180 degrees or -180 degrees < psi < -120 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_bulge_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds. Beta bulge loops often occur at the loop ends of beta-hairpins.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds. Beta bulge loops often occur at the loop ends of beta-hairpins.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_bulge_loop_five
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds in which: the main-chain NH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i+4), the main-chain CO of residue i is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3), these loops have an RL nest at residues i+2 and i+3.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds in which: the main-chain NH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i+4), the main-chain CO of residue i is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3), these loops have an RL nest at residues i+2 and i+3.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_bulge_loop_six
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds in which: the main-chain NH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i+5), the main-chain CO of residue i is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+4), these loops have an RL nest at residues i+3 and i+4.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of three residues within a beta-sheet consisting of two H-bonds in which: the main-chain NH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i+5), the main-chain CO of residue i is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+4), these loops have an RL nest at residues i+3 and i+4.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_strand
owl:Class.obo:def: A beta strand describes a single length of polypeptide chain that forms part of a beta sheet. A single continuous stretch of amino acids adopting an extended conformation of hydrogen bonds between the N-O and the C=O of another part of the peptide. This forms a secondary protein structure in which two or more extended polypeptide regions are hydrogen-bonded to one another in a planar array.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: strand

A beta strand describes a single length of polypeptide chain that forms part of a beta sheet. A single continuous stretch of amino acids adopting an extended conformation of hydrogen bonds between the N-O and the C=O of another part of the peptide. This forms a secondary protein structure in which two or more extended polypeptide regions are hydrogen-bonded to one another in a planar array.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: antiparallel_beta_strand
owl:Class.obo:def: A peptide region which hydrogen bonded to another region of peptide running in the oposite direction (one running N-terminal to C-terminal and one running C-terminal to N-terminal). Hydrogen bonding occurs between every other C=O from one strand to every other N-H on the adjacent strand. In this case, if two atoms C-alpha (i) and C-alpha (j) are adjacent in two hydrogen-bonded beta strands, then they form two mutual backbone hydrogen bonds to each other's flanking peptide groups; this is known as a close pair of hydrogen bonds. The peptide backbone dihedral angles (phi, psi) are about (-140 degrees, 135 degrees) in antiparallel sheets.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A peptide region which hydrogen bonded to another region of peptide running in the oposite direction (one running N-terminal to C-terminal and one running C-terminal to N-terminal). Hydrogen bonding occurs between every other C=O from one strand to every other N-H on the adjacent strand. In this case, if two atoms C-alpha (i) and C-alpha (j) are adjacent in two hydrogen-bonded beta strands, then they form two mutual backbone hydrogen bonds to each other's flanking peptide groups; this is known as a close pair of hydrogen bonds. The peptide backbone dihedral angles (phi, psi) are about (-140 degrees, 135 degrees) in antiparallel sheets.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: parallel_beta_strand
owl:Class.obo:def: A peptide region which hydrogen bonded to another region of peptide running in the oposite direction (both running N-terminal to C-terminal). This orientation is slightly less stable because it introduces nonplanarity in the inter-strand hydrogen bonding pattern. Hydrogen bonding occurs between every other C=O from one strand to every other N-H on the adjacent strand. In this case, if two atoms C-alpha (i)and C-alpha (j) are adjacent in two hydrogen-bonded beta strands, then they do not hydrogen bond to each other; rather, one residue forms hydrogen bonds to the residues that flank the other (but not vice versa). For example, residue i may form hydrogen bonds to residues j - 1 and j + 1; this is known as a wide pair of hydrogen bonds. By contrast, residue j may hydrogen-bond to different residues altogether, or to none at all. The dihedral angles (phi, psi) are about (-120 degrees, 115 degrees) in parallel sheets.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A peptide region which hydrogen bonded to another region of peptide running in the oposite direction (both running N-terminal to C-terminal). This orientation is slightly less stable because it introduces nonplanarity in the inter-strand hydrogen bonding pattern. Hydrogen bonding occurs between every other C=O from one strand to every other N-H on the adjacent strand. In this case, if two atoms C-alpha (i)and C-alpha (j) are adjacent in two hydrogen-bonded beta strands, then they do not hydrogen bond to each other; rather, one residue forms hydrogen bonds to the residues that flank the other (but not vice versa). For example, residue i may form hydrogen bonds to residues j - 1 and j + 1; this is known as a wide pair of hydrogen bonds. By contrast, residue j may hydrogen-bond to different residues altogether, or to none at all. The dihedral angles (phi, psi) are about (-120 degrees, 115 degrees) in parallel sheets.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: peptide_helix
owl:Class.obo:def: A helix is a secondary_structure conformation where the peptide backbone forms a coil.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A helix is a secondary_structure conformation where the peptide backbone forms a coil.
helix

owl:Class.rdfs:label: left_handed_peptide_helix
owl:Class.obo:def: A left handed helix is a region of peptide where the coiled conformation turns in an anticlockwise, left handed screw.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A left handed helix is a region of peptide where the coiled conformation turns in an anticlockwise, left handed screw.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: right_handed_peptide_helix
owl:Class.obo:def: A right handed helix is a region of peptide where the coiled conformation turns in a clockwise, right handed screw.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A right handed helix is a region of peptide where the coiled conformation turns in a clockwise, right handed screw.
helix

owl:Class.rdfs:label: alpha_helix
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.
owl:Class.obo:def: The helix has 3.6 residues per turn which corresponds to a translation of 1.5 angstroms (= 0.15 nm) along the helical axis. Every backbone N-H group donates a hydrogen bond to the backbone C=O group of the amino acid four residues earlier.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: helix
a-helix

The helix has 3.6 residues per turn which corresponds to a translation of 1.5 angstroms (= 0.15 nm) along the helical axis. Every backbone N-H group donates a hydrogen bond to the backbone C=O group of the amino acid four residues earlier.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pi_helix
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.
owl:Class.obo:def: The pi helix has 4.1 residues per turn and a translation of 1.15 (=0.115 nm) along the helical axis. The N-H group of an amino acid forms a hydrogen bond with the C=O group of the amino acid five residues earlier.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The pi helix has 4.1 residues per turn and a translation of 1.15 (=0.115 nm) along the helical axis. The N-H group of an amino acid forms a hydrogen bond with the C=O group of the amino acid five residues earlier.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_ten_helix
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.
owl:Class.obo:def: The 3-10 helix has 3 residues per turn with a translation of 2.0 angstroms (=0.2 nm) along the helical axis. The N-H group of an amino acid forms a hydrogen bond with the C=O group of the amino acid three residues earlier.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The 3-10 helix has 3 residues per turn with a translation of 2.0 angstroms (=0.2 nm) along the helical axis. The N-H group of an amino acid forms a hydrogen bond with the C=O group of the amino acid three residues earlier.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_nest_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles. Nest should not have Proline as any residue. Nests frequently occur as parts of other motifs such as Schellman loops.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles. Nest should not have Proline as any residue. Nests frequently occur as parts of other motifs such as Schellman loops.
nest

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_nest_left_right_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles: Residue(i): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees. Residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles: Residue(i): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees. Residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_nest_right_left_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles: Residue(i): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees. Residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of two consecutive residues with dihedral angles: Residue(i): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 degrees < psi < +40 degrees. Residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 degrees < psi < +90 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: schellmann_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of six or seven consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: paperclip
A motif of six or seven consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: schellmann_loop_seven
owl:Class.obo:def: Wild type: A motif of seven consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds in which: the main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+6), the main-chain CO of residue(i+1) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+5).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Wild type: A motif of seven consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds in which: the main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+6), the main-chain CO of residue(i+1) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+5).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: schellmann_loop_six
owl:Class.obo:def: Common Type: A motif of six consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds in which: the main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+5) the main-chain CO of residue(i+1) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+4).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Common Type: A motif of six consecutive residues that contains two H-bonds in which: the main-chain CO of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+5) the main-chain CO of residue(i+1) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+4).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: serine_threonine_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of five consecutive residues and two hydrogen bonds in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2) or (i+3) , the main-chain CO group of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3) or (i+4).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of five consecutive residues and two hydrogen bonds in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2) or (i+3) , the main-chain CO group of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+3) or (i+4).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: serine_threonine_staple_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of four or five consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain OH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i3) or (i4), Phi angles of residues(i1), (i2) and (i3) are negative.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of four or five consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain OH of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain CO of residue(i3) or (i4), Phi angles of residues(i1), (i2) and (i3) are negative.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_turn_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A reversal in the direction of the backbone of a protein that is stabilized by hydrogen bond between backbone NH and CO groups, involving no more than 4 amino acid residues.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A reversal in the direction of the backbone of a protein that is stabilized by hydrogen bond between backbone NH and CO groups, involving no more than 4 amino acid residues.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_turn
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of four consecutive residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth. It is characterized by the dihedral angles of the second and third residues, which are the basis for sub-categorization.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of four consecutive residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth. It is characterized by the dihedral angles of the second and third residues, which are the basis for sub-categorization.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gamma_turn
owl:Class.obo:def: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i,( i+1),( i+2) if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i,( i+1),( i+2) if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gamma_turn_classic
owl:Class.obo:def: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i, i+1, i+2 if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees: phi(i+1)=75.0 - psi(i+1)=-64.0.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i, i+1, i+2 if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees: phi(i+1)=75.0 - psi(i+1)=-64.0.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gamma_turn_inverse
owl:Class.obo:def: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i, i+1, i+2 if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees: phi(i+1)=-79.0 - psi(i+1)=69.0.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Gamma turns, defined for 3 residues i, i+1, i+2 if a hydrogen bond exists between residues i and i+2 and the phi and psi angles of residue i+1 fall within 40 degrees: phi(i+1)=-79.0 - psi(i+1)=69.0.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: serine_threonine_turn
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of three consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of three consecutive residues and one H-bond in which: residue(i) is Serine (S) or Threonine (T), the side-chain O of residue(i) is H-bonded to the main-chain NH of residue(i+2).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: st_turn_left_handed_type_one
owl:Class.obo:def: The peptide twists in an anticlockwise, left handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, -90 degrees psi +120 degrees < +40 degrees, residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 < psi < +40 degrees.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: st turn left handed type one

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The peptide twists in an anticlockwise, left handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, -90 degrees psi +120 degrees < +40 degrees, residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 < psi < +40 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: st_turn_left_handed_type_two
owl:Class.obo:def: The peptide twists in an anticlockwise, left handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, +80 degrees psi +120 degrees < +180 degrees, residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 < psi < +90 degrees.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: st turn left handed type two

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The peptide twists in an anticlockwise, left handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, +80 degrees psi +120 degrees < +180 degrees, residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 < psi < +90 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: st_turn_right_handed_type_one
owl:Class.obo:def: The peptide twists in an clockwise, right handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, -90 degrees psi +120 degrees < +40 degrees, residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 < psi < +40 degrees.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: st turn right handed type one

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The peptide twists in an clockwise, right handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, -90 degrees psi +120 degrees < +40 degrees, residue(i+1): -140 degrees < phi < -20 degrees, -90 < psi < +40 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: st_turn_right_handed_type_two
owl:Class.obo:def: The peptide twists in an clockwise, right handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, +80 degrees psi +120 degrees < +180 degrees, residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 < psi < +90 degrees.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: st turn right handed type two

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The peptide twists in an clockwise, right handed manner. The dihedral angles for this turn are: Residue(i): -140 degrees < chi(1) -120 degrees < -20 degrees, +80 degrees psi +120 degrees < +180 degrees, residue(i+1): +20 degrees < phi < +140 degrees, -40 < psi < +90 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_variation_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A site of sequence variation (alteration). Alternative sequence due to naturally occurring events such as polymorphisms and alternative splicing or experimental methods such as site directed mutagenesis.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: For example, was a substitution natural or mutated as part of an experiment? This term is added to merge the biosapiens term sequence_variations.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A site of sequence variation (alteration). Alternative sequence due to naturally occurring events such as polymorphisms and alternative splicing or experimental methods such as site directed mutagenesis.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: natural_variant_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Describes the natural sequence variants due to polymorphisms, disease-associated mutations, RNA editing and variations between strains, isolates or cultivars.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Discrete.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: variant
Describes the natural sequence variants due to polymorphisms, disease-associated mutations, RNA editing and variations between strains, isolates or cultivars.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mutated_variant_site
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Discrete.
owl:Class.obo:def: Site which has been experimentally altered.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Site which has been experimentally altered.
mutagen

owl:Class.rdfs:label: alternate_sequence_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Description of sequence variants produced by alternative splicing, alternative promoter usage, alternative initiation and ribosomal frameshifting.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Discrete.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Description of sequence variants produced by alternative splicing, alternative promoter usage, alternative initiation and ribosomal frameshifting.
var_seq

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_turn_type_six
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of four consecutive peptide resides of type VIa or type VIb and where the i+2 residue is cis-proline.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of four consecutive peptide resides of type VIa or type VIb and where the i+2 residue is cis-proline.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_turn_type_six_a
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues, of which the i+2 residue is proline, and that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -90 degrees, psi ~ 0 degrees.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues, of which the i+2 residue is proline, and that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -90 degrees, psi ~ 0 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_turn_type_six_a_one
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: beta turn type six a one

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_turn_type_six_a_two
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: beta turn type six a two

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_turn_type_six_b
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues, of which the i+2 residue is proline, and that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -120 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ 0 degrees.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues, of which the i+2 residue is proline, and that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -120 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ 0 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: beta_turn_type_eight
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ -30 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -120 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of four consecutive peptide residues that may contain one H-bond, which, if present, is between the main-chain CO of the first residue and the main-chain NH of the fourth and is characterized by the dihedral angles: Residue(i+1): phi ~ -60 degrees, psi ~ -30 degrees. Residue(i+2): phi ~ -120 degrees, psi ~ 120 degrees.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DRE_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -10 and -60 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is WATCGATW.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This consensus sequence was identified computationally using the MEME algorithm within core promoter sequences from -60 to +40, with an E value of 1.7e-183. Tends to co-occur with Motif 7. Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or motif 10.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -10 and -60 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is WATCGATW.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DMv4_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, located immediately upstream of some TATA box elements with respect to the TSS (+1). Consensus sequence is YGGTCACACTR. Marked spatial preference within core promoter; tend to occur near the TSS, although not as tightly as INR (SO:0000014).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, located immediately upstream of some TATA box elements with respect to the TSS (+1). Consensus sequence is YGGTCACACTR. Marked spatial preference within core promoter; tend to occur near the TSS, although not as tightly as INR (SO:0000014).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: E_box_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -60 and +1 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is AWCAGCTGWT. Tends to co-occur with DMv2 (SO:0001161). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -60 and +1 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is AWCAGCTGWT. Tends to co-occur with DMv2 (SO:0001161). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DMv5_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -50 and -10 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is KTYRGTATWTTT. Tends to co-occur with DMv4 (SO:0001157) . Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (SO:0001162).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -50 and -10 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is KTYRGTATWTTT. Tends to co-occur with DMv4 (SO:0001157) . Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (SO:0001162).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DMv3_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -30 and +15 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is KNNCAKCNCTRNY. Tends to co-occur with DMv2 (SO:0001161). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (0001162).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -30 and +15 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is KNNCAKCNCTRNY. Tends to co-occur with DMv2 (SO:0001161). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (0001162).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DMv2_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -60 and -45 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is MKSYGGCARCGSYSS. Tends to co-occur with DMv3 (SO:0001160). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (SO:0001162).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between -60 and -45 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is MKSYGGCARCGSYSS. Tends to co-occur with DMv3 (SO:0001160). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or MTE (SO:0001162).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: MTE
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between +20 and +30 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is CSARCSSAACGS. Tends to co-occur with INR motif (SO:0000014). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or DMv5 (SO:0001159).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters, usually located between +20 and +30 relative to the TSS. Consensus sequence is CSARCSSAACGS. Tends to co-occur with INR motif (SO:0000014). Tends to not occur with DPE motif (SO:0000015) or DMv5 (SO:0001159).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: INR1_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter motif with consensus sequence TCATTCG.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter motif with consensus sequence TCATTCG.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DPE1_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter motif with consensus sequence CGGACGT.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter motif with consensus sequence CGGACGT.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DMv1_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter motif with consensus sequence CARCCCT.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter motif with consensus sequence CARCCCT.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: GAGA_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A non directional promoter motif with consensus sequence GAGAGCG.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: NDM2_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A non directional promoter motif with consensus CGMYGYCR.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: NDM3_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A non directional promoter motif with consensus sequence GAAAGCT.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ds_RNA_viral_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A ds_RNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as double stranded RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A ds_RNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as double stranded RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polinton
owl:Class.obo:def: A kind of DNA transposon that populates the genomes of protists, fungi, and animals, characterized by a unique set of proteins necessary for their transposition, including a protein-primed DNA polymerase B, retroviral integrase, cysteine protease, and ATPase. Polintons are characterized by 6-bp target site duplications, terminal-inverted repeats that are several hundred nucleotides long, and 5'-AG and TC-3' termini. Polintons exist as autonomous and nonautonomous elements.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of DNA transposon that populates the genomes of protists, fungi, and animals, characterized by a unique set of proteins necessary for their transposition, including a protein-primed DNA polymerase B, retroviral integrase, cysteine protease, and ATPase. Polintons are characterized by 6-bp target site duplications, terminal-inverted repeats that are several hundred nucleotides long, and 5'-AG and TC-3' termini. Polintons exist as autonomous and nonautonomous elements.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_21S
owl:Class.obo:def: A component of the large ribosomal subunit in mitochondrial rRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A component of the large ribosomal subunit in mitochondrial rRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tRNA_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a tRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a tRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: anticodon_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence of seven nucleotide bases in tRNA which contains the anticodon. It has the sequence 5'-pyrimidine-purine-anticodon-modified purine-any base-3.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence of seven nucleotide bases in tRNA which contains the anticodon. It has the sequence 5'-pyrimidine-purine-anticodon-modified purine-any base-3.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: anticodon
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence of three nucleotide bases in tRNA which recognizes a codon in mRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence of three nucleotide bases in tRNA which recognizes a codon in mRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CCA_tail
owl:Class.obo:def: Base sequence at the 3' end of a tRNA. The 3'-hydroxyl group on the terminal adenosine is the attachment point for the amino acid.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Base sequence at the 3' end of a tRNA. The 3'-hydroxyl group on the terminal adenosine is the attachment point for the amino acid.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DHU_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: Non-base-paired sequence of nucleotide bases in tRNA. It contains several dihydrouracil residues.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Non-base-paired sequence of nucleotide bases in tRNA. It contains several dihydrouracil residues.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: T_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: Non-base-paired sequence of three nucleotide bases in tRNA. It has sequence T-Psi-C.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Non-base-paired sequence of three nucleotide bases in tRNA. It has sequence T-Psi-C.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pyrrolysine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding pyrrolysyl tRNA (SO:0000766).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding pyrrolysyl tRNA (SO:0000766).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U3_snoRNA
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The definition is most of the old definition for snoRNA (SO:0000275).
owl:Class.obo:def: U3 snoRNA is a member of the box C/D class of small nucleolar RNAs. The U3 snoRNA secondary structure is characterised by a small 5' domain (with boxes A and A'), and a larger 3' domain (with boxes B, C, C', and D), the two domains being linked by a single-stranded hinge. Boxes B and C form the B/C motif, which appears to be exclusive to U3 snoRNAs, and boxes C' and D form the C'/D motif. The latter is functionally similar to the C/D motifs found in other snoRNAs. The 5' domain and the hinge region act as a pre-rRNA-binding domain. The 3' domain has conserved protein-binding sites. Both the box B/C and box C'/D motifs are sufficient for nuclear retention of U3 snoRNA. The box C'/D motif is also necessary for nucleolar localization, stability and hypermethylation of U3 snoRNA. Both box B/C and C'/D motifs are involved in specific protein interactions and are necessary for the rRNA processing functions of U3 snoRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: U3 snoRNA is a member of the box C/D class of small nucleolar RNAs. The U3 snoRNA secondary structure is characterised by a small 5' domain (with boxes A and A'), and a larger 3' domain (with boxes B, C, C', and D), the two domains being linked by a single-stranded hinge. Boxes B and C form the B/C motif, which appears to be exclusive to U3 snoRNAs, and boxes C' and D form the C'/D motif. The latter is functionally similar to the C/D motifs found in other snoRNAs. The 5' domain and the hinge region act as a pre-rRNA-binding domain. The 3' domain has conserved protein-binding sites. Both the box B/C and box C'/D motifs are sufficient for nuclear retention of U3 snoRNA. The box C'/D motif is also necessary for nucleolar localization, stability and hypermethylation of U3 snoRNA. Both box B/C and C'/D motifs are involved in specific protein interactions and are necessary for the rRNA processing functions of U3 snoRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: AU_rich_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A cis-acting element found in the 3' UTR of some mRNA which is rich in AUUUA pentamers. Messenger RNAs bearing multiple AU-rich elements are often unstable.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cis-acting element found in the 3' UTR of some mRNA which is rich in AUUUA pentamers. Messenger RNAs bearing multiple AU-rich elements are often unstable.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Bruno_response_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A cis-acting element found in the 3' UTR of some mRNA which is bound by the Drosophila Bruno protein and its homologs.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Not to be confused with BRE_motif (SO:0000016), which binds transcription factor II B.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cis-acting element found in the 3' UTR of some mRNA which is bound by the Drosophila Bruno protein and its homologs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: iron_responsive_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A regulatory sequence found in the 5' and 3' UTRs of many mRNAs which encode iron-binding proteins. It has a hairpin structure and is recognized by trans-acting proteins known as iron-regulatory proteins.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regulatory sequence found in the 5' and 3' UTRs of many mRNAs which encode iron-binding proteins. It has a hairpin structure and is recognized by trans-acting proteins known as iron-regulatory proteins.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: morpholino_backbone
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence composed of nucleobases bound to a morpholino backbone. A morpholino backbone consists of morpholine (CHEBI:34856) rings connected by phosphorodiamidate linkages.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Do not use this for feature annotation. Use morpholino_oligo (SO:0000034) instead.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence composed of nucleobases bound to a morpholino backbone. A morpholino backbone consists of morpholine (CHEBI:34856) rings connected by phosphorodiamidate linkages.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: PNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence composed of peptide nucleic acid (CHEBI:48021), a chemical consisting of nucleobases bound to a backbone composed of repeating N-(2-aminoethyl)-glycine units linked by peptide bonds. The purine and pyrimidine bases are linked to the backbone by methylene carbonyl bonds.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Do not use this term for feature annotation. Use PNA_oligo (SO:0001011) instead.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence composed of peptide nucleic acid (CHEBI:48021), a chemical consisting of nucleobases bound to a backbone composed of repeating N-(2-aminoethyl)-glycine units linked by peptide bonds. The purine and pyrimidine bases are linked to the backbone by methylene carbonyl bonds.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: enzymatic
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing the sequence of a transcript that has catalytic activity with or without an associated ribonucleoprotein.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Do not use this for feature annotation. Use enzymatic_RNA (SO:0000372) instead.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing the sequence of a transcript that has catalytic activity with or without an associated ribonucleoprotein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ribozymic
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing the sequence of a transcript that has catalytic activity even without an associated ribonucleoprotein.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Do not use this for feature annotation. Use ribozyme (SO:0000374) instead.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing the sequence of a transcript that has catalytic activity even without an associated ribonucleoprotein.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudouridylation_guide_snoRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A snoRNA that specifies the site of pseudouridylation in an RNA molecule by base pairing with a short sequence around the target residue.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Has RNA pseudouridylation guide activity (GO:0030558).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A snoRNA that specifies the site of pseudouridylation in an RNA molecule by base pairing with a short sequence around the target residue.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: LNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases attached to a repeating unit made of 'locked' deoxyribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone. The deoxyribose unit's conformation is 'locked' by a 2'-C,4'-C-oxymethylene link.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases attached to a repeating unit made of 'locked' deoxyribose rings connected to a phosphate backbone. The deoxyribose unit's conformation is 'locked' by a 2'-C,4'-C-oxymethylene link.

owl:Class.obo:def: An oligo composed of LNA residues.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases attached to a repeating unit made of threose rings connected to a phosphate backbone.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Do not use this term for feature annotation. Use TNA_oligo (SO:0001191) instead.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases attached to a repeating unit made of threose rings connected to a phosphate backbone.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TNA_oligo
owl:Class.obo:def: An oligo composed of TNA residues.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An oligo composed of TNA residues.

owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence consisting of nucleobases attached to a repeating unit made of an acyclic three-carbon propylene glycol connected to a phosphate backbone. It has two enantiomeric forms, (R)-GNA and (S)-GNA.

owl:Class.obo:def: An oligo composed of GNA residues.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: S_GNA_oligo
owl:Class.obo:def: An oligo composed of (S)-GNA residues.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An oligo composed of (S)-GNA residues.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ds_DNA_viral_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A ds_DNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as double stranded DNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A ds_DNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as double stranded DNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ss_RNA_viral_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A ss_RNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as single stranded RNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A ss_RNA_viral_sequence is a viral_sequence that is the sequence of a virus that exists as single stranded RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: negative_sense_ssRNA_viral_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A negative_sense_RNA_viral_sequence is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus that is complementary to mRNA and must be converted to positive sense RNA by RNA polymerase before translation.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: negative sense single stranded RNA virus

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A negative_sense_RNA_viral_sequence is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus that is complementary to mRNA and must be converted to positive sense RNA by RNA polymerase before translation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: positive_sense_ssRNA_viral_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A positive_sense_RNA_viral_sequence is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus that can be immediately translated by the host.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: positive sense single stranded RNA virus

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A positive_sense_RNA_viral_sequence is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus that can be immediately translated by the host.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ambisense_ssRNA_viral_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A ambisense_RNA_virus is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus with both messenger and anti messenger polarity.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A ambisense_RNA_virus is a ss_RNA_viral_sequence that is the sequence of a single stranded RNA virus with both messenger and anti messenger polarity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RNA_polymerase_promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A region (DNA) to which RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region (DNA) to which RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Phage_RNA_Polymerase_Promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A region (DNA) to which Bacteriophage RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region (DNA) to which Bacteriophage RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SP6_RNA_Polymerase_Promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A region (DNA) to which the SP6 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region (DNA) to which the SP6 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: T3_RNA_Polymerase_Promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA sequence to which the T3 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA sequence to which the T3 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: T7_RNA_Polymerase_Promoter
owl:Class.obo:def: A region (DNA) to which the T7 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region (DNA) to which the T7 RNA polymerase binds, to begin transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_EST
owl:Class.obo:def: An EST read from the 5' end of a transcript that usually codes for a protein. These regions tend to be conserved across species and do not change much within a gene family.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An EST read from the 5' end of a transcript that usually codes for a protein. These regions tend to be conserved across species and do not change much within a gene family.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_EST
owl:Class.obo:def: An EST read from the 3' end of a transcript. They are more likely to fall within non-coding, or untranslated regions(UTRs).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An EST read from the 3' end of a transcript. They are more likely to fall within non-coding, or untranslated regions(UTRs).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: translational_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of mRNA (not divisible by 3 bases) that is skipped during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of mRNA (not divisible by 3 bases) that is skipped during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: plus_1_translational_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of mRNA 1 base long that is skipped during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of mRNA 1 base long that is skipped during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: plus_2_translational_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of mRNA 2 bases long that is skipped during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of mRNA 2 bases long that is skipped during the process of translational frameshifting (GO:0006452), causing the reading frame to be different.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: group_III_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: Group III introns are introns found in the mRNA of the plastids of euglenoid protists. They are spliced by a two step transesterification with bulged adenosine as initiating nucleophile.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Group III introns are introns found in the mRNA of the plastids of euglenoid protists. They are spliced by a two step transesterification with bulged adenosine as initiating nucleophile.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: noncoding_region_of_exon
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An exon either containing but not starting with a start codon or containing but not ending with a stop codon will be partially coding and partially non coding.
owl:Class.obo:def: The maximal intersection of exon and UTR.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The maximal intersection of exon and UTR.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: coding_region_of_exon
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An exon containing either a start or stop codon will be partially coding and partially non coding.
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of an exon that encodes for protein sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of an exon that encodes for protein sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: endonuclease_spliced_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: An intron that spliced via endonucleolytic cleavage and ligation rather than transesterification.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intron that spliced via endonucleolytic cleavage and ligation rather than transesterification.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transgenic_insertion
owl:Class.obo:def: An insertion that derives from another organism, via the use of recombinant DNA technology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An insertion that derives from another organism, via the use of recombinant DNA technology.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: silenced_by_RNA_interference
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by RNA interference.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: RNA interference is GO:0016246.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by RNA interference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: silenced_by_histone_modification
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone modification.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Histone modification is GO:0016570.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone modification.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: silenced_by_histone_methylation
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone methylation.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Histone methylation is GO:0016571.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone methylation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: silenced_by_histone_deacetylation
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone deacetylation.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Histone deacetylation is GO:0016573.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing an epigenetic process where a gene is inactivated by histone deacetylation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_silenced_by_RNA_interference
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is silenced by RNA interference.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is silenced by RNA interference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_silenced_by_histone_modification
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is silenced by histone modification.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is silenced by histone modification.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_silenced_by_histone_methylation
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is silenced by histone methylation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is silenced by histone methylation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_silenced_by_histone_deacetylation
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is silenced by histone deacetylation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is silenced by histone deacetylation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: dihydrouridine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified RNA base in which the 5,6-dihydrouracil is bound to the ribose ring.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: D
A modified RNA base in which the 5,6-dihydrouracil is bound to the ribose ring.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudouridine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified RNA base in which the 5- position of the uracil is bound to the ribose ring instead of the 4- position.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The free molecule is CHEBI:17802.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified RNA base in which the 5- position of the uracil is bound to the ribose ring instead of the 4- position.
Y

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inosine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified RNA base in which hypoxanthine is bound to the ribose ring.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The free molecule is CHEBI:17596.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified RNA base in which hypoxanthine is bound to the ribose ring.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: seven_methylguanine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified RNA base in which guanine is methylated at the 7- position.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The free molecule is CHEBI:2274.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified RNA base in which guanine is methylated at the 7- position.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ribothymidine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified RNA base in which thymine is bound to the ribose ring.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The free molecule is CHEBI:30832.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified RNA base in which thymine is bound to the ribose ring.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: methylinosine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified RNA base in which methylhypoxanthine is bound to the ribose ring.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified RNA base in which methylhypoxanthine is bound to the ribose ring.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mobile
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a feature that has either intra-genome or intracellular mobility.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a feature that has either intra-genome or intracellular mobility.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: replicon
owl:Class.obo:def: A region containing at least one unique origin of replication and a unique termination site.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region containing at least one unique origin of replication and a unique termination site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: base
owl:Class.obo:def: A base is a sequence feature that corresponds to a single unit of a nucleotide polymer.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A base is a sequence feature that corresponds to a single unit of a nucleotide polymer.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: amino_acid
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence feature that corresponds to a single amino acid residue in a polypeptide.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Probably in the future this will cross reference to Chebi.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence feature that corresponds to a single amino acid residue in a polypeptide.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TSS_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The region of a gene from the 5' most TSS to the 3' TSS.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The region of a gene from the 5' most TSS to the 3' TSS.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: miRNA_primary_transcript_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A part of an miRNA primary_transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A part of an miRNA primary_transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pre_miRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The 60-70 nucleotide region remain after Drosha processing of the primary transcript, that folds back upon itself to form a hairpin structure.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The 60-70 nucleotide region remain after Drosha processing of the primary transcript, that folds back upon itself to form a hairpin structure.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: miRNA_stem
owl:Class.obo:def: The stem of the hairpin loop formed by folding of the pre-miRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The stem of the hairpin loop formed by folding of the pre-miRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: miRNA_loop
owl:Class.obo:def: The loop of the hairpin loop formed by folding of the pre-miRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The loop of the hairpin loop formed by folding of the pre-miRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: synthetic_oligo
owl:Class.obo:def: An oligo composed of synthetic nucleotides.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An oligo composed of synthetic nucleotides.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: assembly
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of the genome of known length that is composed by ordering and aligning two or more different regions.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of the genome of known length that is composed by ordering and aligning two or more different regions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: fragment_assembly
owl:Class.obo:def: A fragment assembly is a genome assembly that orders overlapping fragments of the genome based on landmark sequences. The base pair distance between the landmarks is known allowing additivity of lengths.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A fragment assembly is a genome assembly that orders overlapping fragments of the genome based on landmark sequences. The base pair distance between the landmarks is known allowing additivity of lengths.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: fingerprint_map
owl:Class.obo:def: A fingerprint_map is a physical map composed of restriction fragments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A fingerprint_map is a physical map composed of restriction fragments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: STS_map
owl:Class.obo:def: An STS map is a physical map organized by the unique STS landmarks.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An STS map is a physical map organized by the unique STS landmarks.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RH_map
owl:Class.obo:def: A radiation hybrid map is a physical map.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A radiation hybrid map is a physical map.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sonicate_fragment
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA fragment generated by sonication. Sonication is a technique used to sheer DNA into smaller fragments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA fragment generated by sonication. Sonication is a technique used to sheer DNA into smaller fragments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polyploid
owl:Class.obo:def: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is an exact multiple of the haploid number and is greater than the diploid number.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is an exact multiple of the haploid number and is greater than the diploid number.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: autopolyploid
owl:Class.obo:def: A polyploid where the multiple chromosome set was derived from the same organism.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A polyploid where the multiple chromosome set was derived from the same organism.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: allopolyploid
owl:Class.obo:def: A polyploid where the multiple chromosome set was derived from a different organism.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A polyploid where the multiple chromosome set was derived from a different organism.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: homing_endonuclease_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The binding site (recognition site) of a homing endonuclease. The binding site is typically large.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The binding site (recognition site) of a homing endonuclease. The binding site is typically large.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: octamer_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters with sequence ATTGCAT that binds Pou-domain transcription factors.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence element characteristic of some RNA polymerase II promoters with sequence ATTGCAT that binds Pou-domain transcription factors.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: apicoplast_chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome originating in an apicoplast.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome originating in an apicoplast.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_collection
owl:Class.obo:def: A collection of discontinuous sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A collection of discontinuous sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: overlapping_feature_set
owl:Class.obo:def: A continuous region of sequence composed of the overlapping of multiple sequence_features, which ultimately provides evidence for another sequence_feature.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This feature was requested by Nicole, tracker id 1911479. It is required to gather evidence together for annotation. An example would be overlapping ESTs that support an mRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A continuous region of sequence composed of the overlapping of multiple sequence_features, which ultimately provides evidence for another sequence_feature.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: overlapping_EST_set
owl:Class.obo:def: A continous experimental result region extending the length of multiple overlapping EST's.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A continous experimental result region extending the length of multiple overlapping EST's.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: modified_adenosine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified adenine is an adenine base feature that has been altered.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified adenine is an adenine base feature that has been altered.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: modified_inosine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified inosine is an inosine base feature that has been altered.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified inosine is an inosine base feature that has been altered.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: modified_cytidine
owl:Class.obo:def: A modified cytidine is a cytidine base feature which has been altered.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A modified cytidine is a cytidine base feature which has been altered.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: one_methylinosine
owl:Class.obo:def: 1-methylinosine is a modified inosine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: m1I
1-methylinosine is a modified inosine.

owl:Class.obo:def: 1,2'-O-dimethylinosine is a modified inosine.

owl:Class.obo:def: 2'-O-methylinosine is a modified inosine.

owl:Class.obo:def: N4-methylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

owl:Class.obo:def: 5-hydroxymethylcytidine is a modified cytidine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: biomaterial_region

owl:Class.rdfs:label: experimental_feature
owl:Class.obo:def: A region which is the result of some arbitrary experimental procedure. The procedure may be carried out with biological material or inside a computer.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: biological_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region defined by its disposition to be involved in a biological process.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region defined by its disposition to be involved in a biological process.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: topologically_defined_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region that is defined according to its relations with other regions within the same sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region that is defined according to its relations with other regions within the same sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: translocation_breakpoint
owl:Class.obo:def: The point within a chromosome where a translocation begins or ends.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The point within a chromosome where a translocation begins or ends.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insertion_breakpoint
owl:Class.obo:def: The point within a chromosome where a insertion begins or ends.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The point within a chromosome where a insertion begins or ends.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: deletion_breakpoint
owl:Class.obo:def: The point within a chromosome where a deletion begins or ends.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The point within a chromosome where a deletion begins or ends.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_flanking_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A flanking region located five prime of a specific region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A flanking region located five prime of a specific region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_flanking_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A flanking region located three prime of a specific region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A flanking region located three prime of a specific region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcribed_fragment
owl:Class.obo:def: An experimental region, defined by a tiling array experiment to be transcribed at some level.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Term requested by the MODencode group.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An experimental region, defined by a tiling array experiment to be transcribed at some level.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cis_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Intronic 2 bp region bordering exon. A splice_site that adjacent_to exon and overlaps intron.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Intronic 2 bp region bordering exon. A splice_site that adjacent_to exon and overlaps intron.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: trans_splice_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Primary transcript region bordering trans-splice junction.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Primary transcript region bordering trans-splice junction.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: splice_junction
owl:Class.obo:def: The boundary between an intron and an exon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The boundary between an intron and an exon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: conformational_switch
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a polypeptide, involved in the transition from one conformational state to another.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: MM Young, K Kirshenbaum, KA Dill & S Highsmith. Predicting conformational switches in proteins. Protein Science, 1999, 8, 1752-64. K. Kirshenbaum, M.M. Young and S. Highsmith. Predicting Allosteric Switches in Myosins. Protein Science 8(9):1806-1815. 1999.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a polypeptide, involved in the transition from one conformational state to another.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: dye_terminator_read
owl:Class.obo:def: A read produced by the dye terminator method of sequencing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A read produced by the dye terminator method of sequencing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pyrosequenced_read
owl:Class.obo:def: A read produced by pyrosequencing technology.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An example is a read produced by Roche 454 technology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A read produced by pyrosequencing technology.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ligation_based_read
owl:Class.obo:def: A read produced by ligation based sequencing technologies.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An example of this kind of read is one produced by ABI SOLiD.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A read produced by ligation based sequencing technologies.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polymerase_synthesis_read
owl:Class.obo:def: A read produced by the polymerase based sequence by synthesis method.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: An example is a read produced by Illumina technology.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A read produced by the polymerase based sequence by synthesis method.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cis_regulatory_frameshift_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A structural region in an RNA molecule which promotes ribosomal frameshifting of cis coding sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A structural region in an RNA molecule which promotes ribosomal frameshifting of cis coding sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: expressed_sequence_assembly
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence assembly derived from expressed sequences.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: From tracker [ 2372385 ] expressed_sequence_assembly.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence assembly derived from expressed sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DNA_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with DNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A binding site that, in the molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with DNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cryptic_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is not transcribed under normal conditions and is not critical to normal cellular functioning.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is not transcribed under normal conditions and is not critical to normal cellular functioning.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_polyadenylation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_RACE_clone
owl:Class.obo:def: A three prime RACE (Rapid Amplification of cDNA Ends) clone is a cDNA clone copied from the 3' end of an mRNA (using a poly-dT primer to capture the polyA tail and a gene-specific or randomly primed 5' primer), and spliced into a vector for propagation in a suitable host.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A three prime RACE (Rapid Amplification of cDNA Ends) clone is a cDNA clone copied from the 3' end of an mRNA (using a poly-dT primer to capture the polyA tail and a gene-specific or randomly primed 5' primer), and spliced into a vector for propagation in a suitable host.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cassette_pseudogene
owl:Class.obo:def: A cassette pseudogene is a kind of gene in an inactive form which may recombine at a telomeric locus to form a functional copy.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by the Trypanosome community.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A cassette pseudogene is a kind of gene in an inactive form which may recombine at a telomeric locus to form a functional copy.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A place holder for a cross product with chebi.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Ala

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A place holder for a cross product with chebi.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A place holder for a cross product with chebi.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A place holder for a cross product with chebi.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A place holder for a cross product with chebi.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Pyl
