owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcribed_cluster
owl:Class.obo:def: A region defined by a set of transcribed sequences from the same gene or expressed pseudogene.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term was requested by Jeff Bowes, using the tracker, ID = 2594157.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region defined by a set of transcribed sequences from the same gene or expressed pseudogene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: unigene_cluster
owl:Class.obo:def: A kind of transcribed_cluster defined by a set of transcribed sequences from the a unique gene.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term was requested by Jeff Bowes, using the tracker, ID = 2594157.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of transcribed_cluster defined by a set of transcribed sequences from the a unique gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CRISPR
owl:Class.obo:def: Clustered Palindromic Repeats interspersed with bacteriophage derived spacer sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Clustered Palindromic Repeats interspersed with bacteriophage derived spacer sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insulator_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A binding site that, in an insulator region of a nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: See tracker ID 2060908.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A binding site that, in an insulator region of a nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: enhancer_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A binding site that, in the enhancer region of a nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A binding site that, in the enhancer region of a nucleotide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with polypeptide residues.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: contig_collection
owl:Class.obo:def: A collection of contigs.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: See tracker ID: 2138359.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A collection of contigs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: lincRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A multiexonic non-coding RNA transcribed by RNA polymerase II.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A multiexonic non-coding RNA transcribed by RNA polymerase II.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: UST
owl:Class.obo:def: An EST spanning part or all of the untranslated regions of a protein-coding transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An EST spanning part or all of the untranslated regions of a protein-coding transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_UST
owl:Class.obo:def: A UST located in the 3'UTR of a protein-coding transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A UST located in the 3'UTR of a protein-coding transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_UST
owl:Class.obo:def: An UST located in the 5'UTR of a protein-coding transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An UST located in the 5'UTR of a protein-coding transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RST
owl:Class.obo:def: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_RST
owl:Class.obo:def: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a 3'-RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a 3'-RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_RST
owl:Class.obo:def: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a 5'-RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tag produced from a single sequencing read from a 5'-RACE product; typically a few hundred base pairs long.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: UST_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match against an UST sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match against an UST sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RST_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match against an RST sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match against an RST sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: primer_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A nucleotide match to a primer sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A nucleotide match to a primer sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: miRNA_antiguide
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of the pri miRNA that base pairs with the guide to form the hairpin.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of the pri miRNA that base pairs with the guide to form the hairpin.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: trans_splice_junction
owl:Class.obo:def: The boundary between the spliced leader and the first exon of the mRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The boundary between the spliced leader and the first exon of the mRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: outron
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a primary transcript, that is removed via trans splicing.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a primary transcript, that is removed via trans splicing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: natural_plasmid
owl:Class.obo:def: A plasmid that occurs naturally.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A plasmid that occurs naturally.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_trap_construct
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and produce a fusion transcript between exons of the gene into which it inserts and a reporter element in the construct. Gene traps contain a splice acceptor, do not contain promoter elements for the reporter, and are mutagenic. Gene traps may be bicistronic with the second cassette containing a promoter driving an a selectable marker.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and produce a fusion transcript between exons of the gene into which it inserts and a reporter element in the construct. Gene traps contain a splice acceptor, do not contain promoter elements for the reporter, and are mutagenic. Gene traps may be bicistronic with the second cassette containing a promoter driving an a selectable marker.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: promoter_trap_construct
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and express a reporter when inserted in close proximity to a promoter element. Promoter traps typically do not contain promoter elements and are mutagenic.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and express a reporter when inserted in close proximity to a promoter element. Promoter traps typically do not contain promoter elements and are mutagenic.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: enhancer_trap_construct
owl:Class.obo:def: An enhancer trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and express a reporter when the expression from a basic minimal promoter is enhanced by genomic enhancer elements. Enhancer traps contain promoter elements and are not usually mutagenic.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An enhancer trap construct is a type of engineered plasmid which is designed to integrate into a genome and express a reporter when the expression from a basic minimal promoter is enhanced by genomic enhancer elements. Enhancer traps contain promoter elements and are not usually mutagenic.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: PAC_end
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence from the end of a PAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence from the end of a PAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: RAPD
owl:Class.obo:def: RAPD is a 'PCR product' where a sequence variant is identified through the use of PCR with random primers.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: RAPD is a 'PCR product' where a sequence variant is identified through the use of PCR with random primers.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SNV
owl:Class.obo:def: SNVs are single nucleotide positions in genomic DNA at which different sequence alternatives exist.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: SNVs are single nucleotide positions in genomic DNA at which different sequence alternatives exist.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: X_element_combinatorial_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: An X element combinatorial repeat is a repeat region located between the X element and the telomere or adjacent Y' element.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: X element combinatorial repeats contain Tbf1p binding sites,nand possible functions include a role in telomerase-independent telomerenmaintenance via recombination or as a barrier against transcriptionalnsilencing. These are usually present as a combination of one or more ofnseveral types of smaller elements (designated A, B, C, or D). This term was requested 2009-10-16 by Michel Dumontier, tracker id 2880747.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An X element combinatorial repeat is a repeat region located between the X element and the telomere or adjacent Y' element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Y_prime_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A Y' element is a repeat region (SO:0000657) located adjacent to telomeric repeats or X element combinatorial repeats, either as a single copy or tandem repeat of two to four copies.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term was requested 2009-10-16 by Michel Dumontier, tracker id 2880747.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A Y' element is a repeat region (SO:0000657) located adjacent to telomeric repeats or X element combinatorial repeats, either as a single copy or tandem repeat of two to four copies.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: standard_draft
owl:Class.obo:def: The status of a whole genome sequence, where the data is minimally filtered or un-filtered, from any number of sequencing platforms, and is assembled into contigs. Genome sequence of this quality may harbour regions of poor quality and can be relatively incomplete.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The status of a whole genome sequence, where the data is minimally filtered or un-filtered, from any number of sequencing platforms, and is assembled into contigs. Genome sequence of this quality may harbour regions of poor quality and can be relatively incomplete.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: high_quality_draft
owl:Class.obo:def: The status of a whole genome sequence, where overall coverage represents at least 90 percent of the genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The status of a whole genome sequence, where overall coverage represents at least 90 percent of the genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: improved_high_quality_draft
owl:Class.obo:def: The status of a whole genome sequence, where additional work has been performed, using either manual or automated methods, such as gap resolution.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The status of a whole genome sequence, where additional work has been performed, using either manual or automated methods, such as gap resolution.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: annotation_directed_improved_draft
owl:Class.obo:def: The status of a whole genome sequence,where annotation, and verification of coding regions has occurred.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The status of a whole genome sequence,where annotation, and verification of coding regions has occurred.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: noncontiguous_finished
owl:Class.obo:def: The status of a whole genome sequence, where the assembly is high quality, closure approaches have been successful for most gaps, misassemblies and low quality regions.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The status of a whole genome sequence, where the assembly is high quality, closure approaches have been successful for most gaps, misassemblies and low quality regions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: finished_genome
owl:Class.obo:def: The status of a whole genome sequence, with less than 1 error per 100,000 base pairs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The status of a whole genome sequence, with less than 1 error per 100,000 base pairs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intronic_regulatory_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A regulatory region that is part of an intron.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regulatory region that is part of an intron.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: centromere_DNA_Element_I
owl:Class.obo:def: A centromere DNA Element I (CDEI) is a conserved region, part of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region composed of 8-11bp which enables binding by the centromere binding factor 1(Cbf1p).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term was requested 2009-10-16 by Michel Dumontier, tracker id 2880699.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A centromere DNA Element I (CDEI) is a conserved region, part of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region composed of 8-11bp which enables binding by the centromere binding factor 1(Cbf1p).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: centromere_DNA_Element_II
owl:Class.obo:def: A centromere DNA Element II (CDEII) is part a conserved region of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region that is AT-rich and ~ 75-100 bp in length.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term was requested 2009-10-16 by Michel Dumontier, tracker id 2880699.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A centromere DNA Element II (CDEII) is part a conserved region of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region that is AT-rich and ~ 75-100 bp in length.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: centromere_DNA_Element_III
owl:Class.obo:def: A centromere DNA Element I (CDEI) is a conserved region, part of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region that consists of a 25-bp which enables binding by the centromere DNA binding factor 3 (CBF3) complex.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term was requested 2009-10-16 by Michel Dumontier, tracker id 2880699.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A centromere DNA Element I (CDEI) is a conserved region, part of the centromere, consisting of a consensus region that consists of a 25-bp which enables binding by the centromere DNA binding factor 3 (CBF3) complex.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: telomeric_repeat
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The repeats are maintained by telomerase and there is generally 300 (+/-) 75 bp of TG(1-3) at a given end. Telomeric repeats function in completing chromosome replication and protecting the ends from degradation and end-to-end fusions. This term was requested 2009-10-16 by Michel Dumontier, tracker id 2880739.
owl:Class.obo:def: The telomeric repeat is a repeat region, part of the chromosome, which in yeast, is a G-rich terminal sequence of the form (TG(1-3))n or more precisely ((TG)(1-6)TG(2-3))n.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The telomeric repeat is a repeat region, part of the chromosome, which in yeast, is a G-rich terminal sequence of the form (TG(1-3))n or more precisely ((TG)(1-6)TG(2-3))n.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: X_element
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Possible functions include roles in chromosomal segregation,nmaintenance of chromosome stability, recombinational sequestering, or as anbarrier to transcriptional silencing. This term was requested 2009-10-16 by Michel Dumontier, tracker id 2880747. nnFrom Janos Demeter: The only region shared by all chromosome ends, the X element core sequence is a small conserved element (~475 bp) that contains an ARS sequence and in most cases an Abf1p binding site. Between these is a GC-rich region nearly identical to the meiosis-specific regulatory sequence URS1.
owl:Class.obo:def: The X element is a conserved region, of the telomere, of ~475 bp that contains an ARS sequence and in most cases an Abf1p binding site.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The X element is a conserved region, of the telomere, of ~475 bp that contains an ARS sequence and in most cases an Abf1p binding site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: YAC_end
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence from the end of a YAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence from the end of a YAC clone that may provide a highly specific marker.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: whole_genome_sequence_status
owl:Class.obo:def: The status of whole genome sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This terms and children were added to SO in response to tracker request by Patrick Chain. The paper Genome Project Standards in a New Era of Sequencing. Science October 9th 2009, addresses these terms.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The status of whole genome sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: heritable_phenotypic_marker
owl:Class.obo:def: A biological_region characterized as a single heritable trait in a phenotype screen. The heritable phenotype may be mapped to a chromosome but generally has not been characterized to a specific gene locus.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A biological_region characterized as a single heritable trait in a phenotype screen. The heritable phenotype may be mapped to a chromosome but generally has not been characterized to a specific gene locus.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: peptide_collection
owl:Class.obo:def: A collection of peptide sequences.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Term requested via tracker ID: 2910829.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A collection of peptide sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: high_identity_region
owl:Class.obo:def: An experimental feature with high sequence identity to another sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by tracker ID: 2902685.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An experimental feature with high sequence identity to another sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: processed_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript for which no open reading frame has been identified and for which no other function has been determined.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Ensembl and Vega also use this term name. Requested by Howard Deen of MGI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript for which no open reading frame has been identified and for which no other function has been determined.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: assortment_derived_variation
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome variation derived from an event during meiosis.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome variation derived from an event during meiosis.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: reference_genome
owl:Class.obo:def: A collection of sequences (often chromosomes) taken as the standard for a given organism and genome assembly.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A collection of sequences (often chromosomes) taken as the standard for a given organism and genome assembly.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: variant_genome
owl:Class.obo:def: A collection of sequences (often chromosomes) of an individual.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A collection of sequences (often chromosomes) of an individual.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: variant_collection
owl:Class.obo:def: A collection of one or more sequences of an individual.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A collection of one or more sequences of an individual.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insertion_attribute
owl:Class.obo:def: A quality of a chromosomal insertion,.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: direct
owl:Class.obo:def: A quality of an insertion where the insert is not in a cytologically inverted orientation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inverted
owl:Class.obo:def: A quality of an insertion where the insert is in a cytologically inverted orientation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: assembly_error_correction

owl:Class.rdfs:label: initiator_codon_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the first codon of a transcript.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This is being used to annotate changes to the first codon of a transcript, when the first annotated codon is not to methionine. A variant is predicted to change the first amino acid of a translation irrespective of the fact that the underlying codon is an AUG. As such for transcripts with an incomplete CDS (sequence does not start with an AUG), it is still called.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the first codon of a transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: missense_variant

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mathematically_defined_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: A mathematically defined repeat (MDR) is a experimental feature that is determined by querying overlapping oligomers of length k against a database of shotgun sequence data and identifying regions in the query sequence that exceed a statistically determined threshold of repetitiveness.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Mathematically defined repeat regions are determined without regard to the biological origin of the repetitive region. The repeat units of a MDR are the overlapping oligomers of size k that were used to for the query. Tools that can annotate mathematically defined repeats include Tallymer (Kurtz et al 2008, BMC Genomics: 517) and RePS (Wang et al, Genome Res 12(5): 824-831.).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mathematically defined repeat (MDR) is a experimental feature that is determined by querying overlapping oligomers of length k against a database of shotgun sequence data and identifying regions in the query sequence that exceed a statistically determined threshold of repetitiveness.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_non_canonical_start_codon
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene with a start codon other than AUG.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by flybase, Dec 2010.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: gene with non canonical start codon

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene with a start codon other than AUG.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_with_start_codon_CUG
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene with a translational start codon of CUG.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by flybase, Dec 2010.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene with a translational start codon of CUG.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pseudogenic_gene_segment
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene segment which when incorporated by somatic recombination in the final gene transcript results in a nonfunctional product.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene segment which when incorporated by somatic recombination in the final gene transcript results in a nonfunctional product.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: copy_number_gain
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence alteration whereby the copy number of a given regions is greater than the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: gain
A sequence alteration whereby the copy number of a given regions is greater than the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: copy_number_loss
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence alteration whereby the copy number of a given region is less than the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence alteration whereby the copy number of a given region is less than the reference sequence.
loss

owl:Class.rdfs:label: UPD
owl:Class.obo:def: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from one parent and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the other parent.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from one parent and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the other parent.
UPD

owl:Class.rdfs:label: maternal_uniparental_disomy
owl:Class.obo:def: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from the mother and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the father.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from the mother and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the father.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: paternal_uniparental_disomy
owl:Class.obo:def: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from the father and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the mother.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Uniparental disomy is a sequence_alteration where a diploid individual receives two copies for all or part of a chromosome from the father and no copies of the same chromosome or region from the mother.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: open_chromatin_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA sequence that in the normal state of the chromosome corresponds to an unfolded, un-complexed stretch of double-stranded DNA.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by John Calley 3125900.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA sequence that in the normal state of the chromosome corresponds to an unfolded, un-complexed stretch of double-stranded DNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SL3_acceptor_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL3 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL3 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

owl:Class.obo:def: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL8 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL8 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

owl:Class.obo:def: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL9 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL9 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

owl:Class.obo:def: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL10 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL10 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

owl:Class.obo:def: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL11 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL11 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

owl:Class.obo:def: A SL2_acceptor_site which appends the SL12 RNA leader sequence to the 5' end of an mRNA. SL12 acceptor sites occur in genes in internal segments of polycistronic transcripts.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: duplicated_pseudogene
owl:Class.obo:def: A pseudogene that arose via gene duplication. Generally duplicated pseudogenes have the same structure as the original gene, including intron-exon structure and some regulatory sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A pseudogene that arose via gene duplication. Generally duplicated pseudogenes have the same structure as the original gene, including intron-exon structure and some regulatory sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: unitary_pseudogene
owl:Class.obo:def: A pseudogene, deactivated from original state by mutation, fixed in a population.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This is different from a non processed pseudogene because the gene was not duplicated. An example is the L-gulono-lactone oxidase pseudogene in primates.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A pseudogene, deactivated from original state by mutation, fixed in a population.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_processed_pseudogene
owl:Class.obo:def: A pseudogene that arose from a means other than retrotransposition.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A pseudogene that arose from a means other than retrotransposition.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: variant_quality
owl:Class.obo:def: A dependent entity that inheres in a bearer, a sequence variant.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A dependent entity that inheres in a bearer, a sequence variant.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: variant_origin
owl:Class.obo:def: A quality inhering in a variant by virtue of its origin.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A quality inhering in a variant by virtue of its origin.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: variant_frequency
owl:Class.obo:def: A physical quality which inheres to the variant by virtue of the number instances of the variant within a population.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A physical quality which inheres to the variant by virtue of the number instances of the variant within a population.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: unique_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A physical quality which inheres to the variant by virtue of the number instances of the variant within a population.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A physical quality which inheres to the variant by virtue of the number instances of the variant within a population.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: variant_phenotype
owl:Class.obo:def: A quality inhering in a variant by virtue of its phenotype.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A quality inhering in a variant by virtue of its phenotype.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TF_binding_site_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant located within a transcription factor binding site.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant located within a transcription factor binding site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: complex_structural_alteration
owl:Class.obo:def: A structural sequence alteration or rearrangement encompassing one or more genome fragments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A structural sequence alteration or rearrangement encompassing one or more genome fragments.
complex

owl:Class.rdfs:label: loss_of_heterozygosity
owl:Class.obo:def: A functional variant whereby the sequence alteration causes a loss of function of one allele of a gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A functional variant whereby the sequence alteration causes a loss of function of one allele of a gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: splice_donor_5th_base_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that causes a change at the 5th base pair after the start of the intron in the orientation of the transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that causes a change at the 5th base pair after the start of the intron in the orientation of the transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U_box
owl:Class.obo:def: An U-box is a conserved T-rich region upstream of a retroviral polypurine tract that is involved in PPT primer creation during reverse transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An U-box is a conserved T-rich region upstream of a retroviral polypurine tract that is involved in PPT primer creation during reverse transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mating_type_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A specialized region in the genomes of some yeast and fungi, the genes of which regulate mating type.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A specialized region in the genomes of some yeast and fungi, the genes of which regulate mating type.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: paired_end_fragment
owl:Class.obo:def: An assembly region that has been sequenced from both ends resulting in a read_pair (mate_pair).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An assembly region that has been sequenced from both ends resulting in a read_pair (mate_pair).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: exon_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that changes exon sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: ANNOVAR:exonic
snpEff:EXON
VAAST:exon_variant
A sequence variant that changes exon sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: non_coding_transcript_exon_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that changes non-coding exon sequence in a non-coding transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that changes non-coding exon sequence in a non-coding transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: clone_end
owl:Class.obo:def: A read from an end of the clone sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A read from an end of the clone sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: point_centromere
owl:Class.obo:def: A point centromere is a relatively small centromere (about 125 bp DNA) in discrete sequence, found in some yeast including S. cerevisiae.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A point centromere is a relatively small centromere (about 125 bp DNA) in discrete sequence, found in some yeast including S. cerevisiae.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regional_centromere
owl:Class.obo:def: A regional centromere is a large modular centromere found in fission yeast and higher eukaryotes. It consist of a central core region flanked by inverted inner and outer repeat regions.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regional centromere is a large modular centromere found in fission yeast and higher eukaryotes. It consist of a central core region flanked by inverted inner and outer repeat regions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regional_centromere_central_core
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved region within the central region of a modular centromere, where the kinetochore is formed.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved region within the central region of a modular centromere, where the kinetochore is formed.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: centromeric_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: A repeat region found within the modular centromere.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A repeat region found within the modular centromere.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regional_centromere_inner_repeat_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The inner inverted repeat region of a modular centromere and part of the central core surrounding a non-conserved central region. This region is adjacent to the central core, on each chromosome arm.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The inner inverted repeat region of a modular centromere and part of the central core surrounding a non-conserved central region. This region is adjacent to the central core, on each chromosome arm.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regional_centromere_outer_repeat_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The heterochromatic outer repeat region of a modular centromere. These repeats exist in tandem arrays on both chromosome arms.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The heterochromatic outer repeat region of a modular centromere. These repeats exist in tandem arrays on both chromosome arms.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tasiRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence of a 21 nucleotide double stranded, polyadenylated non coding RNA, transcribed from the TAS gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence of a 21 nucleotide double stranded, polyadenylated non coding RNA, transcribed from the TAS gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tasiRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding a tasiRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding a tasiRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: increased_polyadenylation_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript processing variant whereby polyadenylation of the encoded transcript is increased with respect to the reference.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Term requested by M. Dumontier, June 1 2011.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript processing variant whereby polyadenylation of the encoded transcript is increased with respect to the reference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: decreased_polyadenylation_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript processing variant whereby polyadenylation of the encoded transcript is decreased with respect to the reference.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Term requested by M. Dumontier, June 1 2011.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript processing variant whereby polyadenylation of the encoded transcript is decreased with respect to the reference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DDB_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved polypeptide motif that mediates protein-protein interaction and defines adaptor proteins for DDB1/cullin 4 ubiquitin ligases.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Note: PMID:18794354 describes the DDB box, and has lots of alignments, but doesn't actually come out with a consensus sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved polypeptide motif that mediates protein-protein interaction and defines adaptor proteins for DDB1/cullin 4 ubiquitin ligases.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: destruction_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved polypeptide motif that can be recognized by both Fizzy/Cdc20- and FZR/Cdh1-activated anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C) and targets a protein for ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the APC/C. The consensus sequence is RXXLXXXXN.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved polypeptide motif that can be recognized by both Fizzy/Cdc20- and FZR/Cdh1-activated anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C) and targets a protein for ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the APC/C. The consensus sequence is RXXLXXXXN.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ER_retention_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A C-terminal tetrapeptide motif that mediates retention of a protein in (or retrieval to) the endoplasmic reticulum. In mammals the sequence is KDEL, and in fungi HDEL or DDEL.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A C-terminal tetrapeptide motif that mediates retention of a protein in (or retrieval to) the endoplasmic reticulum. In mammals the sequence is KDEL, and in fungi HDEL or DDEL.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: KEN_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved polypeptide motif that can be recognized by FZR/Cdh1-activated anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C) and targets a protein for ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the APC/C. The consensus sequence is KENXXXN.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved polypeptide motif that can be recognized by FZR/Cdh1-activated anaphase-promoting complex/cyclosome (APC/C) and targets a protein for ubiquitination and subsequent degradation by the APC/C. The consensus sequence is KENXXXN.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mitochondrial_targeting_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the mitochondrion.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the mitochondrion.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: signal_anchor
owl:Class.obo:def: A signal sequence that is not cleaved from the polypeptide. Anchors a Type II membrane protein to the membrane.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A signal sequence that is not cleaved from the polypeptide. Anchors a Type II membrane protein to the membrane.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: PIP_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A polypeptide region that mediates binding to PCNA. The consensus sequence is QXX(hh)XX(aa), where (h) denotes residues with moderately hydrophobic side chains and (a) denotes residues with highly hydrophobic aromatic side chains.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A polypeptide region that mediates binding to PCNA. The consensus sequence is QXX(hh)XX(aa), where (h) denotes residues with moderately hydrophobic side chains and (a) denotes residues with highly hydrophobic aromatic side chains.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: phosphorylation_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A post-translationally modified region in which residues of the protein are modified by phosphorylation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A post-translationally modified region in which residues of the protein are modified by phosphorylation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transmembrane_helix
owl:Class.obo:def: A region that traverses the lipid bilayer and adopts a helical secondary structure.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region that traverses the lipid bilayer and adopts a helical secondary structure.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: vacuolar_sorting_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the vacuole.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A polypeptide region that targets a polypeptide to the vacuole.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inframe
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a sequence that contains a mutation involving the deletion or insertion of one or more bases, where this number is divisible by 3.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a sequence that contains a mutation involving the deletion or insertion of one or more bases, where this number is divisible by 3.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: protein_altering_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant which is predicted to change the protein encoded in the coding sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variant which is predicted to change the protein encoded in the coding sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: synonymous_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant where there is no resulting change to the encoded amino acid.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: EBI term: Synonymous SNPs - In coding sequence, not resulting in an amino acid change (i.e. silent mutation).nThis term is sometimes used synonomously with the more general term 'silent mutation', although a silent mutation may occur in non coding sequence. The best practice is to annotate to the most specific term.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: coding-synon
A sequence variant where there is no resulting change to the encoded amino acid.
VAAST:synonymous_codon
ANNOVAR:synonymous SNV
snpEff:SYNONYMOUS_CODING

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inframe_indel
owl:Class.obo:def: A coding sequence variant where the change does not alter the frame of the transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A coding sequence variant where the change does not alter the frame of the transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inframe_insertion
owl:Class.obo:def: An inframe non synonymous variant that inserts bases into in the coding sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snpEFF:CODON_INSERTION
An inframe non synonymous variant that inserts bases into in the coding sequence.
ANNOVAR:nonframeshift insertion

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inframe_deletion
owl:Class.obo:def: An inframe non synonymous variant that deletes bases from the coding sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: ANNOVAR:nonframeshift deletion
An inframe non synonymous variant that deletes bases from the coding sequence.
snpEff:CODON_DELETION

owl:Class.rdfs:label: conservative_inframe_insertion
owl:Class.obo:def: An inframe increase in cds length that inserts one or more codons into the coding sequence between existing codons.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An inframe increase in cds length that inserts one or more codons into the coding sequence between existing codons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: disruptive_inframe_insertion
owl:Class.obo:def: An inframe increase in cds length that inserts one or more codons into the coding sequence within an existing codon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An inframe increase in cds length that inserts one or more codons into the coding sequence within an existing codon.
snpEff:CODON_CHANGE_PLUS_CODON_INSERTION

owl:Class.rdfs:label: conservative_inframe_deletion
owl:Class.obo:def: An inframe decrease in cds length that deletes one or more entire codons from the coding sequence but does not change any remaining codons.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An inframe decrease in cds length that deletes one or more entire codons from the coding sequence but does not change any remaining codons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: disruptive_inframe_deletion
owl:Class.obo:def: An inframe decrease in cds length that deletes bases from the coding sequence starting within an existing codon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snpEff:CODON_CHANGE_PLUS_CODON_DELETION
An inframe decrease in cds length that deletes bases from the coding sequence starting within an existing codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_read
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequencer read of an mRNA substrate.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Bayer Cropscience June, 2011.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequencer read of an mRNA substrate.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: genomic_DNA_read
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequencer read of a genomic DNA substrate.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequencer read of a genomic DNA substrate.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_contig
owl:Class.obo:def: A contig composed of mRNA_reads.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Bayer Cropscience June, 2011.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A contig composed of mRNA_reads.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: AFLP_fragment
owl:Class.obo:def: A PCR product obtained by applying the AFLP technique, based on a restriction enzyme digestion of genomic DNA and an amplification of the resulting fragments.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Bayer Cropscience June, 2011.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A PCR product obtained by applying the AFLP technique, based on a restriction enzyme digestion of genomic DNA and an amplification of the resulting fragments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: protein_hmm_match
owl:Class.obo:def: A match to a protein HMM such as pfam.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A match to a protein HMM such as pfam.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: immunoglobulin_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of immunoglobulin sequence, either constant or variable.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of immunoglobulin sequence, either constant or variable.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: V_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The variable region of an immunoglobulin polypeptide sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The variable region of an immunoglobulin polypeptide sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: C_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The constant region of an immunoglobulin polypeptide sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The constant region of an immunoglobulin polypeptide sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: N_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Extra nucleotides inserted between rearranged immunoglobulin segments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Extra nucleotides inserted between rearranged immunoglobulin segments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: S_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The switch region of immunoglobulin heavy chains; it is involved in the rearrangement of heavy chain DNA leading to the expression of a different immunoglobulin classes from the same B-cell.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The switch region of immunoglobulin heavy chains; it is involved in the rearrangement of heavy chain DNA leading to the expression of a different immunoglobulin classes from the same B-cell.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mobile_element_insertion
owl:Class.obo:def: A kind of insertion where the inserted sequence is a mobile element.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of insertion where the inserted sequence is a mobile element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: novel_sequence_insertion
owl:Class.obo:def: An insertion the sequence of which cannot be mapped to the reference genome.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by the NCBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An insertion the sequence of which cannot be mapped to the reference genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CSL_response_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence GTGRGAA, bound by CSL (CBF1/RBP-JK/Suppressor of Hairless/LAG-1) transcription factors.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence GTGRGAA, bound by CSL (CBF1/RBP-JK/Suppressor of Hairless/LAG-1) transcription factors.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: GATA_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A GATA transcription factor element containing the consensus sequence WGATAR (in which W indicates A/T and R indicates A/G).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A GATA transcription factor element containing the consensus sequence WGATAR (in which W indicates A/T and R indicates A/G).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polymorphic_pseudogene
owl:Class.obo:def: Pseudogene owing to a SNP/DIP but in other individuals/haplotypes/strains the gene is translated.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This terms is used by Ensembl and Vega.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Pseudogene owing to a SNP/DIP but in other individuals/haplotypes/strains the gene is translated.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: AP_1_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence TGACTCA, bound by AP-1 and related transcription factors.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence TGACTCA, bound by AP-1 and related transcription factors.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CRE
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence TGACGTCA; bound by the ATF/CREB family of transcription factors.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence TGACGTCA; bound by the ATF/CREB family of transcription factors.
ATF/CRE site

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CuRE
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element bound by copper ion-sensing transcription factors such as S. cerevisiae Mac1p or S. pombe Cuf1; the consensus sequence is HTHNNGCTGD (more specifically TTTGCKCR in budding yeast).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element bound by copper ion-sensing transcription factors such as S. cerevisiae Mac1p or S. pombe Cuf1; the consensus sequence is HTHNNGCTGD (more specifically TTTGCKCR in budding yeast).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DRE
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence CGWGGWNGMM, bound by transcription factors related to RecA and found in promoters of genes expressed following several types of DNA damage or inhibition of DNA synthesis.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence CGWGGWNGMM, bound by transcription factors related to RecA and found in promoters of genes expressed following several types of DNA damage or inhibition of DNA synthesis.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: FLEX_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element that has consensus sequence GTAAACAAACAAAM and contains a heptameric core GTAAACA, bound by transcription factors with a forkhead DNA-binding domain.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element that has consensus sequence GTAAACAAACAAAM and contains a heptameric core GTAAACA, bound by transcription factors with a forkhead DNA-binding domain.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: forkhead_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence TTTRTTTACA, bound by transcription factors with a forkhead DNA-binding domain.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence TTTRTTTACA, bound by transcription factors with a forkhead DNA-binding domain.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: homol_D_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A core promoter element that has the consensus sequence CAGTCACA (or its inverted form TGTGACTG), and plays the role of a TATA box in promoters that do not contain a canonical TATA sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A core promoter element that has the consensus sequence CAGTCACA (or its inverted form TGTGACTG), and plays the role of a TATA box in promoters that do not contain a canonical TATA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: homol_E_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A core promoter element that has the consensus sequence ACCCTACCCT (or its inverted form AGGGTAGGGT), and is found near the homol D box in some promoters that use a homol D box instead of a canonical TATA sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A core promoter element that has the consensus sequence ACCCTACCCT (or its inverted form AGGGTAGGGT), and is found near the homol D box in some promoters that use a homol D box instead of a canonical TATA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: HSE
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element that consists of at least three copies of the pentanucleotide NGAAN, bound by the heat shock transcription factor HSF.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element that consists of at least three copies of the pentanucleotide NGAAN, bound by the heat shock transcription factor HSF.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: iron_repressed_GATA_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A GATA promoter element with consensus sequence WGATAA, found in promoters of genes repressed in the presence of iron.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The synonym IDP (GATA) is found in an annotation but un-traced as far as literature goes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A GATA promoter element with consensus sequence WGATAA, found in promoters of genes repressed in the presence of iron.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mating_type_M_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence ACAAT, found in promoters of mating type M-specific genes in fission yeast and bound by the transcription factor Mat1-Mc.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Note that this should not be confused with the M-box that has consensus sequence CATGTG and is bound by bHLH transcription factors such as MITF.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence ACAAT, found in promoters of mating type M-specific genes in fission yeast and bound by the transcription factor Mat1-Mc.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: androgen_response_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-palindromic sequence found in the promoters of genes whose expression is regulated in response to androgen.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-palindromic sequence found in the promoters of genes whose expression is regulated in response to androgen.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: smFISH_probe
owl:Class.obo:def: A smFISH is a probe that binds RNA in a single molecule in situ hybridization experiment.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A smFISH is a probe that binds RNA in a single molecule in situ hybridization experiment.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: MCB
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence ACGCGT, bound by the transcription factor complex MBF (MCB-binding factor) and found in promoters of genes expressed during the G1/S transition of the cell cycle.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence ACGCGT, bound by the transcription factor complex MBF (MCB-binding factor) and found in promoters of genes expressed during the G1/S transition of the cell cycle.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CCAAT_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCAAT, bound by a protein complex that represses transcription in response to low iron levels.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCAAT, bound by a protein complex that represses transcription in response to low iron levels.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Ace2_UAS
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCAGCC, bound by the fungal transcription factor Ace2.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCAGCC, bound by the fungal transcription factor Ace2.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TR_box
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence TTCTTTGTTY, bound an HMG-box transcription factor such as S. pombe Ste11, and found in promoters of genes up-regulated early in meiosis.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence TTCTTTGTTY, bound an HMG-box transcription factor such as S. pombe Ste11, and found in promoters of genes up-regulated early in meiosis.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: STREP_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCCCTC, bound by the PKA-responsive zinc finger transcription factor Rst2.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: stress-starvation response element of Schizosaccharomyces pombe

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence CCCCTC, bound by the PKA-responsive zinc finger transcription factor Rst2.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rDNA_intergenic_spacer_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA motif that contains a core consensus sequence AGGTAAGGGTAATGCAC, is found in the intergenic regions of rDNA repeats, and is bound by an RNA polymerase I transcription termination factor (e.g. S. pombe Reb1).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA motif that contains a core consensus sequence AGGTAAGGGTAATGCAC, is found in the intergenic regions of rDNA repeats, and is bound by an RNA polymerase I transcription termination factor (e.g. S. pombe Reb1).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sterol_regulatory_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A 10-bp promoter element bound by sterol regulatory element binding proteins (SREBPs), found in promoters of genes involved in sterol metabolism. Many variants of the sequence ATCACCCCAC function as SREs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A 10-bp promoter element bound by sterol regulatory element binding proteins (SREBPs), found in promoters of genes involved in sterol metabolism. Many variants of the sequence ATCACCCCAC function as SREs.
SRE

owl:Class.rdfs:label: GT_dinucleotide_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: A dinucleotide repeat region composed of GT repeating elements.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: paper:PMID:16043634.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A dinucleotide repeat region composed of GT repeating elements.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: GTT_trinucleotide_repeat
owl:Class.obo:def: A trinucleotide repeat region composed of GTT repeating elements.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A trinucleotide repeat region composed of GTT repeating elements.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Sap1_recognition_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA motif to which the S. pombe Sap1 protein binds. The consensus sequence is 5'-TARGCAGNTNYAACGMG-3'; it is found at the mating type locus, where it is important for mating type switching, and at replication fork barriers in rDNA repeats.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA motif to which the S. pombe Sap1 protein binds. The consensus sequence is 5'-TARGCAGNTNYAACGMG-3'; it is found at the mating type locus, where it is important for mating type switching, and at replication fork barriers in rDNA repeats.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CDRE_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: An RNA polymerase II promoter element found in the promoters of genes regulated by calcineurin. The consensus sequence is GNGGCKCA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An RNA polymerase II promoter element found in the promoters of genes regulated by calcineurin. The consensus sequence is GNGGCKCA.
calcineurin-dependent response element

owl:Class.rdfs:label: BAC_read_contig
owl:Class.obo:def: A contig of BAC reads.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Bayer Cropscience December, 2011.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A contig of BAC reads.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: candidate_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene suspected of being involved in the expression of a trait.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Bayer Cropscience December, 2011.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene suspected of being involved in the expression of a trait.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: positional_candidate_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A candidate gene whose association with a trait is based on the gene's location on a chromosome.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Bayer Cropscience December, 2011.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A candidate gene whose association with a trait is based on the gene's location on a chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: functional_candidate_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: A candidate gene whose function has something in common biologically with the trait under investigation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A candidate gene whose function has something in common biologically with the trait under investigation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: enhancerRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A short ncRNA that is transcribed from an enhancer. May have a regulatory function.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A short ncRNA that is transcribed from an enhancer. May have a regulatory function.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: PCB
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element with consensus sequence GNAACR, bound by the transcription factor complex PBF (PCB-binding factor) and found in promoters of genes expressed during the M/G1 transition of the cell cycle.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element with consensus sequence GNAACR, bound by the transcription factor complex PBF (PCB-binding factor) and found in promoters of genes expressed during the M/G1 transition of the cell cycle.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rearrangement_breakpoint
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a chromosome, where the chromosome has undergone a large structural rearrangement that altered the genome organization. There is no longer synteny to the reference genome.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: NCBI definition: An orphan rearrangement between chromosomal location observed in isolation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a chromosome, where the chromosome has undergone a large structural rearrangement that altered the genome organization. There is no longer synteny to the reference genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: interchromosomal_breakpoint
owl:Class.obo:def: A rearrangement breakpoint between two different chromosomes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A rearrangement breakpoint between two different chromosomes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intrachromosomal_breakpoint
owl:Class.obo:def: A rearrangement breakpoint within the same chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A rearrangement breakpoint within the same chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: unassigned_supercontig
owl:Class.obo:def: A supercontig that is not been assigned to any ultracontig during a genome assembly project.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Bayer Cropscience January, 2012.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A supercontig that is not been assigned to any ultracontig during a genome assembly project.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: partial_genomic_sequence_assembly
owl:Class.obo:def: A partial DNA sequence assembly of a chromosome or full genome, which contains gaps that are filled with N's.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Bayer Cropscience January, 2012.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A partial DNA sequence assembly of a chromosome or full genome, which contains gaps that are filled with N's.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: lnc_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-coding RNA over 200nucleotides in length.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-coding RNA over 200nucleotides in length.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: feature_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that falls entirely or partially within a genomic feature.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that falls entirely or partially within a genomic feature.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: feature_ablation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the deletion, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the deletion, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: feature_amplification
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the structural change, an amplification of sequence, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the structural change, an amplification of sequence, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: feature_translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the structural change, a translocation, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where the structural change, a translocation, is greater than the extent of the underlying genomic features.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: feature_fusion
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where a deletion fuses genomic features.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant, caused by an alteration of the genomic sequence, where a deletion fuses genomic features.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript_translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: A feature translocation where the region contains a transcript.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A feature translocation where the region contains a transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A feature translocation where the region contains a regulatory region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TFBS_translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: A feature translocation where the region contains a transcription factor binding site.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A feature translocation where the region contains a transcription factor binding site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript_fusion
owl:Class.obo:def: A feature fusion where the deletion brings together transcript regions.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A feature fusion where the deletion brings together transcript regions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regulatory_region_fusion
owl:Class.obo:def: A feature fusion where the deletion brings together regulatory regions.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Class.obo:def: A feature amplification of a region containing a transcript.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A feature amplification of a region containing a transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript_regulatory_region_fusion
owl:Class.obo:def: A feature fusion where the deletion brings together a regulatory region and a transcript region.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Class.obo:def: A feature amplification of a region containing a regulatory region.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A feature amplification of a region containing a regulatory region.

owl:Class.obo:def: A feature amplification of a region containing a transcription factor binding site.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcript_ablation
owl:Class.obo:def: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a transcript feature.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a transcript feature.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regulatory_region_ablation
owl:Class.obo:def: A feature ablation whereby the deleted region includes a regulatory region.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Created in conjunction with the EBI.

owl:Class.obo:def: A CDS that is part of a transposable element.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A CDS that is part of a transposable element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regional_centromere_outer_repeat_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript that is transcribed from the outer repeat region of a regional centromere.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: regional centromere outer repeat region transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript that is transcribed from the outer repeat region of a regional centromere.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: feature_truncation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: feature_elongation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that causes the extension of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that causes the extension of a genomic feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: internal_feature_elongation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that causes the extension of a genomic feature from within the feature rather than from the terminus of the feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that causes the extension of a genomic feature from within the feature rather than from the terminus of the feature, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: frameshift_elongation
owl:Class.obo:def: A frameshift variant that causes the translational reading frame to be extended relative to the reference feature.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: ANNOVAR:frameshift insertion
A frameshift variant that causes the translational reading frame to be extended relative to the reference feature.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: frameshift_truncation
owl:Class.obo:def: A frameshift variant that causes the translational reading frame to be shortened relative to the reference feature.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A frameshift variant that causes the translational reading frame to be shortened relative to the reference feature.
ANNOVAR:frameshit deletion

owl:Class.rdfs:label: copy_number_increase
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant where copies of a feature are increased relative to the reference.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant where copies of a feature are increased relative to the reference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: copy_number_decrease
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant where copies of a feature are decreased relative to the reference.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant where copies of a feature are decreased relative to the reference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: bacterial_RNApol_promoter_sigma_ecf
owl:Class.obo:def: A bacterial promoter with sigma ecf factor binding dependency. This is a type of bacterial promoters that requires a sigma ECF factor to bind to identified -10 and -35 sequence regions in order to mediate binding of the RNA polymerase to the promoter region as part of transcription initiation.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Kevin Clancy - invitrogen -May 2012.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A bacterial promoter with sigma ecf factor binding dependency. This is a type of bacterial promoters that requires a sigma ECF factor to bind to identified -10 and -35 sequence regions in order to mediate binding of the RNA polymerase to the promoter region as part of transcription initiation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rDNA_replication_fork_barrier
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA motif that is found in eukaryotic rDNA repeats, and is a site of replication fork pausing.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Midori - June 2012.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA motif that is found in eukaryotic rDNA repeats, and is a site of replication fork pausing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transcription_start_cluster
owl:Class.obo:def: A region defined by a cluster of experimentally determined transcription starting sites.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region defined by a cluster of experimentally determined transcription starting sites.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CAGE_tag
owl:Class.obo:def: A CAGE tag is a sequence tag hat corresponds to 5' ends of mRNA at cap sites, produced by cap analysis gene expression and used to identify transcriptional start sites.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A CAGE tag is a sequence tag hat corresponds to 5' ends of mRNA at cap sites, produced by cap analysis gene expression and used to identify transcriptional start sites.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CAGE_cluster

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of transcription_initiation_cluster defined by the clustering of CAGE tags on a sequence region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: 5_methylcytosine

owl:Class.rdfs:label: 4_methylcytosine
owl:Class.obo:def: A cytosine methylated at the 4 nitrogen.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: N6_methyladenine

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mitochondrial_contig
owl:Class.obo:def: A contig of mitochondria derived sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A contig of mitochondria derived sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TERRA
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts contain G rich telomeric RNA repeats and RNA tracts corresponding to adjacent subtelomeric sequences. They are 100-9000 bases long.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Telomeric transcription has been documented in mammals, birds, fish, plants and yeast. Requested by Antonia Lock, October 2012.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts contain G rich telomeric RNA repeats and RNA tracts corresponding to adjacent subtelomeric sequences. They are 100-9000 bases long.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ARRET
owl:Class.obo:def: A non coding RNA transcript, complementary to subtelomeric tract of TERRA transcript but devoid of the repeats.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Telomeric transcription has been documented in mammals, birds, fish, plants and yeast. Requested by Antonia Lock, October 2012.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non coding RNA transcript, complementary to subtelomeric tract of TERRA transcript but devoid of the repeats.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ARIA
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts consist of C rich repeats.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Telomeric transcription has been documented in mammals, birds, fish, plants and yeast. Requested by Antonia Lock, October 2012.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts consist of C rich repeats.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: anti_ARRET
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts are antisense of ARRET transcripts.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Telomeric transcription has been documented in mammals, birds, fish, plants and yeast. Requested by Antonia Lock, October 2012.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-coding RNA transcript, derived from the transcription of the telomere. These transcripts are antisense of ARRET transcripts.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: telomeric_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-coding transcript derived from the transcript of the telomere.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-coding transcript derived from the transcript of the telomere.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A duplication of the distal region of a chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: TCT_motif

Resembles the initiator (TCAKTY in Drosophila) but functionally distinct from initiator.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: G_box
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A plant specific region.
owl:Class.obo:def: A regulatory promoter element identified in mutation experiments, with consensus sequence: CACGTG. Present in promoters, intergenic regions, coding regions, and introns. They are involved in gene expression responses to light and interact with G-box binding factor and I-box binding factor 1a.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A regulatory promoter element identified in mutation experiments, with consensus sequence: CACGTG. Present in promoters, intergenic regions, coding regions, and introns. They are involved in gene expression responses to light and interact with G-box binding factor and I-box binding factor 1a.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: L_box
owl:Class.obo:def: An orientation dependent regulatory promoter element, with consensus sequence of TTGCACAN4TTGCACA, found in plants.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: I-box
owl:Class.obo:def: A plant regulatory promoter motif, composed of a highly conserved hexamer GATAAG (I-box core).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A plant regulatory promoter motif, composed of a highly conserved hexamer GATAAG (I-box core).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: 5_prime_UTR_premature_start_codon_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is introduced, moved or lost.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Andy Menzies at the Sanger. This isn't necessarily a protein coding change. A premature start codon can effect the production of a mature protein product by providing a competing translation start point. Some genes balance their expression this way, eg THPO requires the presence of a premature start to limit expression, its loss leads to Familial thrombocythemia.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snpEff:START_GAINED
A 5' UTR variant where a premature start codon is introduced, moved or lost.
