owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A consensus AFLP fragment is an AFLP sequence produced from any alignment algorithm which uses assembled multiple AFLP sequences as input.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: nonsynonymous_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-synonymous variant is an inframe, protein altering variant, resulting in a codon change.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: non_synonymous_coding
A non-synonymous variant is an inframe, protein altering variant, resulting in a codon change.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: extended_cis_splice_site
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added by Andy Menzies (Sanger).
owl:Class.obo:def: Intronic positions associated with cis-splicing. Contains the first and second positions immediately before the exon and the first, second and fifth positions immediately after.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Intronic positions associated with cis-splicing. Contains the first and second positions immediately before the exon and the first, second and fifth positions immediately after.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intron_base_5
owl:Class.obo:def: Fifth intronic position after the intron exon boundary, close to the 5' edge of the intron.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Fifth intronic position after the intron exon boundary, close to the 5' edge of the intron.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: extended_intronic_splice_region_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant occurring in the intron, within 10 bases of exon.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Added by Andy Menzies (Sanger).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant occurring in the intron, within 10 bases of exon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: extended_intronic_splice_region
owl:Class.obo:def: Region of intronic sequence within 10 bases of an exon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Region of intronic sequence within 10 bases of an exon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: subtelomere
owl:Class.obo:def: A heterochromatic region of the chromosome, adjacent to the telomere (on the centromeric side) that contains repetitive DNA and sometimes genes and it is transcribed.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A heterochromatic region of the chromosome, adjacent to the telomere (on the centromeric side) that contains repetitive DNA and sometimes genes and it is transcribed.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sgRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A small RNA oligo, typically about 20 bases, that guides the cas nuclease to a target DNA sequence in the CRISPR/cas mutagenesis method.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small RNA oligo, typically about 20 bases, that guides the cas nuclease to a target DNA sequence in the CRISPR/cas mutagenesis method.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mating_type_region_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: DNA motif that is a component of a mating type region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA motif that is a component of a mating type region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: W_region
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.
owl:Class.obo:def: The leftmost segment of homology in the HML and MAT mating loci, but not present in HMR.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The leftmost segment of homology in the HML and MAT mating loci, but not present in HMR.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Y_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A segment of non-homology between a and alpha mating alleles, found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR), has two forms (Ya and Yalpha).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A segment of non-homology between a and alpha mating alleles, found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR), has two forms (Ya and Yalpha).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Z1_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A mating type region motif, one of two segments of homology found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mating type region motif, one of two segments of homology found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Z2_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A mating type region motif, the rightmost segment of homology in the HML and MAT mating loci (not present in HMR).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mating type region motif, the rightmost segment of homology in the HML and MAT mating loci (not present in HMR).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ARS_consensus_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: The ACS is an 11-bp sequence of the form 5'-WTTTAYRTTTW-3' which is at the core of every yeast ARS, and is necessary but not sufficient for recognition and binding by the origin recognition complex (ORC). Functional ARSs require an ACS, as well as other cis elements in the 5' (C domain) and 3' (B domain) flanking sequences of the ACS.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The ACS is an 11-bp sequence of the form 5'-WTTTAYRTTTW-3' which is at the core of every yeast ARS, and is necessary but not sufficient for recognition and binding by the origin recognition complex (ORC). Functional ARSs require an ACS, as well as other cis elements in the 5' (C domain) and 3' (B domain) flanking sequences of the ACS.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: DSR_motif
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Antonia Locke, (Pombe).
owl:Class.obo:def: The determinant of selective removal (DSR) motif consists of repeats of U(U/C)AAAC. The motif targets meiotic transcripts for removal during mitosis via the exosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The determinant of selective removal (DSR) motif consists of repeats of U(U/C)AAAC. The motif targets meiotic transcripts for removal during mitosis via the exosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: zinc_repressed_element
owl:Class.obo:def: A promoter element that has the consensus sequence GNMGATC, and is found in promoters of genes repressed in the presence of zinc.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This element is bound by Loz1 in S. pombe. The paper does not name the element. This term was requested by Midoris Harris, for Pombe.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A promoter element that has the consensus sequence GNMGATC, and is found in promoters of genes repressed in the presence of zinc.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: MNV
owl:Class.obo:def: An MNV is a multiple nucleotide variant (substitution) in which the inserted sequence is the same length as the replaced sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An MNV is a multiple nucleotide variant (substitution) in which the inserted sequence is the same length as the replaced sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rare_amino_acid_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding a rare amino acid is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Request from Uma Devi Paila, UVA. Variants in the sites of rare amino acids e.g. Selenocysteine. These are important impact terms since a loss of such rare amino acids may lead to a loss of function.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding a rare amino acid is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: selenocysteine_loss
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding selenocysteine is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Request from Uma Devi Paila, UVA. Variants in the sites of rare amino acids e.g. Selenocysteine. These are important impact terms since a loss of such rare amino acids may lead to a loss of function.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding selenocysteine is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pyrrolysine_loss
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding pyrrolysine is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Request from Uma Devi Paila, UVA. Variants in the sites of rare amino acids e.g. Selenocysteine. These are important impact terms since a loss of such rare amino acids may lead to a loss of function.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant whereby at least one base of a codon encoding pyrrolysine is changed, resulting in a different encoded amino acid.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intragenic_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A variant that occurs within a gene but falls outside of all transcript features. This occurs when alternate transcripts of a gene do not share overlapping sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Pablo Cingolani, for use in SnpEff.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snpEff:INTRAGENIC
A variant that occurs within a gene but falls outside of all transcript features. This occurs when alternate transcripts of a gene do not share overlapping sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: start_lost
owl:Class.obo:def: A codon variant that changes at least one base of the canonical start codon.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Request from Uma Devi Paila, UVA. This term should not be applied to incomplete transcripts.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snpEff:START_LOST
A codon variant that changes at least one base of the canonical start codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: 5_prime_UTR_truncation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 5'UTR with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snpEff:UTR_5_DELETED
A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 5'UTR with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: 5_prime_UTR_elongation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that causes the extension of 5' UTR, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that causes the extension of 5' UTR, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: 3_prime_UTR_truncation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 3' UTR with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snpEff:UTR_3_DELETED
A sequence variant that causes the reduction of a the 3' UTR with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: 3_prime_UTR_elongation
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that causes the extension of 3' UTR, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant that causes the extension of 3' UTR, with regard to the reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: conserved_intergenic_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant located in a conserved intergenic region, between genes.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Uma Paila (UVA) for snpEff.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: snpEff:INTERGENIC_CONSERVED
A sequence variant located in a conserved intergenic region, between genes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: conserved_intron_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript variant occurring within a conserved region of an intron.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Uma Paila (UVA) for snpEff.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript variant occurring within a conserved region of an intron.
snpEff:INTRON_CONSERVED

owl:Class.rdfs:label: start_retained_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant where at least one base in the start codon is changed, but the start remains.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Uma Paila as this term is annotated by snpEff. This would be used for non_AUG start codon annotation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant where at least one base in the start codon is changed, but the start remains.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: boundary_element
owl:Class.obo:def: Boundary elements are DNA motifs that prevent heterochromatin from spreading into neighboring euchromatic regions.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Antonia Lock.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Boundary elements are DNA motifs that prevent heterochromatin from spreading into neighboring euchromatic regions.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mating_type_region_replication_fork_barrier
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA motif that is found in eukaryotic rDNA repeats, and is a site of replication fork pausing.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Midori Harris.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: mating type region replication fork barrier

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA motif that is found in eukaryotic rDNA repeats, and is a site of replication fork pausing.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: priRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A small RNA molecule, 22-23 nt in size, that is the product of a longer RNA. The production of priRNAs is independent of dicer and involves binding of RNA by argonaute and trimming by triman. In fission yeast, priRNAs trigger the establishment of heterochromatin. priRNAs are primarily generated from centromeric transcripts (dg and dh repeats), but may also be produced from degradation products of primary transcripts.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A small RNA molecule, 22-23 nt in size, that is the product of a longer RNA. The production of priRNAs is independent of dicer and involves binding of RNA by argonaute and trimming by triman. In fission yeast, priRNAs trigger the establishment of heterochromatin. priRNAs are primarily generated from centromeric transcripts (dg and dh repeats), but may also be produced from degradation products of primary transcripts.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: multiplexing_sequence_identifier
owl:Class.obo:def: A nucleic tag which is used in a ligation step of library preparation process to allow pooling of samples while maintaining ability to identify individual source material and creation of a multiplexed library.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A nucleic tag which is used in a ligation step of library preparation process to allow pooling of samples while maintaining ability to identify individual source material and creation of a multiplexed library.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: W_region
owl:Class.obo:def: One of two segments of homology found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Janos Demeter, SGD.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: One of two segments of homology found at all three mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cis_acting_homologous_chromosome_pairing_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A genome region where chromosome pairing occurs preferentially during homologous chromosome pairing during early meiotic prophase of Meiosis I.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: comment: An example of this is the Sme2 locus in fission yeast S. pombe, where is coincident with an ribonuclear complex termed the "Mei2 dot". This term was Requested by Val Wood, PomBase.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A genome region where chromosome pairing occurs preferentially during homologous chromosome pairing during early meiotic prophase of Meiosis I.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intein_encoding_region
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by Janos Demeter 2014.
owl:Class.obo:def: The nucleotide sequence which encodes the intein portion of the precursor gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The nucleotide sequence which encodes the intein portion of the precursor gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: uORF
owl:Class.obo:def: A short open reading frame that is found in the 5' untranslated region of an mRNA and plays a role in translational regulation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A short open reading frame that is found in the 5' untranslated region of an mRNA and plays a role in translational regulation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sORF
owl:Class.obo:def: An open reading frame that encodes a peptide of less than 100 amino acids.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An open reading frame that encodes a peptide of less than 100 amino acids.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tnaORF
owl:Class.obo:def: A translated ORF encoded entirely within the antisense strand of a known protein coding gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A translated ORF encoded entirely within the antisense strand of a known protein coding gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: X_region
owl:Class.obo:def: One of two segments of homology found at all\nthree mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: One of two segments of homology found at all\nthree mating loci (HML, MAT, and HMR).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: shRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A short hairpin RNA (shRNA) is an RNA transcript that makes a tight hairpin turn that can be used to silence target gene expression via RNA interference.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A short hairpin RNA (shRNA) is an RNA transcript that makes a tight hairpin turn that can be used to silence target gene expression via RNA interference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regulatory_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of sequence that is involved in the control of a biological process.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of sequence that is involved in the control of a biological process.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: U14_snoRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: The primary transcript of an evolutionarily conserved eukaryotic low molecular weight RNA capable of intermolecular hybridization with both homologous and heterologous 18S rRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The primary transcript of an evolutionarily conserved eukaryotic low molecular weight RNA capable of intermolecular hybridization with both homologous and heterologous 18S rRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: methylation_guide_snoRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A snoRNA that specifies the site of 2'-O-ribose methylation in an RNA molecule by base pairing with a short sequence around the target residue.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Has RNA 2'-O-ribose methylation guide activity (GO:0030561).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A snoRNA that specifies the site of 2'-O-ribose methylation in an RNA molecule by base pairing with a short sequence around the target residue.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: rRNA_cleavage_RNA
owl:Class.obo:def: An ncRNA that is part of a ribonucleoprotein that cleaves the primary pre-rRNA transcript in the process of producing mature rRNA molecules.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An ncRNA that is part of a ribonucleoprotein that cleaves the primary pre-rRNA transcript in the process of producing mature rRNA molecules.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: exon_of_single_exon_gene
owl:Class.obo:def: An exon that is the only exon in a gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An exon that is the only exon in a gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: primer_binding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: Non-covalent primer binding site for initiation of replication, transcription, or reverse transcription.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Non-covalent primer binding site for initiation of replication, transcription, or reverse transcription.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_array
owl:Class.obo:def: An array includes two or more genes, or two or more gene subarrays, contiguously arranged where the individual genes, or subarrays, are either identical in sequence, or essentially so.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This would include, for example, a cluster of genes each encoding the major ribosomal RNAs and a cluster of histone gene subarrays.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An array includes two or more genes, or two or more gene subarrays, contiguously arranged where the individual genes, or subarrays, are either identical in sequence, or essentially so.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_subarray
owl:Class.obo:def: A subarray is, by defintition, a member of a gene array (SO:0005851); the members of a subarray may differ substantially in sequence, but are closely related in function.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This would include, for example, a cluster of genes encoding different histones.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A subarray is, by defintition, a member of a gene array (SO:0005851); the members of a subarray may differ substantially in sequence, but are closely related in function.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_cassette
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that can be substituted for a related gene at a different site in the genome.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This would include, for example, the mating type gene cassettes of S. cerevisiae. Gene cassettes usually exist as linear sequences as part of a larger DNA molecule, such as a chromosome or plasmid.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that can be substituted for a related gene at a different site in the genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_cassette_array
owl:Class.obo:def: An array of non-functional genes whose members, when captured by recombination form functional genes.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This would include, for example, the arrays of non-functional VSG genes of Trypanosomes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An array of non-functional genes whose members, when captured by recombination form functional genes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_group
owl:Class.obo:def: A collection of related genes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A collection of related genes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: selenocysteine_tRNA_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript encoding seryl tRNA (SO:000269).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript encoding seryl tRNA (SO:000269).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: selenocysteinyl_tRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: A tRNA sequence that has a selenocysteine anticodon, and a 3' selenocysteine binding region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tRNA sequence that has a selenocysteine anticodon, and a 3' selenocysteine binding region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: syntenic_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region in which two or more pairs of homologous markers occur on the same chromosome in two or more species.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region in which two or more pairs of homologous markers occur on the same chromosome in two or more species.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: biochemical_region_of_peptide
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of a peptide that is involved in a biochemical function.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region of a peptide that is involved in a biochemical function.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: molecular_contact_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region that is involved a contact with another molecule.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A region that is involved a contact with another molecule.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intrinsically_unstructured_polypeptide_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A region of polypeptide chain with high conformational flexibility.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: disordered region
A region of polypeptide chain with high conformational flexibility.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: catmat_left_handed_three
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of 3 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+1: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. An extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance would be useful, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. More precisely these two oxygens are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+1.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of 3 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+1: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. An extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance would be useful, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. More precisely these two oxygens are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+1.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: catmat_left_handed_four
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of 4 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i+1: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+2: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+2: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. The extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance is similar, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. In this case these two Oxygen atoms are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+2.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of 4 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i+1: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+2: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+2: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. The extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance is similar, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. In this case these two Oxygen atoms are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+2.

An extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance would be useful, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. More precisely these two oxygens are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+1.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of 3 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+1: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. An extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance would be useful, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. owl:Class.rdfs:label: catmat_right_handed_four
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of 4 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i+1: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+2: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+2: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. The extra restriction of the length of the O to O distance is similar, that it be less than 5 Angstrom. In this case these two Oxygen atoms are the main chain carbonyl oxygen atoms of residues i-1 and i+2.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of 4 consecutive residues with dihedral angles as follows: res i: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+1: phi -90 bounds -120 to -60, res i+1: psi -10 bounds -50 to 30, res i+2: phi -75 bounds -100 to -50, res i+2: psi 140 bounds 110 to 170. owl:Class.rdfs:label: alpha_beta_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A motif of five consecutive residues and two H-bonds in which: H-bond between CO of residue(i) and NH of residue(i+4), H-bond between CO of residue(i) and NH of residue(i+3),Phi angles of residues(i+1), (i+2) and (i+3) are negative.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A motif of five consecutive residues and two H-bonds in which: H-bond between CO of residue(i) and NH of residue(i+4), H-bond between CO of residue(i) and NH of residue(i+3),Phi angles of residues(i+1), (i+2) and (i+3) are negative.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: lipoprotein_signal_peptide
owl:Class.obo:def: A peptide that acts as a signal for both membrane translocation and lipid attachment in prokaryotes.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: prokaryotic membrane lipoprotein lipid attachment site

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A peptide that acts as a signal for both membrane translocation and lipid attachment in prokaryotes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: no_output
owl:Class.obo:def: An experimental region wherean analysis has been run and not produced any annotation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An experimental region wherean analysis has been run and not produced any annotation.
no output

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cleaved_peptide_region
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.
owl:Class.obo:def: The cleaved_peptide_region is the region of a peptide sequence that is cleaved during maturation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The cleaved_peptide_region is the region of a peptide sequence that is cleaved during maturation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: peptide_coil
owl:Class.obo:def: Irregular, unstructured regions of a protein's backbone, as distinct from the regular region (namely alpha helix and beta strand - characterised by specific patterns of main-chain hydrogen bonds).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Irregular, unstructured regions of a protein's backbone, as distinct from the regular region (namely alpha helix and beta strand - characterised by specific patterns of main-chain hydrogen bonds).
coil
random coil

owl:Class.rdfs:label: hydrophobic_region_of_peptide
owl:Class.obo:def: Hydrophobic regions are regions with a low affinity for water.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Range.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Hydrophobic regions are regions with a low affinity for water.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: n_terminal_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The amino-terminal positively-charged region of a signal peptide (approx 1-5 aa).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The amino-terminal positively-charged region of a signal peptide (approx 1-5 aa).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: c_terminal_region
owl:Class.obo:def: The more polar, carboxy-terminal region of the signal peptide (approx 3-7 aa).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The more polar, carboxy-terminal region of the signal peptide (approx 3-7 aa).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: central_hydrophobic_region_of_signal_peptide
owl:Class.obo:def: The central, hydrophobic region of the signal peptide (approx 7-15 aa).
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: central hydrophobic region of signal peptide

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The central, hydrophobic region of the signal peptide (approx 7-15 aa).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_conserved_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A conserved motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) region of biological interest that is conserved in different proteins. They may or may not have functional or structural significance within the proteins in which they are found.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A conserved motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) region of biological interest that is conserved in different proteins. They may or may not have functional or structural significance within the proteins in which they are found.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_binding_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A polypeptide binding motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) polypeptide region of biological interest that contains one or more amino acids experimentally shown to bind to a ligand.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A polypeptide binding motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) polypeptide region of biological interest that contains one or more amino acids experimentally shown to bind to a ligand.
binding

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_catalytic_motif
owl:Class.obo:def: A polypeptide catalytic motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) polypeptide region that contains one or more active site residues.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A polypeptide catalytic motif is a short (up to 20 amino acids) polypeptide region that contains one or more active site residues.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_DNA_contact
owl:Class.obo:def: A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with DNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: DNA_bind
A binding site that, in the polypeptide molecule, interacts selectively and non-covalently with DNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: polypeptide_conserved_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A subsection of sequence with biological interest that is conserved in different proteins. They may or may not have functional or structural significance within the proteins in which they are found.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A subsection of sequence with biological interest that is conserved in different proteins. They may or may not have functional or structural significance within the proteins in which they are found.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: substitution
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence alteration where the length of the change in the variant is the same as that of the reference.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence alteration where the length of the change in the variant is the same as that of the reference.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: complex_substitution
owl:Class.obo:def: "When no simple or well defined DNA mutation event describes the observed DNA change, the keyword \"complex\" should be used. Usually there are multiple equally plausible explanations for the change." [EBI:www.ebi.ac.uk/mutations/recommendations/mutevent.html]

owl:Class.rdfs:label: point_mutation
owl:Class.obo:def: A single nucleotide change which has occurred at the same position of a corresponding nucleotide in a reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A single nucleotide change which has occurred at the same position of a corresponding nucleotide in a reference sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transition
owl:Class.obo:def: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into an other pyrimidine nucleotide, or change of a purine nucleotide, A or G, into an other purine nucleotide.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into an other pyrimidine nucleotide, or change of a purine nucleotide, A or G, into an other purine nucleotide.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pyrimidine_transition
owl:Class.obo:def: A substitution of a pyrimidine, C or T, for another pyrimidine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A substitution of a pyrimidine, C or T, for another pyrimidine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: C_to_T_transition
owl:Class.obo:def: A transition of a cytidine to a thymine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transition of a cytidine to a thymine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: C_to_T_transition_at_pCpG_site
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: C to T transition at pCpG site
owl:Class.obo:def: The transition of cytidine to thymine occurring at a pCpG site as a consequence of the spontaneous deamination of 5'-methylcytidine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The transition of cytidine to thymine occurring at a pCpG site as a consequence of the spontaneous deamination of 5'-methylcytidine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: purine_transition
owl:Class.obo:def: A substitution of a purine, A or G, for another purine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A substitution of a purine, A or G, for another purine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: A_to_G_transition
owl:Class.obo:def: A transition of an adenine to a guanine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transition of an adenine to a guanine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: G_to_A_transition
owl:Class.obo:def: A transition of a guanine to an adenine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transition of a guanine to an adenine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into a purine nucleotide, A or G, or vice versa.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into a purine nucleotide, A or G, or vice versa.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pyrimidine_to_purine_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into a purine nucleotide, A or G.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Change of a pyrimidine nucleotide, C or T, into a purine nucleotide, A or G.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: C_to_A_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A transversion from cytidine to adenine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transversion from cytidine to adenine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: T_to_A_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A transversion from T to A.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transversion from T to A.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: T_to_G_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A transversion from T to G.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transversion from T to G.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: purine_to_pyrimidine_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: Change of a purine nucleotide, A or G , into a pyrimidine nucleotide C or T.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Change of a purine nucleotide, A or G , into a pyrimidine nucleotide C or T.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: A_to_C_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A transversion from adenine to cytidine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transversion from adenine to cytidine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: A_to_T_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A transversion from adenine to thymine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transversion from adenine to thymine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: G_to_C_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A transversion from guanine to cytidine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transversion from guanine to cytidine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: G_to_T_transversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A transversion from guanine to thymine.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transversion from guanine to thymine.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intrachromosomal_mutation
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal structure variation within a single chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal structure variation within a single chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosomal_deletion
owl:Class.obo:def: An incomplete chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An incomplete chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosomal_inversion
owl:Class.obo:def: An interchromosomal mutation where a region of the chromosome is inverted with respect to wild type.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An interchromosomal mutation where a region of the chromosome is inverted with respect to wild type.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: interchromosomal_mutation
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal structure variation whereby more than one chromosome is involved.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal structure variation whereby more than one chromosome is involved.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: indel
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence alteration which included an insertion and a deletion, affecting 2 or more bases.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Indels can have a different number of bases than the corresponding reference sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence alteration which included an insertion and a deletion, affecting 2 or more bases.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: An insertion which derives from, or is identical in sequence to, nucleotides present at a known location in the genome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An insertion which derives from, or is identical in sequence to, nucleotides present at a known location in the genome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A continuous nucleotide sequence is inverted in the same position.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: inversion
A continuous nucleotide sequence is inverted in the same position.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosomal_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: An extra chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An extra chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intrachromosomal_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: A duplication that occurred within a chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A duplication that occurred within a chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: direct_tandem_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: A tandem duplication where the individual regions are in the same orientation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tandem duplication where the individual regions are in the same orientation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inverted_tandem_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: A tandem duplication where the individual regions are not in the same orientation.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A tandem duplication where the individual regions are not in the same orientation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: intrachromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome structure variation whereby a transposition occurred within a chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome structure variation whereby a transposition occurred within a chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: compound_chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome structure variant where a monocentric element is caused by the fusion of two chromosome arms.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome structure variant where a monocentric element is caused by the fusion of two chromosome arms.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: Robertsonian_fusion
owl:Class.obo:def: A non reciprocal translocation whereby the participating chromosomes break at their centromeres and the long arms fuse to form a single chromosome with a single centromere.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non reciprocal translocation whereby the participating chromosomes break at their centromeres and the long arms fuse to form a single chromosome with a single centromere.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosomal_translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: An interchromosomal mutation. Rearrangements that alter the pairing of telomeres are classified as translocations.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An interchromosomal mutation. Rearrangements that alter the pairing of telomeres are classified as translocations.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: ring_chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: A ring chromosome is a chromosome whose arms have fused together to form a ring, often with the loss of the ends of the chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A ring chromosome is a chromosome whose arms have fused together to form a ring, often with the loss of the ends of the chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: pericentric_inversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal inversion that includes the centromere.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal inversion that includes the centromere.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: paracentric_inversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal inversion that does not include the centromere.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal inversion that does not include the centromere.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: reciprocal_chromosomal_translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal translocation with two breaks; two chromosome segments have simply been exchanged.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal translocation with two breaks; two chromosome segments have simply been exchanged.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variation_affecting_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: Any change in mature, spliced and processed, RNA that results from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing partially characterised change in transcript
mutation causing uncharacterised change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing partially characterised change in transcript
sequence variant causing uncharacterised change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Any change in mature, spliced and processed, RNA that results from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_no_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: No effect on the state of the RNA.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect. Also as there is not change, it is not a good ontological term.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing no change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing no change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: No effect on the state of the RNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variation_affecting_coding_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: Any of the amino acid coding triplets of a gene are affected by the DNA mutation.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Any of the amino acid coding triplets of a gene are affected by the DNA mutation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_initiator_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The DNA mutation changes, usually destroys, the first coding triplet of a gene. Usually prevents translation although another initiator codon may be used.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing initiator codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing initiator codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The DNA mutation changes, usually destroys, the first coding triplet of a gene. Usually prevents translation although another initiator codon may be used.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_amino_acid_coding_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The DNA mutation affects the amino acid coding sequence of a gene; this region includes both the initiator and terminator codons.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutaton causing amino acid coding codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing amino acid coding codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The DNA mutation affects the amino acid coding sequence of a gene; this region includes both the initiator and terminator codons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_synonymous_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The changed codon has the same translation product as the original codon.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing synonymous codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing synonymous codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The changed codon has the same translation product as the original codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_non_synonymous_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A DNA point mutation that causes a substitution of an amino acid by an other.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing non synonymous codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing non synonymous codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A DNA point mutation that causes a substitution of an amino acid by an other.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_missense_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The nucleotide change in the codon leads to a new codon coding for a new amino acid.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing missense codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing missense codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The nucleotide change in the codon leads to a new codon coding for a new amino acid.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_conservative_missense_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: The amino acid change following from the codon change does not change the gross properties (size, charge, hydrophobicity) of the amino acid at that position.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The exact rules need to be stated, a common set of rules can be derived from e.g. BLOSUM62 amino acid distance matrix.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing conservative missense codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing conservative missense codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The amino acid change following from the codon change does not change the gross properties (size, charge, hydrophobicity) of the amino acid at that position.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_nonconservative_missense_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: The amino acid change following from the codon change changes the gross properties (size, charge, hydrophobicity) of the amino acid in that position.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: The exact rules need to be stated, a common set of rules can be derived from e.g. BLOSUM62 amino acid distance matrix.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing nonconservative missense codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing nonconservative missense codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The amino acid change following from the codon change changes the gross properties (size, charge, hydrophobicity) of the amino acid in that position.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_nonsense_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The nucleotide change in the codon triplet creates a terminator codon.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing nonsense codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing nonsense codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The nucleotide change in the codon triplet creates a terminator codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_terminator_codon_change_in_transcript
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The nucleotide change in the codon triplet changes the stop codon, causing an elongated transcript sequence.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing terminator codon change in transcript
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing terminator codon change in transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The nucleotide change in the codon triplet changes the stop codon, causing an elongated transcript sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variation_affecting_reading_frame
owl:Class.obo:def: An umbrella term for terms describing an effect of a sequence variation on the frame of translation.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An umbrella term for terms describing an effect of a sequence variation on the frame of translation.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: frameshift_sequence_variation
owl:Class.obo:def: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, because the number of nucleotides inserted or deleted is not a multiple of three.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, because the number of nucleotides inserted or deleted is not a multiple of three.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_plus_1_frameshift_mutation
owl:Class.obo:def: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the insertion of a nucleotide.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing plus 1 frameshift mutation

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the insertion of a nucleotide.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_minus_1_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the deletion of a nucleotide.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the deletion of a nucleotide.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_plus_2_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the insertion of two nucleotides.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the insertion of two nucleotides.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_minus_2_frameshift
owl:Class.obo:def: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the deletion of two nucleotides.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mutation causing a disruption of the translational reading frame, due to the deletion of two nucleotides.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_transcript_processing
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: Sequence variant affects the way in which the primary transcriptional product is processed to form the mature transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sequence variant affects the way in which the primary transcriptional product is processed to form the mature transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_splicing
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant_effect where the way in which the primary transcriptional product is processed to form the mature transcript, specifically by the removal (splicing) of intron sequences is changed.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variant_effect where the way in which the primary transcriptional product is processed to form the mature transcript, specifically by the removal (splicing) of intron sequences is changed.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_splice_donor
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the splice donor sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the splice donor sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_splice_acceptor
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the splice acceptor sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the splice acceptor sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_cryptic_splice_activation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: A cryptic splice site is only used when the natural splice site has been disrupted by a sequence alteration.
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant causing a new (functional) splice site.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing cryptic splice activator

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant causing a new (functional) splice site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_editing
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: Sequence variant affects the editing of the transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sequence variant affects the editing of the transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_transcription
owl:Class.obo:def: Mutation affects the process of transcription, its initiation, progression or termination.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Mutation affects the process of transcription, its initiation, progression or termination.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_decreasing_rate_of_transcription
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variation that decreases the rate a which transcription of the sequence occurs.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variation decreasing rate of transcription

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variation that decreases the rate a which transcription of the sequence occurs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variation_affecting_transcript_sequence
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_increasing_rate_of_transcription
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variation increasing rate of transcription

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_rate_of_transcription
owl:Class.obo:def: A mutation that alters the rate a which transcription of the sequence occurs.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant affecting rate of transcription

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mutation that alters the rate a which transcription of the sequence occurs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence variant_affecting_transcript_stability
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: Sequence variant affects the stability of the transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sequence variant affects the stability of the transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_increasing_transcript_stability
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: Sequence variant increases the stability (half-life) of the transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sequence variant increases the stability (half-life) of the transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_decreasing_transcript_stability
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: Sequence variant decreases the stability (half-life) of the transcript.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sequence variant decreases the stability (half-life) of the transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variation_affecting_level_of_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variation that causes a change in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variation affecting level of transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variation that causes a change in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variation_decreasing_level_of_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variation that causes a decrease in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: sequence variation decreasing level of transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variation that causes a decrease in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variation_increasing_level_of_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variation that causes an increase in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variation increasing level of transcript

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variation that causes an increase in the level of mature, spliced and processed RNA, resulting from a change in the corresponding DNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_translational_product
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant causing a change in primary translation product of a transcript.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing partially characterised change of translational product
mutation causing uncharacterised change of translational product
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing partially characterised change of translational product
sequence variant causing uncharacterised change of translational product

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant causing a change in primary translation product of a transcript.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_no_change_of_translational_product
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect. Also, as there is no change, this is not a good ontological term.
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence variant at RNA level does not lead to any change in polypeptide.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing no change of translational product
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing no change of translational product

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence variant at RNA level does not lead to any change in polypeptide.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_complex_change_of_translational_product
owl:Class.obo:def: Any sequence variant effect that is known at nucleotide level but cannot be explained by using other key terms.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing complex change of translational product
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing complex change of translational product

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Any sequence variant effect that is known at nucleotide level but cannot be explained by using other key terms.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_amino_acid_substitution
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The replacement of a single amino acid by another.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing amino acid substitution

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The replacement of a single amino acid by another.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_conservative_amino_acid_substitution
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing conservative amino acid substitution
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing conservative amino acid substitution

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_nonconservative_amino_acid_substitution
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing nonconservative amino acid substitution
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing nonconservative amino acid substitution

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_amino_acid_insertion
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The insertion of one or more amino acids from the polypeptide, without affecting the surrounding sequence.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing amino acid insertion

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The insertion of one or more amino acids from the polypeptide, without affecting the surrounding sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_amino_acid_deletion
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The deletion of one or more amino acids from the polypeptide, without affecting the surrounding sequence.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing amino acid deletion

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The deletion of one or more amino acids from the polypeptide, without affecting the surrounding sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_polypeptide_truncation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The translational product is truncated at its C-terminus, usually a result of a nonsense codon change in transcript (SO:1000062).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The translational product is truncated at its C-terminus, usually a result of a nonsense codon change in transcript (SO:1000062).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_polypeptide_elongation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.obo:def: The extension of the translational product at either (or both) the N-terminus and/or the C-terminus.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The extension of the translational product at either (or both) the N-terminus and/or the C-terminus.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mutation_causing_polypeptide_N_terminal_elongation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: mutation causing polypeptide N terminal elongation

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: mutation causing polypeptide C terminal elongation

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_level_of_translational_product
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation affecting level of translational product
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant affecting level of translational product

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant decreasing level of translation product

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutationt increasing level of translation product
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant increasing level of translation product

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation affecting polypeptide amino acid sequence
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant affecting polypeptide amino acid sequence

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: mutation causing out of frame polypeptide N terminal elongation
out of frame polypeptide N-terminal elongation

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mutaton_causing_inframe_polypeptide_C_terminal_elongation
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: mutaton causing inframe polypeptide C terminal elongation

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mutation_causing_out_of_frame_polypeptide_C_terminal_elongation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: mutation causing out of frame polypeptide C terminal elongation
out of frame polypeptide C-terminal elongation

owl:Class.rdfs:label: frame_restoring_sequence_variant
owl:Class.obo:def: A mutation that reverts the sequence of a previous frameshift mutation back to the initial frame.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mutation that reverts the sequence of a previous frameshift mutation back to the initial frame.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_3D_structure_of_polypeptide
owl:Class.obo:def: A mutation that changes the amino acid sequence of the peptide in such a way that it changes the 3D structure of the molecule.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasRelatedSynonym: mutation causing partially characterised 3D structural change
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant affecting 3D structure of polypeptide
sequence variant causing partially characterised 3D structural change
sequence variant causing uncharacterised 3D structural change

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A mutation that changes the amino acid sequence of the peptide in such a way that it changes the 3D structure of the molecule.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_no_3D_structural_change

owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing no 3D structural change

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_transcript_secondary_structure
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant that affects the secondary structure (folding) of the RNA transcript molecule.
