owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_effect
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.nUpdated after discussion with Peter Taschner - Feb 09.
owl:Class.obo:def: The effect of a change in nucleotide sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The effect of a change in nucleotide sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_polypeptide_fusion
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: autosynaptic_chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: An autosynaptic chromosome is the aneuploid product of recombination between a pericentric inversion and a cytologically wild-type chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An autosynaptic chromosome is the aneuploid product of recombination between a pericentric inversion and a cytologically wild-type chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: homo_compound_chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: A compound chromosome whereby two copies of the same chromosomal arm attached to a common centromere. The chromosome is diploid for the arm involved.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A compound chromosome whereby two copies of the same chromosomal arm attached to a common centromere. The chromosome is diploid for the arm involved.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: hetero_compound_chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: A compound chromosome whereby two arms from different chromosomes are connected through the centromere of one of them.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A compound chromosome whereby two arms from different chromosomes are connected through the centromere of one of them.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosome_fission
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome that occurred by the division of a larger chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome that occurred by the division of a larger chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: dexstrosynaptic_chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: An autosynaptic chromosome carrying the two right (D = dextro) telomeres.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An autosynaptic chromosome carrying the two right (D = dextro) telomeres.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: laevosynaptic_chromosome
owl:Class.obo:def: LS is an autosynaptic chromosome carrying the two left (L = levo) telomeres.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: LS is an autosynaptic chromosome carrying the two left (L = levo) telomeres.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: free_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome structure variation whereby the duplicated sequences are carried as a free centric element.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome structure variation whereby the duplicated sequences are carried as a free centric element.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: free_ring_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: A ring chromosome which is a copy of another chromosome.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A ring chromosome which is a copy of another chromosome.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: complex_chromosomal_mutation
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome structure variant with 4 or more breakpoints.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome structure variant with 4 or more breakpoints.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: deficient_translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal deletion whereby a translocation occurs in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal deletion whereby a translocation occurs in which one of the four broken ends loses a segment before re-joining.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inversion_cum_translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal translocation whereby the first two breaks are in the same chromosome, and the region between them is rejoined in inverted order to the other side of the first break, such that both sides of break one are present on the same chromosome. The remaining free ends are joined as a translocation with those resulting from the third break.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal translocation whereby the first two breaks are in the same chromosome, and the region between them is rejoined in inverted order to the other side of the first break, such that both sides of break one are present on the same chromosome. The remaining free ends are joined as a translocation with those resulting from the third break.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: bipartite_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: An interchromosomal mutation whereby the (large) region between the first two breaks listed is lost, and the two flanking segments (one of them centric) are joined as a translocation to the free ends resulting from the third break.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An interchromosomal mutation whereby the (large) region between the first two breaks listed is lost, and the two flanking segments (one of them centric) are joined as a translocation to the free ends resulting from the third break.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cyclic_translocation
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal translocation whereby three breaks occurred in three different chromosomes. The centric segment resulting from the first break listed is joined to the acentric segment resulting from the second, rather than the third.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal translocation whereby three breaks occurred in three different chromosomes. The centric segment resulting from the first break listed is joined to the acentric segment resulting from the second, rather than the third.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: bipartite_inversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal inversion caused by three breaks in the same chromosome; both central segments are inverted in place (i.e., they are not transposed).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal inversion caused by three breaks in the same chromosome; both central segments are inverted in place (i.e., they are not transposed).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: uninverted_insertional_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inverted_insertional_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: insertional_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome duplication involving the insertion of a duplicated region (as opposed to a free duplication).

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome duplication involving the insertion of a duplicated region (as opposed to a free duplication).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: interchromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosome structure variation whereby a transposition occurred between chromosomes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosome structure variation whereby a transposition occurred between chromosomes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inverted_interchromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segment.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segment.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: uninverted_interchromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: An interchromosomal transition where the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An interchromosomal transition where the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: inverted_intrachromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically inverted orientation with respect to its flanking segments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: uninverted_intrachromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the insertion is in cytologically the same orientation as its flanking segments.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: unoriented_insertional_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Flag - unknown in the definition.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An insertional duplication where a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: unoriented_interchromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: FLAG - term describes an unknown.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An interchromosomal transposition whereby a copy of the segment between the first two breaks listed is inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: unoriented_intrachromosomal_transposition
owl:Class.obo:def: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: FLAG - definition describes an unknown.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intrachromosomal transposition whereby the segment between the first two breaks listed is removed and inserted at the third break; the orientation of the insertion with respect to its flanking segments is not recorded.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: deficient_inversion
owl:Class.obo:def: A chromosomal deletion whereby three breaks occur in the same chromosome; one central region is lost, and the other is inverted.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A chromosomal deletion whereby three breaks occur in the same chromosome; one central region is lost, and the other is inverted.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tandem_duplication
owl:Class.obo:def: A duplication consisting of 2 identical adjacent regions.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A duplication consisting of 2 identical adjacent regions.
erverted

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_affecting_gene_structure
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the gene structure.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the gene structure.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_gene_fusion
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the gene structure by causing a fusion to another gene.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence_variant_effect that changes the gene structure by causing a fusion to another gene.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: chromosome_number_variation
owl:Class.obo:def: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A kind of chromosome variation where the chromosome complement is not an exact multiple of the haploid number.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causes_exon_loss
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant affecting splicing and causes an exon loss.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant affecting splicing and causes an exon loss.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causes_intron_gain
owl:Class.obo:def: A sequence variant effect, causing an intron to be gained by the processed transcript; usually a result of a donor acceptor mutation (SO:1000072).
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A sequence variant effect, causing an intron to be gained by the processed transcript; usually a result of a donor acceptor mutation (SO:1000072).

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_cryptic_splice_donor_activation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing cryptic splice donor activation

owl:Class.rdfs:label: sequence_variant_causing_cryptic_splice_acceptor_activation
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: OBSOLETE: This term was deleted as it conflated more than one term. The alteration is separate from the effect.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: sequence variant causing cryptic splice acceptor activation

owl:Class.rdfs:label: alternatively_spliced_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A transcript that is alternatively spliced.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A transcript that is alternatively spliced.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: encodes_1_polypeptide
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is alternately spliced, but encodes only one polypeptide.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is alternately spliced, but encodes only one polypeptide.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: encodes_greater_than_1_polypeptide
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: encodes_different_polypeptides_different_stop
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different stop codons.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different stop codons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: encodes_overlapping_peptides_different_start
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different start codons.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different start codons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: encodes_disjoint_polypeptides
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that do not have overlapping peptide sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that do not have overlapping peptide sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: encodes_overlapping_polypeptides_different_start_and_stop
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different start and stop codons.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: encodes overlapping polypeptides different start and stop

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences, but use different start and stop codons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: encodes_overlapping_peptides
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene that is alternately spliced, and encodes more than one polypeptide, that have overlapping peptide sequences.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: cryptogene
owl:Class.obo:def: A maxicircle gene so extensively edited that it cannot be matched to its edited mRNA sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A maxicircle gene so extensively edited that it cannot be matched to its edited mRNA sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: dicistronic_primary_transcript
owl:Class.obo:def: A primary transcript that has the quality dicistronic.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A primary transcript that has the quality dicistronic.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CDS_independently_known
owl:Class.obo:def: A CDS with the evidence status of being independently known.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A CDS with the evidence status of being independently known.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: orphan_CDS
owl:Class.obo:def: A CDS whose predicted amino acid sequence is unsupported by any experimental evidence or by any match with any other known sequence.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A CDS whose predicted amino acid sequence is unsupported by any experimental evidence or by any match with any other known sequence.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CDS_supported_by_domain_match_data
owl:Class.obo:def: A CDS that is supported by domain similarity.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: CDS supported by domain match data

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A CDS that is supported by domain similarity.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CDS_supported_by_sequence_similarity_data
owl:Class.obo:def: A CDS that is supported by sequence similarity data.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: CDS supported by sequence similarity data

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A CDS that is supported by sequence similarity data.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CDS_predicted
owl:Class.obo:def: A CDS that is predicted.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A CDS that is predicted.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CDS_supported_by_EST_or_cDNA_data
owl:Class.obo:def: A CDS that is supported by similarity to EST or cDNA data.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: CDS supported by EST or cDNA data

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A CDS that is supported by similarity to EST or cDNA data.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: internal_Shine_Dalgarno_sequence
owl:Class.obo:def: A Shine-Dalgarno sequence that stimulates recoding through interactions with the anti-Shine-Dalgarno in the RNA of small ribosomal subunits of translating ribosomes. The signal is only operative in Bacteria.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A Shine-Dalgarno sequence that stimulates recoding through interactions with the anti-Shine-Dalgarno in the RNA of small ribosomal subunits of translating ribosomes. The signal is only operative in Bacteria.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: recoded_mRNA
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence of a mature mRNA transcript, modified before translation or during translation, usually by special cis-acting signals.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence of a mature mRNA transcript, modified before translation or during translation, usually by special cis-acting signals.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: minus_1_translationally_frameshifted
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a translational frameshift of -1.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a translational frameshift of -1.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: plus_1_translationally_frameshifted
owl:Class.obo:def: An attribute describing a translational frameshift of +1.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An attribute describing a translational frameshift of +1.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_recoded_by_translational_bypass
owl:Class.obo:def: A recoded_mRNA where translation was suspended at a particular codon and resumed at a particular non-overlapping downstream codon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recoded_mRNA where translation was suspended at a particular codon and resumed at a particular non-overlapping downstream codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: mRNA_recoded_by_codon_redefinition
owl:Class.obo:def: A recoded_mRNA that was modified by an alteration of codon meaning.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recoded_mRNA that was modified by an alteration of codon meaning.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: recoding_stimulatory_region
owl:Class.obo:def: A site in an mRNA sequence that stimulates the recoding of a region in the same mRNA.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A site in an mRNA sequence that stimulates the recoding of a region in the same mRNA.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: four_bp_start_codon
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-canonical start codon with 4 base pairs.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-canonical start codon with 4 base pairs.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: archaeal_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: An intron characteristic of Archaeal tRNA and rRNA genes, where intron transcript generates a bulge-helix-bulge motif that is recognised by a splicing endoribonuclease.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Intron characteristic of tRNA genes; splices by an endonuclease-ligase mediated mechanism.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intron characteristic of Archaeal tRNA and rRNA genes, where intron transcript generates a bulge-helix-bulge motif that is recognised by a splicing endoribonuclease.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: tRNA_intron
owl:Class.obo:def: An intron found in tRNA that is spliced via endonucleolytic cleavage and ligation rather than transesterification.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Could be a cross product with Gene ontology, GO:0006388.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: An intron found in tRNA that is spliced via endonucleolytic cleavage and ligation rather than transesterification.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: CTG_start_codon
owl:Class.obo:def: A non-canonical start codon of sequence CTG.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A non-canonical start codon of sequence CTG.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: SECIS_element
owl:Class.obo:def: The incorporation of selenocysteine into a protein sequence is directed by an in-frame UGA codon (usually a stop codon) within the coding region of the mRNA. Selenoprotein mRNAs contain a conserved secondary structure in the 3' UTR that is required for the distinction of UGA stop from UGA selenocysteine. The selenocysteine insertion sequence (SECIS) is around 60 nt in length and adopts a hairpin structure which is sufficiently well-defined and conserved to act as a computational screen for selenoprotein genes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The incorporation of selenocysteine into a protein sequence is directed by an in-frame UGA codon (usually a stop codon) within the coding region of the mRNA. Selenoprotein mRNAs contain a conserved secondary structure in the 3' UTR that is required for the distinction of UGA stop from UGA selenocysteine. The selenocysteine insertion sequence (SECIS) is around 60 nt in length and adopts a hairpin structure which is sufficiently well-defined and conserved to act as a computational screen for selenoprotein genes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: retron
owl:Class.obo:def: Sequence coding for a short, single-stranded, DNA sequence via a retrotransposed RNA intermediate; characteristic of some microbial genomes.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Sequence coding for a short, single-stranded, DNA sequence via a retrotransposed RNA intermediate; characteristic of some microbial genomes.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_recoding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The recoding stimulatory signal located downstream of the recoding site.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The recoding stimulatory signal located downstream of the recoding site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_stem_loop_structure
owl:Class.obo:def: A recoding stimulatory region, the stem-loop secondary structural element is downstream of the redefined region.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recoding stimulatory region, the stem-loop secondary structural element is downstream of the redefined region.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: five_prime_recoding_site
owl:Class.obo:def: The recoding stimulatory signal located upstream of the recoding site.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The recoding stimulatory signal located upstream of the recoding site.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: flanking_three_prime_quadruplet_recoding_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: Four base pair sequence immediately downstream of the redefined region. The redefined region is a frameshift site. The quadruplet is 2 overlapping codons.
owl:Class.oboInOWL:hasExactSynonym: flanking three prime quadruplet recoding signal

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: Four base pair sequence immediately downstream of the redefined region. The redefined region is a frameshift site. The quadruplet is 2 overlapping codons.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: UAG_stop_codon_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A stop codon signal for a UAG stop codon redefinition.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A stop codon signal for a UAG stop codon redefinition.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: UAA_stop_codon_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A stop codon signal for a UAA stop codon redefinition.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A stop codon signal for a UAA stop codon redefinition.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: regulon
owl:Class.obo:def: A group of genes, whether linked as a cluster or not, that respond to a common regulatory signal.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A group of genes, whether linked as a cluster or not, that respond to a common regulatory signal.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: UGA_stop_codon_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A stop codon signal for a UGA stop codon redefinition.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A stop codon signal for a UGA stop codon redefinition.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: three_prime_repeat_recoding_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A recoding stimulatory signal, downstream sequence important for recoding that contains repetitive elements.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recoding stimulatory signal, downstream sequence important for recoding that contains repetitive elements.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: distant_three_prime_recoding_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A recoding signal that is found many hundreds of nucleotides 3' of a redefined stop codon.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recoding signal that is found many hundreds of nucleotides 3' of a redefined stop codon.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: stop_codon_signal
owl:Class.obo:def: A recoding stimulatory signal that is a stop codon and has effect on efficiency of recoding.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: This term does not include the stop codons that are redefined. An example would be a stop codon that partially overlapped a frame shifting site would be an example stimulatory signal.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A recoding stimulatory signal that is a stop codon and has effect on efficiency of recoding.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: databank_entry
owl:Class.obo:def: The sequence referred to by an entry in a databank such as GenBank or SwissProt.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: The sequence referred to by an entry in a databank such as GenBank or SwissProt.

owl:Class.rdfs:label: gene_segment
owl:Class.obo:def: A gene component region which acts as a recombinational unit of a gene whose functional form is generated through somatic recombination.
owl:Class.rdfs:comment: Requested by tracker 2021594, July 2008, by Alex.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A gene component region which acts as a recombinational unit of a gene whose functional form is generated through somatic recombination.

owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:label: variant_of
owl:NamedIndividual.obo:def: A' is a variant (mutation) of A = definition every instance of A' is either an immediate mutation of some instance of A, or there is a chain of immediate mutation processes linking A' to some instance of A.
owl:NamedIndividual.rdfs:comment: Added to SO during the immunology workshop, June 2007. This relationship was approved by Barry Smith.

owl:Axiom.owl:annotatedTarget: A' is a variant (mutation) of A = definition every instance of A' is either an immediate mutation of some instance of A, or there is a chain of immediate mutation processes linking A' to some instance of A.
